1.content: It's time to begin the story! Which character will we follow?
1.title: Dovahkiin!

choices: At the Throat of the World with Parthuurnax
11.content:
Name: Jacob
Species: Imperial
Allegiance: Stormcloaks
Armor: Stormcloak Officer Armor
Weapon: Ebony Blade
Powers: Beast Form (Werewolf)
Married to: Camilia Velarius
Lives in: Hjerim, Windhelm.
Most used shout: Dragon Aspect

Where will this story start?
11.title: Character #1

choices: "The Blades want me to kill you."
"Can the Greybeards do anything this time?"
113.content:
Where was that damned dragon? Probably late. Maybe he was dead. Blades did his own job. The snow pelted him like arrows in combat. The wispmother on the way up didn't help Jacob's mood either. Gods, where was he? Suddenly, a dragon roared, and Parthuurnax landed.

"Climb upon me. I cannot explain. Krosis."

Jacob climbed to the old dragon's neck, and flew off. Parthuurnax was first to speak.

"Alduin was not defeated. Not truly. While not having the soul of a dragon, you should have absorbed it. You did not. He is returning, with a new plan. To form an army of dragons instead of letting them roam free. His body and soul are separate, he is ethereal, but commands his comrades. He must be defeated. Do you have anything to say?"
113.title: At the Throat of the World with Parthuurnax

1131.content:
"Wasn't he defeated in Sovngarde," Jacob inquired, ", where could his soul have gone?"

Where is it?
1131.title: "Where are we going?"

12.content:
Name: Valen Nostrus
Race: Dark Elf
Profession: Listener
Armor: Dark Brotherhood set
Weapon: Blade of Woe
Powers: Summon Spectral Assassin


Where do we find him?
12.title: All Hail the Listener!

123.content:
Valen hung from the wall of an Thalmor prison from his hands. He was recently caught after killing a Thalmor ambassador. They stripped him of his armor and weapons, and are trying to make him talk. Then entered two Thalmor justicars.

"Well, Listener. It appears that you've failed your latest and final contract." The justicar said smugly.

Valen grinned, "Maybe you're mistaken. I KILLED your ambassador, and you didn't stop me in time. That's all that matters."

"Quiet," the justicar screamed, "you will die the death of a coward! You! Go get the executioner!"

"Understood," the justicar said as she walked away and left.

The two were there silently when Valen noticed the hatch behind the justicar creak open slightly. A second later, a large tentacle pierced the justicar's chest and killed him. The justicar dropped dead in front of Valen as the hatch opened, and out came...
123.title: In prison

1231.content:
Name: Daedla
Species: Imperial
Allegiance: Stormcloaks
Armor: Miraak's Robes
Weapon: Miraak's Sword
Powers: Beast Form (Werewolf)
Married to: Camilia Velarius
Lives in: Hjerim, Windhelm.
Most used shout: Dragon Aspect
---------------------------------------------
Daedla pushed the hatch opened and stepped out in front of Valen.

"So you're the Listener..." Daedla's smile was hidden behind his mask. "That looks quite uncomfortable, here...". Daedla then searched the dead justicar's body and found the key. As he unhooked Valen from the chains.

"All of your stuff is in that chest. Gear up and let's get out of here." Daedla said.

What happens next?
1231.title: ...Daedla. (My character).

choices: "I want to hire you for a contract."
"I want you to join me on a quest."
12312.content:
I was almost ashamed to have been rescued by a stranger. When you've been in the Dark Brotherhood as long as I have, you get very good at making escapes. Regardless, I quickly equipped my gear, and we began to make our way out of the prison. Being as there were likely dozens of Thalmor here, I told my rescuer that this would require a subtle approach.


I could tell just by looking at him, that subtlety was not his specialty.



Needs to say, I took the lead, sneaking up on any guards we encountered with cat-like tread, and quietly cutting their throats. A few times, we came across a locked door, or a trap. But with my nimble fingers and careful feet, we easily avoided them. There was only one obstacle I couldn't see a way around. We were nearly out of this prison, when we saw the edit to the outside. Unfortunately, it was at the other end of a room full of a dozen Thalmor soldiers, and a couple justicars.



"There's no way past them." I whispered "There's no way we could take them on."


"Leave it to me."


Out of the corner of my eye, I saw my companion changing shape. Before I could register what was going on, a enormous werewolf ran past me, charging into the room with a deafening roar, catching the thalmor off guard. Some of them managed to get off a few shots with some arrows, but they were no worse them pin, pricks for the ferocious beast, as it tore into them sending blood and corpses flying in all directions.


When it was over, thenroom was completely painted with Thalmor blood, and my companion stood in the center of it before changing back to his former self. I had never actually seen a werewolf before, and for brief moment I was shocked, but I quickly wiped it away. When we finally made it outside, I asked "Why did you rescue me?"
12312.title: Valen POV

123122.content:
"You've proven yourself to me. I'll need your help on a...quest of sorts," Daedla inquired, "But right now, we need to leave." Valen nodded his head in agreement and the two made their way out and into the Wolfskull Cave farther down the road. Daedla started a quick fire, and pulled out a map with markings all across it. He could hear the noise of the assassin sharpening and cleaning off his blades.

"Now, before you go on about this quest, how do you know me?" Valen asked curious to the man's knowledge. "I've seen your work, especially the work with that Thalmor Justicar before your capture." Daedla replied. "You know about that," Valen asked. "Well, I'm the one who preformed the Black Sacrament in order for you to kill him. I went right to Nazir, was it, with the coin. You know, saving face." Daedla replied.

Daedla could see the initial shock of the assassin to the information. "Well, can I at least know who you are?"

Daedla set the map down and stood, walking to Valen. He then held out his hand. "I am Daedla." Valen shook his hand half-cautiously. "Valen," he replied. "So what's this about a quest?"

"Oh I can't tell you now," Daedla interrupted, "I we need at least four people with us, for this is a long quest."

Valen leaned back against the cave wall, "Well what's in it for me?"

"Fame, glory, knowledge, and any else you desire. So what do you say?"
123122.title: "I want you to join me on a quest."

1231221.content:
Valentine's considered the offer carefully. He didn't really want to be famous. When you're Listener for the Dark Brotherhood, the last thing you want is for all of Tamriel to know who you are. Glory on the other hand, he already had respect and glory as Listener, but you could never have too much. " Will there be any sort of material reward at the end of this journey? Gold, perhaps?"


Daedla nodded "More than you can count."


That caught Valen's interest. He had made quite a tidy sum of cold during his career, but he had spent a large deal of it repairing the Dawnstar sanctuary. "Alright, I guess I'll go along with this, but it had better be worth my time." Daedla chuckled " Don't worry, it will be, you can count on that. Now, as I said, we need at least four of us, so we must recruit two more companions, a thief and a mage."


"I''ve got a contact in the Thieves' Guild." Said Valen "A Breton by the name of Delvin. Maybe he could help us. If not him, there must be someone there who will."


"And perhaps the College of Winterhold would be willing to loan us one of their best spellcasters." Said Daedla. "So, where shall we go first?"
1231221.title: Quest Accepted

12312212.content:
"I believe a thief is necessary for us to continue." Daedla offered. "So we're heading to Riften?" Valen asked, believing the answer was obvious. "Yes, but we won't need to talk to Delvin to hire this one." Valen was surprised, "Really? I'm surprised that they'd just hand a thief over suddenly for...whatever this quest is." Daedla began to pace around the fire, "The Theives Guild is back in Skyrim. I believe you already know this. But as good as a standard run-of-the-mill thief would be, I have a better candidate." Valen still looked confused, "Still, why are they handing him over to us?" "The Theives Guild happened to corrupt a mercenary in Riften by the name of Jacob, an assassin. I have some ties with him. He may be willing to help. He is connected to the guild, but is more of a...freelance thief," Daedla finished. Valen then stood, "Alright, you better be right. We staying the night here?" "No. It's best to move during the night, attract less attention. You ready?" Daedla said approaching the mouth of the cave after putting out the fire. Valen sheathed his blades and followed, "Let's get going."



The trek across the started with the two men getting on each of the horses and moving through the forests to avoid detection. On the way, Valen had some questions. "So who exactly is this guy," Valen asked. "Well," Daedla began "he was once part of the Companions, the inner circle and everything. But he left, the coin didn't fit his needs. He was...well, is good-natured. However, he needed gold. He joined the Thieves Guild a few years back. I'm surprised you don't know him, with you being with the Brotherhood and all." Valen still had some questions, "Why'd he leave the guild?" "Well, he got bored, left, and went back into mercenary work. Now, when you see him, he may wear a mask and look very sinister. But he's the best thief I know." The next day they arrived in Riften.


Jacob wandered the street on his way back from the Temple of Mara. He breathed in a big breath and released a large sigh. He needed to be sure everything goes fine. He took a detour around back, walking by the secret entrance. Thoughts of bedlam and fishing jobs filled his mind...good times. He walked past Honeyside when he heard something behind him. He pulled out one of his daggers and held it at the ready. "Who's there," Jacob said with Authority. Daedla stepped out of the shadows with Valen behind him. "You seem jumpy," Daedla said. "By the divines, don't do that, Daedla!" Jacob said sternly sheathing his dagger, "what do you want?" "Buisness," Daedla replied simply. Jacob stood silently, "Come on." The group then entered Honeyside, now deserted. "Now what do you want, and who's the Dark Elf you brought along, Daedla?"

Jacob's bio:
Name: Jacob
Species: Imperial
Weapon: Retractable Steel daggers
Armor: Stolen Thalmor Sneaking suit and mask.
Powers: Shadowcloak of Nocturnal, Werewolf.
Sex: Male
Dragon Shout: Whirlwind Sprint
Allegiance: Stormcloak
12312212.title: Riften

13.content:
Name: Volgern
Race: Nord
Allegiance: Empire
Armor: Dawnguard heavy armor
Weapon: enchanted steel greatsword(shock)
Power: beastform
Profession: mercenary

Where does the story start?
13.title: Character #3

131.content: Volgern sat at a table within the Nightgate Inn. He had just completed a successful job and was now rewarding himself with a bit of mead. The inn was pretty deserted, it was just him and the barkeep. Volgern sat there, continuing to drink when the door opened and...
131.title: In an inn

1311.content:
Name: Jacob
Race: Imperial
Allegiance: Stormcloak
Armor: Blades armor and the Helm of Yngol.
Weapons: Blades Sword, Enhanced Dwarven Crossbow, Lightning Bolt, Mace of Molag Bal.
Powers: Strife of Nocturnal, Beast Form
Profession: Demon Hunter

~~~

Jacob pushed the door of the Nightgate inn open. Was supposed to meet a client around here tomorrow, so he decided to take a room in the inn. Jacob noticed a man in large armor also sitting alone at one of the tables. Jacob didn't pay much attention to him and approached the barkeeper. He didn't even have to exchange words with the man as he pushed a key forward and jerked his head to the direction of the stairs. Jacob nodded and walked down them.

What happens next?
1311.title: ...[Character's Name] entered.

choices: ....risk it, I might be wrong about him being an assassin"
.....go back to my table and wait to see if anyone else arrives."
13111.content:
Volgern noted the man going down the stairs with more than passing interest. He could tell the man had the beastblood,
as he did, simply by his smell.Even though it was none of his business,Volgern was curious about the man's intentions, and how the innkeeper knew to give the man a key, without either of them saying a word to each other. "Perhaps the man is an assassin." Volgern quietly said to himself. "No, he would have worn more subtle armor than that." "But what if it's a disguise?...."Against his better judgement, Volgern followed the man down,aware that the man might not appreciate being followed.Volgern grew wary, for though the man had to know he was being followed,(after all,Volgern' s boots were making a lot of noise.) he gave no indication of noticing Volgern behind him. Just as Volgern was about to call to the man, he entered his room. "Now what." Volgern said to himself,"I can't just barge in there, that might prove disastrous." " But what if he is an assassin? I might be interrupting his job. Hmmm......." "All right, I'm going to..........
13111.title: Volgern follows him

131111.content:
Without a second thought, Volgern pushed the door open to the room and moves in.

~~~

Jacob lunged forward at the slightest indication of the door opening and buried the crossbow bolt into the man's lower left stomach. Jacob knew all he had to do was hit him with that bolt. A Nightingale named Karliah had given him a special paralysis poison. Keeps the target alive and conscious, but unable to move. Jacob watched as the man reeled back and fell back through the doorway. Jacob moved towards the body slowly, watching it twitch at random moments. When Jacob was standing right above him, his face changed from it's expressionless notion to one of disappointment and shock.

"Dang it!" Jacob said quite loudly. "Everything alright down there?" He heard the barkeeper yelling. "Just fine." Jacob replied. Jacob paced for a minute or two, stopped, looked back at Volgern, and let out a sigh. Jacob moved over him and threw him over his shoulder and walked with him toward a back exit. Jacob opened it as it led to the forest. Jacob set the man down for a moment and felt his body begin changing. Fur grew across, muscles filled his body, and his senses sharpened. He let out the howl of a werewolf and now looked down at the man. He carefully placed his jaw around him and carried him that way. 'Urgh....Disgusting..' Jacob thought as he ran with this man in his jaw until he reached a cave. He laid the man down and changed back. Jacob started a quick fire, then approached the man and sat him upright. "Now, if you're as tough as I think you are, you can talk, but that paralysis is still gonna prevent you from moving. Now, who are you?"

What happens next?
131111.title: ....risk it, I might be wrong about him being a...

choices: Jacob says nothing, thinking about what to do
1311111.content:
Volgern sat quietly for a moment, surveying his surroundings. He was in a cave,and as far as he could tell,it was still night.He was sitting down,and,for some reason,could not move. 'Well I guess me still being alive proves he is not an assassin, but why can't I move?' Volgern thought. 'What happened? I remember opening the door, and getting hit by a bolt, but past that everything is a blur.' Realizing that the man might not have much patience, he finally said, "Well, I guess there's no reason to lie to you. My name is Volgern,and I'm assuming you aren't very pleased with the fact that I messed up whatever you were doing." Volgern waited, wondering if the man would answer his next question." So,if it's not too much trouble,who are you, and what were you doing?" Volgern realized he might have made a mistake, as he was in no position to ask anything right now.
Realizing that he might be able to shake off the paralysis if he could change to beastform Volgern tensed, just in case the man didn't like him asking questions about him.
1311111.title: interesting turn of events

13111111.content:
Jacob pulled the blade away and stood up. "Really? That's pretty gusty to start asking questions with a blade at your throat. But very well, I am Jacob. I work with a few of the temples nearby to help cast away Daedra, vampires or the undead. If you're confused on why you can't move, I got you on a fairly potent paralysis poison. Hm, won't be long now..."

What happens next?
13111111.title: Jacob responds

choices: ....he was imagining things. go back inside
131111112.content:
Considering what Jacob told him, Volgern decided, after making some conclusions, to continue with his last question asked. "So why were you waiting in that room?" Volgern asked, though already guessing the answer. Daedra wouldn't stop at an inn, and undead would have never gotten away from its summoner,and necromancy was allowed, if still looked down upon, so it was unlikely Jacob was hunting a necromancer. Before Jacob could respond, Volgern snapped his head toward the entrance to the cave. Due to his common(and recent) transformations, Volgern still had the sharpened senses of a werewolf, and he was certain he had heard footsteps outside. Volgern, hoping he wasn't making a bad decision, quickly changed to beastform, and moved to the entrance to the cave.

Looking around, Volgern decided.......
131111112.title: questions and a transformation

choices: Group of Vigilants of Stendarr, and they see Volgern.
1311111122.content: What did Volgern see outside the cave?
1311111122.title: something else

13111111222.content: Volgern then saw that passing outside the cave were three Vigilants. One had a mace, the other the same but with a flame spell, and the other with a silver sword. Volgern was ready to run, but the Vigilants already spotted him and were pulling out their weapons. Volgern was ready to strike when Jacob stepped in between them. "Back off," Jacob warned them. "It's a beast! What do you expect us to do?" Jacob approached the Vigilant and said, "I expect you to walk away. I'm testing on this one so we may better understand them. Kill it and my research is gone. How would a reputation like that hold in the Vigilants of Stendarr?" The vigilant was obviously angered but turned and had the others follow. Jacob turned back to Volgern and suddenly kneed him in the gut. Jacob bent down on one knee next to him, "Next time don't be so reckless, or else...Now come on." He grabbed one of Volgern's gigantic arms and helped him back into the cave. "Now I need to know, were you ever part of the Companions?"
13111111222.title: Group of Vigilants of Stendarr, and they see Vo...

choices: Jacob answers after a short pause
The Vigilants return, with more people
131111112221.content:
Volgern, considering that Jacob had helped stop the needless bloodshed that would have followed if the Vigilants attacked, answered immediately. "Yes I was a part of the Companions, for three years. But after I joined the Dawnguard, I started coming back to Jorrvaskr less and less. Eventually, I stopped reporting to them at all, because I was so busy with missions from Isran. After I finally had time for things other than vampire slaying, Kodlak had already been killed, and, since I wasn't there to help him, I wasn't allowed to even enter Jorrvaskr at all."
Volgern sat, watching Jacob think about what he had said. Volgern wondered if Jacob was also part of the Companions, since he knew he was a werewolf as well, for it was rare for a werewolf who was not a Companion to not become completely feral. "Are you part of the Companions?" Volgern asked after a couple minutes, breaking the silence. He was curious, especially since he never remembered seeing Jacob at Jorrvaskr.
131111112221.title: Volgern's response

1311111122211.content: Jacob shook his head and thought to himself if he could be trusted. He let out a long stressed sigh and looked up at Volgern. "No. I wasn't a Companion. In fact, I should be a feral werewolf at this very moment. The only thing keeping that bond is this ring." Jacob held the ring forward, fused into his finger and had a carved wolf's head on it. "This helps me control...sometimes. Sometimes the beast calls me and I can't control it. I thought about joining up with them, but that would just be because of the fact I'm a werewolf. And I wasn't risking my life for that. So I try to dedicate the rest of myself to ridding demons like that. Maybe I could find retribution..." Jacob said, finishing it off with a long sigh. Jacob peered outside and...
1311111122211.title: Jacob answers after a short pause

choices: Volgern explains why (part of Volgern's backstory)
13111111222111.content:
Volgern noticed a few members of the Dawnguard walking past at the same time Jacob did, and, hoping Jacob didn't mind, called out for them to join him and Jacob. Recognizing the group's apparent leader, Volgern called him out by name. "Reltar,out on the hunt again?" Reltar, ignoring Volgern's greeting, eyed Jacob suspiciously. "Another one of your vampire friends, Volgern?" Jacob turned to Volgern, looking curiously at him. Volgern responded to the look immediately. "He and the rest of the Dawnguard never agreed to my choice to spare Serana. And now they seem to think that anyone I travel with who isn't wearing Dawnguard armor is a vampire."

After examining Jacob for any signs that he was a vampire, as he fully believed Volgern was lying, Reltar accepted what Volgern had said and promptly left.

"I hate talking to him."Volgern said as the group left the cave.
13111111222111.title: the Dawnguard

choices: Jacob responds with some of his own history. such as how he became a werewolf.
Jacob says nothing, considering what Volgern told him.
131111112221111.content:
Jacob, appearing interested in why, looked at Volgern expectantly. "Before the two of us both joined the Dawnguard, Reltar hunted me. He was asked by someone, probably part of the Silver Hand, to hunt down a monster in the forests outside Riften, which,as you can guess, was were I did my hunting. Well one night, as I was looking for something to kill, I spotted his campfire. I thought he was a bandit or something and therefore would be easy prey.
"How wrong I was!. I jumped into his camp to find a warrior in full daedric armor. Suddenly I realized this was no mere bandit, so I start to back off, but unfortunately,he saw me before I could get away. He charges at me with complete abandon, and I, so surprised at this sudden attack, could not get away from it. So he got a solid hit on my chest, cutting a deep gash along my torso. But, after the surprise wore off, I was able to counter his next attack. Eventually, I tore out his eye and was able to escape.
After he found out that I was the reason he had one eye, he never trusted me again. Even going so far as to refuse Isran's order to go with me on a mission, claiming that I was a '" lying, deceitful monster who had no right to still be alive'"
Even now he refuses to treat me with respect. Always expecting, and probably hoping, that I will attack him when we're alone.
131111112221111.title: Volgern explains why (part of Volgern's bac...

1311111122211111.content: Jacob turned and was ready to move down the road again, but stopped after three steps. "I use to be normal person. I lived in Windhelm with Camilia. I would always head out and hunt each night. One night, I was approached by a Daedric Lord named Hircine. He was...impressed, at my work turned me into a werewolf. He started guiding me on my hunts so I could find and take down bigger and larger prey. But I was able to control my form, able to hide it from the rest of the world. Then one day, Hircine returned and led me to a cave where he said game roamed inside. I head in am suddenly taken down by two arrows. A group of hunters pulled me away and placed me at some sorta shrine to Hircine. Then one of them pulled out the this ring." He held his hand up to show the silver wolf ring surrounded by seared flesh. "They gave me this accursed ring so I could be hunted. They threw me out of the cave after the burnt it into my finger. But no matter what now, I'm always gonna be the prey I use to hunt." Jacob turned back and looked at Volgern. "We're not all that different. You know any place that may be more...accustomed to our kind?"
1311111122211111.title: Jacob responds with some of his own history. su...

13111111222111111.content:
Volgern thought about what Jacob had said for a long time before answering. "Well I guess I know a place, but I can't promise they will allow us to stay, or for how long." Volgern said after deciding the best course. "There is a werewolf safe haven of sorts on the island of Solstheim, where werewolves are known to gather. But there's no guarantee that the pack that runs the place would let you stay permanently.
"Or we could ask the new leader of the Companions. I've heard that he allows werewolves to take sanctuary there indefinitely, as long as they respect the rules and help them with work.

"So what do you think, should we take a boat to Solstheim, or see if the Companions will take us in?"
13111111222111111.title: Volgern knows a place, sorta...

131111112221111111.content: It sounded a little too good to be true. He can leave all of his past mistakes behind here and be somewhere helpful instead of being hunted. "The group in Solstheim seems like the best choice." He walked back into the cave (which is where he was living the last few days and collected his gear. "Lead the way."
131111112221111111.title: Go to Solstheim

choices: "Yes, we will allow you to stay. at least for now."
" No, we will not. If Hircine doesn't accept him, neither will we."
1311111122211111111.content:
"Okay,but first we need to stop at the nightgate inn,I left my helm and other items there." After collecting Volgern's items, they set off for Windhelm. The trip was mostly uneventful,the only interesting thing happening was a vampire recognizing Volgern and attacking the two of them. After reaching Windhelm, Volgern convinced Gjalund to take them to Raven Rock and they got to the Island without incident.
"Well, we're here. Let's go, I'll show you the way there."
After travelling there, Volgern stopped Jacob just out of earshot of the sentry guarding the entrance to the cave. "Remember, we're outsiders here so don't expect them to trust or even like you if they let us stay."Volgern warned. "They aren't the most friendly of our kind. Also, you see the guy sitting away from the others? Don't get anywhere near him. He's not a werewolf, but a werebear. And they are much worse than we are at being aggressive and hostile towards everyone."
Walking up to the leader, Volgern bowed in respect to him, and motioned for Jacob to do the same." We have come to respectively ask your permission to stay here with others of our kind."Volgern said to the Majni after he asked what they wanted. "My friend is not particularly in the favor of our Lord Hircine, and hopes to escape the people hunting him. Luckily, we have not seen the Bloodmoon, so Hircine Hasn't called a Great Hunt for him."
"So, will you allow us to stay here?"

Majni replied......
1311111122211111111.title: To Solstheim

choices: Nikolaus is shot with an arrow by an unknown assailant while hunting
Nikolaus sees a group of vampires attack a young woman in the street
A courier from the Imperial Legion
14.content:
Name: Nikolaus Taylor
Species: Imperial
Allegiance: Unaligned, A soldier for hire
Armor: Enhanced Draugr Chainmail Light Armor
Weapon 1: Blue Steel One Handed Long Sword

Where will this story start?
14.title: Character #4

141.content: Nikolaus crept across the forest foliage. He's been tracking a group of elk from Riverwood to somewhere near Falkreath. He held a hand on his sword, which was still sheathed. He crept along until he came across a singular tower, covered in moss and destroyed. He was moving past it when he felt pain arc in his right arm. Nikolaus fell and hit the ground with a loud thud. He then realized he couldn't move, as if his muscles had given up or just shutdown, his entire body loosened. He heard footsteps approach from behind. Nikolaus had fallen on his face when he was hit, so he was staring at the treeline, unable to move his head, but able to move his eyes. The footsteps were above him when...
141.title: Nikolaus is shot with an arrow by an unknown as...

1411.content:
Just when he thought death was about to take him, he heard something hit into a nearby tree with great force.
????: Hey! You!
He then heard the footsteps next to him run off in another direction, getting fainter as he ran. He then heard another set of footsteps getting closer. He was flipped over and now looking up at...
1411.title: An arrow whizzed by. (Character Entry)

choices: Nikolaus wakes up in an alchemy room in Daedla's house
14111.content:
Name: Daedla
Race: Imperial
Gender: Male
Occupation: Stormcloak Officer (Stormblade)
Armor: Stormcloak Officer uniform
Weapons: Daedric Bow, Mace of Molag Bol.
Married to: Camilia Velarius (Living in Hjerim, in Windhelm)
Powers: Strife of Nocturnal, Beast Form.
Most used dragon shout: Call of Valor

------

Daedla stared at the man he was kneeling over.
Daedla: Oh no, well this isn't good...
Daedla grabbed the arrow and yanked it from Nikolaus' arm. He held it in the sunlight and examined it a little.
Daedla: Just what I thought...Paralysis poison. And strong stuff too.
He proceed as he pulled the man off the ground and held him over his shoulder.
Daedla: Let's get going...
He laid Nikolaus across his horse on his stomach and mounted the horse. He galloped a few miles down the road before Nikolaus passed out.

What happens next?
14111.title: (Character #1)

choices: In an Ancient Nord Burial Crypt
151.content:
Name: Vedvenin

Race: Dunmer (Dark Elf)

Allegiance: Imperial Legion, Dawnguard

Occupations: Thief, Tomb Raider, Nightingale, Assassin, Listener, Harbinger of the Companions, Dragon Slayer, Undead Hunter.

Armor: Daedric Armor (Legendary)

Armor Rating: 1323 without a shield; 700 without a helmet (These figures are just to give an idea of physical endurance)

Helmet enchantments: +40% Bow damage, Waterbreathing.

Armor enchantments: +31% Stamina Regen, +62 Health

Gauntlets enchantments: +40% Sneaking, +40% Bow damage.

Boots enchantments: +46% Fire Resist, +46% Frost Resist.

Jewelry enchantments: +46% Frost Resist, +92% Shock Resist (cumulative)

Weapons: Dragonbone Sword of Chaos Flames (Legendary) (x2) - 140 damage/blade, Dragonbone Bow of Chaos Flames (Legendary) - 279 damage + arrow damage, Auriel's Bow - 212 damage + arrow damage, Ancient Nordic Pickaxe (specifically used for mining).


Weapon enchantments:

Dragonbone Sword of Chaos Flames (Legendary) - 31 Fire Damage, 50% chance to inflict 48 points of Fire, Frost, and Shock damage.

Dragonbone Sword of Chaos Flames (Legendary) - 31 Fire Damage, 50% chance to inflict 48 points of Fire, Frost, and Shock damage.

Dragonbone Bow of Chaos Flames (Legendary) - 31 Fire Damage, 50% chance to inflict 48 points of Fire, Frost, and Shock damage.

Auriel's Bow (Legendary) - 20 points of sun damage. Undead targets take triple damage.


Most often used spells:
-Candlelight
-Grand Healing
-Soul Trap

Most frequently used Shout:
-Fire Breath

Powers:
-Ancestor's Wrath (Flame Cloak)
-Black Market: Summons a Dremora Merchant.
-Mora's Boon: Fully restores Health, Magicka, and Stamina.
-Root of Power
-Secret of Arcana: All spells cost no Magicka for 30 seconds.
-Summon Karstaag

Appearance: Pale, blue-gray skin, ruby red eyes, short, white hair, with a few strands forward of her left ear. If you make her angry, a black tattoo composed of intricate lines appears all over her body, centralizing to a dragon-shaped crest on her back, much like the one found on the Imperial flag. Those that do see it, however, usually don't live long enough to tell their friends. On the flip-side, however, if you catch her absorbing a dragon's soul, it appears and glows a gold color.

About: She is usually never seen smiling, and if she does, that either means you've proved your worth to her as an ally, or she has thought of an amusing way to kill you, the latter usually happens to men and women who would like to 'stay the night.'
151.title: Dovahkiin #5

1513.content: Vedvenin walked through the tight corridor of the ruins as the orb of light she summoned hovered around her lighting the path. She moved into one of the larger crypt rooms to see draugr across the ground, killed in various ways. Two of them have bolts sticking in them as the rest have larger slashes in them. Odd that they were already dispatched of, she continued on. As she approached the next corridor, she heard the sound of metal clanking. Approaching slowly, she peered around the corner and saw...
1513.title: In an Ancient Nord Burial Crypt

15131.content:
Name: Jacob

Species: Imperial

Allegiance: Dawnguard, Stormcloaks, House of Telvanni.

Weapons: Blackbow of Fate (Legendary), Dual Blades swords (Legendary), Dual Dragonpriest daggers (Legendary)(Chaos damage of 38, Absorb Health 25), Nightingale Blade (Legendary), Ancient Dwarven Crossbow.

Armor: Nightingale Armor, Nightingale Hood, Nightingale gloves, Nightingale boots, Ring of the Hunt, Bone Hawk Amulet(49% Bow Damage, One-Handed 49%)

Powers: Beast Form, Shadowcloak of Nocturnal.

Most used magic abilities: Thunderbolt, Icy Spear, Incinerate, Conjure Ash guardian, Conjure Dremora Lord.

Profession: Explorer, Mercenary, Hunts Undead, Hunter.

Details: Short black hair, blind in left eye, scars across the left side if his face, wary, intelligent, able to speak to any of the served Dremora (Hermaeus Mora, Mephala, Hircine, Molag Bal, etc.), channels Chi-like energy through himself to remain vigilant. He will try to resolve all situations with as little violence as possible, doesn't mind his sword doing some of the talking.

------------------

His Ancient Nordic pickaxe slammed against the vein if Stahlrim as the ore fell to his feet. The vein ran dry as he picked the ore up and placed them in a knapsack. He moved to head farther into the crypt when he heard something move. The steady force of energy that flowed through him was disturbed. With that he spun around and pulled Nightingale's blade from it's sheath towards the doorway Vedvenin was around. "Who's there?"

What happens next?
15131.title: Dovahkiin #1

151311.content:
"I must admit, I'm mildly impressed," a woman's voice said. Jacob peered over toward the doorway and saw a woman in full Daedric armor. "I hadn't expected you to notice me so quickly. Although I must admit, your aura is rather weak."

"What do you mean 'weak!?" Jacob growled. The woman walked toward him, completely unfazed by Jacob's offensive stance.

"Tisk, tisk, tisk," Vedvenin said, in slight mockery. "You're one to be threatening me with that weak blade." She pushed aside the Nightingale Blade by its edge with relative ease. "Now, before you go threatening me with a toothpick again, a word of advice; if you want to stay alive, keep out of my way."

"Who are you to threaten me?" Jacob asked, angered. "We Stormcloaks will kill each and every one of you Legionnaires!"

"We Stormcloaks this, we Stormcloaks that," Vedvenin said, bored. "If you keep flapping your gums like this, I'm going to murder you like your false king did to Torygg! I'm actually surprised that someone of your quality was able to take on a Draugr Deathlord and live to tell the tale."

"What do you mean 'someone of my quality?" Jacob asked.

"A warrior who uses hatred as a weapon is only second rate," Vedvenin said before proceeding deeper into the crypt.

"Wait!" Jacob exclaimed. "Remove your helmet and tell me your name. I go by Jacob."
151311.title: Vedvenin reveals herself

1513111.content:
She pulled off the Daedric helmet and turned to look at him. Jacob pulled his sword down and chuckled to himself. "A Dunmer, huh? Very impressive. Although I'm a Stormcloak in service to Ulfric, all I want is to grant Skyrim freedom. But, enough about philosophy." Jacob sheathed his sword and was walking past when she stopped him.

"Hold on! What are you doing here?" Vedvenin asked somewhat harshly. Jacob turned and looked back at her, he sighed and pulled the mask on his face down. "Come on," Jacob said, motioning Vedvenin to follow him as he walked down the corridor. Vedvenin, cautious if him, followed him anyway. They stopped on a small balcony like platform that overlooked and entrance to a Dwarven ruin.

"Now, you tell me what kind of Nords put a burial crypt right next to a Dwarven city?" Jacob inquired. He began walking forward and climbed a few rocks leading up to the entrance. He stopped a little of the ways up and turned to Vedvenin. "But I could use some help from someone who can sense my aura? Whaddya say?" He held a hand out to help her up.

What happens next?
1513111.title: Vedvenin removes her helmet.

15131111.content:
"Fine," she sighed, taking Jacob's hand, at which point he helped pull her up.

"You know, you still haven't told me your name," Jacob said once she was standing beside him. He noticed a long, thin scar on her left cheek, almost reaching from ear to mouth.

"I go by Vedvenin," she answered.

"Vedvenin, huh? Sounds like a dragon's name," Jacob said.

"My current name was engraved into the hilt of an ebony sword that my father owned, which supposedly belonged to a very high-ranking dragon priest, which my father gave to his friend, who raised me," Vedvenin said. "It means 'Black Wind Master', or, more accurately, 'Master of the Black Wind."

"That's quite a name," Jacob said. "What's with that scar? War wound?"

"I wish it were that glorified," Vedvenin said, brushing back a strand of hair that was resting on her face. "My parents' house burned down back in Kithendis Falls, over in southern Morrowind. My father barely got me out of there alive, but when he went back in for my mother, neither of them were as lucky. So, I wear this scar to serve as a reminder of my past, to remind me that my life could be taken at any moment, just as I nearly lost it when it had just begun."

"So, you're a girl who lost her family in a house fire," Jacob said. "That would explain your attitude."

"My 'attitude' comes from me not wanting potential allies to become soft," Vedvenin explained. "Now that that's out of the way, what is it you need my help with?"
15131111.title: She follows him

151311111.content:
Jacob continued through the Dwarven Ruins with his new ally. "Reports that both Stormcloak and Imperial squads, including a few civilians disappeared around here. I was sent to investigate. Of course when I found the draugr, I thought that was it. I killed them, but when I was leaving something disrupted my aura. Almost...like it was...calling me y'know?" Jacob laid a hand across the Dwarve's handiwork. "I don't know what, but I think there may be something quite powerful in these ruins."

The two rounded the corner into the next hallway. Jacob stopped and heard noises of mechanical clanking. "Hold up."

"What? Why?"

Then around the corner up ahead came three Dwarven sphere and two Dwarven ballistas. However, these ones seemed to have more armor patched on them. Jacob whipped the Dwarven Black Bow of Fate he had on his back around and pulled a steel arrow back and downed a Dwarven ballista quickly. "Time to fight, Vedvenin!" Jacob yelled pulling out an Akaviri Blade.

What happens next?
151311111.title: Jacob explains.

choices: A room with dozens of Dwemer Spider Guardians.
1513111111.content:
Vedvenin quickly equipped her helmet, drew her own bow, loaded in a steel arrow, and fired at a Balista. Not only did the arrow strike with enough force to detach the main body from the legs, but the fire damage caused the boiler to rupture, causing a brilliant explosion of fire, steam, and metal fragments. She followed up by putting away her bow and drawing her twin dragonbone swords, swung at a Dwarven Sphere Guardian and cleaved it in two. She turned her attention to Jacob, who was being combated by the remaining two Spheres. She at one and plunged her sword into it, releasing a lot of steam and hot water, allowing Jacob to focus on the last one, which was badly damaged, and finish it off.

"Thanks, I guess," Jacob said. "What do you think is with all the armor on these things?"

"Maybe it's to protect something immensely powerful," Vedvenin suggested. "Maybe it's to protect the world against someone who's a danger to us all."

"Well, the way we handled those, they can't possibly be that bad!" Jacob exclaimed. Vedvenin approached him.

"What if those Balistas and Spheres were the last line of defense against said being, hm?" She asked. "There's no telling what lies deeper within. An armored Dwarven Centurian Master. That'd be a fun fight."

They head deeper into the city.
1513111111.title: Vedvenin fights

15131111112.content:
Jacob and Vedvenin entered a large room with three Dwarven heads across the wall. Jacob noticed a set of levers under each of them. In the mouth of one is a grand soul gem, the other a common soul gem, and the last a petty soul gem. Vedvenin walked forward and looked at it. "This can't be that hard, now let's see..."

Vedvenin walked towards the lever underneath the common soul gem head and pulled the lever. Jacob realized that something was wrong. "Get down!" Jacob rushed forward and pushed Vedvenin down as a bolt scathed his arm. "Whoa! You alright?" Vedvenin said getting to her feet. Jacob moved his arm a little, "It's nothing...be careful next time! The dwarves don't take kindly to this stuff." Jacob then saw a note on the ground. He picked it up and open it, "THE STRONG BEFORE THE WEAK"

Jacob looked at the mouths and moved to the one with a grand soul gem and pulled the lever beneath it, them the common's lever, then the final one. The gate opened. "There. Just, please be careful...".

Vedvenin stopped and followed Jacob farther down a corridor.

What happens next?
15131111112.title: A puzzle-trap room.

151311111121.content:
The two of them opened the large metal door to a large, empty room with no way out, and nothing in it.

"I travel all this way, make a bunch of scrap metal, almost get nicked by a Dwemer bolt, and walk away with only a handful of gold and jewels," Vedvenin said, disappointed and irritated. She took off her helmet to make sure she wasn't over-looking anything. "That, and we still haven't found out who or what was behind the disappearances! No evidence of necromancers, vampires, or cultists anywhere!"

"No way forward, either," Jacob sighed. "Damn."

"Who's there?" A dry, weak-sounding male voice asked. Both of the adventurers peered over toward a dark corner, where they saw an elf with bronze skin bound against the wall by thick chains. He was also blind-folded.

"Are you... a Dwemer?" Vedvenin asked.

"How many years has it been?" The Dwemer asked.

"At least a thousand," Jacob said. "If that's the case, then how is it you're still alive!?"

"I looked into the arts of necromancy when I was younger," he said. "Could you please remove this blind-fold? I want to see your faces."

Vedvenin removed the elf's blind-fold, where he just gave her a confused stare. "What kind of elf could you be, miss? Never seen anything like you before."

"I'm a Dunmer," she said.

"Your kind certainly has changed since I last laid eyes upon them," the Dwemer said.

"That would make you over five thousand years old!" Jacob exclaimed. "That's impossible!"

"Not if you're skilled enough in Longevity," the Dwemer said. "Now, would you kindly get me out of these chains? It's been so long since I've last laid eyes upon Tamriel."

"I don't know about this," Vedvenin said.

"I think you're worrying too much," Jacob said. "You know the court mage in Solitude? I hear she's been alive for several hundred years!"

"These circumstances are very different, but okay," she said, drawing her dragonbone swords. She thrust a chain, cleanly severing it from the wall. The Dwemer then reached over and pulled at the other chain, causing it to snap. He walked toward the center of the room.

"Hold it!" Vedvenin shouted. "You're no longer a normal mortal. Even I couldn't break those chains, and I'm one of the strongest people in the world."

"Come here, girl," the Dwemer said. Vedvenin began to walk toward him, but not of her own accord.

"What are you doing to me?" she asked, feeling fear for only the second time in her life. "Release me!"

"Not yet," the Dwemer said as she was near enough to him. "Your soul looks... tasty." Her eyes went wide. He touched the space between her clavicles, and a small, glowing, golden dragon appeared. It looked as if it were bound. "So strong, yet so helpless."

"Let her go!" Jacob shouted, charging him. He smacked the pommel of his Nightingale Blade into the back of the Dwarve's neck, breaking his concentration enough for Vedvenin to fall free of the elve's grasp. The tiny dragon's bonds disappeared, and the dragon itself dissipated. The Dwemer then turned around, grabbed Jacob, and hurled him through the doorway and closed the door without moving an inch.

"Until next we meet, lovely," the Dwemer said. He sprouted dragon-like wings and launched himself into the air, breaking through the rock ceiling. Vedvenin felt an intense burning in her chest, and let out a blood-curdling scream as an inferno engulfed her and filled the room, causing the stone and metal to glow red. A pipe ruptured, releasing a lot of steam. Water began pouring out, creating even more vapor as it cooled any stone or metal it touched. As the inferno died down, and the water was nearly at her feet, Vedvenin passed out.
151311111121.title: The reach the final room.

1513111111211.content:
Jacob laid on his back and opened his eyes to see a door glowing a dim red color. Jacob stood slowly. His back was worst for wear, but he could take it. He was trapped and looked towards the door. "Vedvenin! Vedvenin, you there?" Jacob yelled. No response. "I gotta get in there."

Jacob looked at the wall and saw that the heat still made it weak. Jacob ran to the back of the room and yelled. "Fus, Ro Dah!" The wall had a hole blown in the center as steam and heat poured in.

Jacob was taken back initially, but quickly recovered and ran through it. He saw in the center of the room, he saw Vedvenin passed out on her back as the water was rising. He ran over her and saw her armor glowing slightly. He grabbed her by the back and legs and held her as she burned against the armor slightly. Jacob ran to a wall and used telekinesis to pick up a broken boiler pipe and tossed it through a wall. He ran outside holding Vedvenin, and quickly ran down one of the roads.

Jacob ran for a few minutes until he saw two Stormcloaks walking down the road. One of them had a horse.

"Brother! I need a horse!" Jacob hollered moving towards them.

"Stormblade! It's an honor. As you wish," the Stormcloak answered.

Jacob laid Vedvenin on the horse and jumped on as he rode down the road.

Hours passed until Jacob had reached the cave. He was hidden inside an abandoned bandit camp. A hatch inside the camp led to the cave underneath. Jacob laid Vedvenin down and looked over her wounds. "...That's gonna hurt when she wakes up." Not knowing any healing magic, he bandaged a wound on her forehead and removed the top of her Daedric armor and replaced it with rags. He bandaged the wounds and noticed the dragon symbol on her back. Jacob finished bandaging her back and flipped her over gently and began bandaging the rest of her. Jacob finished bandaging her and placed her armor and weapons in a chest at the foot of her bed. He checked over her from time to time, but rested as well.

What happens next?
1513111111211.title: Jacob wakes up.

15131111112111.content:
"Ugh, my head," she groaned as she awoke.

"What in Oblivion happened in that Dwemer ruin?" Jacob asked.

"I don't remember much, but I do feel like I've been over a giant's fire for several hours," Vedvenin said. She felt a burning, stinging sensation all over her body.

"I don't know, either," Jacob began. "But it sure was hot in there. Oh, and I hope you don't mind, but I've taken the liberty of patching up your wounds."

"Thanks, I guess," Vedvenin said as she cast the Grand Healing spell. She removed some of her bandages. "Where's my armor?"

"It's in that chest over there with the rest of your belongings," Jacob said. Vedvenin walked over to the chest and removed her armor, quickly equipping it. "What's the rush?"

"I''m going to Solitude to talk to General Tullius about having a meeting in Dragonsreach," she said. "You should probably go to Windhelm and speak with Ulfric. Odds are high that the Greybeards won't host another meeting. At least not this soon."

"Last I checked, you're in no condition for combat, let-alone travel! You can't..." he was cut off by a blade suddenly appearing near his throat.

"You don't know me," Vedvenin growled. There were footsteps and conversation above them. Some were laughing. She climbed the ladder and peaked into the camp and saw...
15131111112111.title: Vedvenin wakes up

choices: He remains oblivious to their presence
151311111121111.content: The camp where the bandits were staying was consumed by chaos, bandits lay on the ground dead or dieing. A large Argonian figure strode among the corpses. He wore Daedric armour from head to toe (enchanted to increase his stamina, health and muffle his footsteps) at his waist hung two Daedric swords (fire and frost) and a Daedric bow was secured from his back. He walked among the corpses until he found the bandit chief. The Argonian knelt and began to feed off of the fresh body.
151311111121111.title: Bandits who were losing a fight to dovakiin 6

1513111111211111.content: The Argonian looked up scanning the area around him. Suddenly he stood up raising his two blades "come forth"
1513111111211111.title: He notices vedvenin and Jacob

choices: Eoin finds them/Jacob and Vedvenin reveal themselves
1513111111211112.content:
Jacob had snuck out of the cave with Vedvenin and were hiding by a nearby shack. Jacob peered around the corner holding his crossbow. "He looks Imperial. Recognize him, Vedvenin?" Jacob whispered quietly.

Vedvenin replied, "I haven't seen before."

Jacob peered around the corner as the Argonian ate the corpses. "He's a werewolf. I can smell it on him."

Vedvenin looked over to Jacob, surprised at what he said. "Wait, your a werewolf?"

Jacob continued watching the Argonian, "Don't ask. You think we can trust him?"

Vedvenin looked at him, "Not sure."

What happens next?
1513111111211112.title: He remains oblivious to their presence

15131111112111122.content: Eoin tensed up with a chunk of flesh still in his claws. He tilted his head slightly to survey his surroundings before whispering " Laas Yah Nir" . With that done he stood up and performed a salute. "Hail be ye friend or foe?" Shouted Eoin at the two hiding figures , as he rested a hand on his Daedric sword ,Rune.
15131111112111122.title: Eoin senses them

151311111121111221.content:
Vedvenin cautiously walked out into the open. "Friend. You imperial?" She yelled to him.

"Aye," Eoin replied back.

Jacob walked from the other side of shack, still holding his crossbow but pointing it towards the ground. "Hail, brother of the beastblood."

Eoin nodded his head to Jacob, "And to you as well."

Jacob then asked, "What are you doing here?"

What's Eoin doing here?
151311111121111221.title: Friendly introduction

1513111111211112212.content:
I had been hunting" said Eoin with a smile and then looking to Jacob said " I'm sure you get the craving to"

Ah yes" laughed Jacob "that is one thing that the blood likes, the hunt"

Eoin turned back to vedvenin "what brings you out here"he said in a serious manner
1513111111211112212.title: Hunting

15131111112111122121.content:
"This Stormcloak brought me out here, and despite being the enemy, treated my wounds after I somehow burst into flames," Vedvenin said.

"How in Oblivion did that happen?" Eoin asked, stunned.

"I don't know. A five-thousand year-old Dwemer took control of me, then Jacob hit him with his sword, he released me, then after throwing Jacob through the door, closing it and busted through the rock ceiling," Vedvenin said, becoming very stern. "You should know not to talk to your superiors like that, Argonian. And while I may have also been a werewolf at one point I hated it. So, I killed a Glenmoril Witch, and rid myself of it."

"And what makes you my superior, whore?" Eion asked, chuckling. Vedvenin marched toward him becoming angry. Intricate black lines appeared on her face.

"I'm a Legate in the Imperial Legion, lizard!" She barked. "Now, if you don't watch your words, I'm going to cut your head off!"

"Hey, calm down, there, Vedvenin!" Jacob pleaded.
15131111112111122121.title: Their quest

151311111121111221211.content:
"We need to focus on the 5,000 year old Dwemer wandering Tamriel right now. Not rankings!" Jacob yelled out.

Vedvenin glared at the Argonian and backed off. "Fine. You're lucky, swamp-dweller."

Eoin shook his head and chuckled. Jacob walked forward, "We need to get people alert of this. We're heading to Dragonsreach to arrange a meeting between Ulfric and General Tullius. Care to join us?"

Does Eoin join?
151311111121111221211.title: She calms down a little.

1513111111211112212111.content:
I will join you for now" Eoin said after a pause " besides it would be my ass if I didn't help a superiour officer.
And the three of them set off
1513111111211112212111.title: Yes

15131111112111122121111.content:
Jacob rode the horse he had gotten from the Stormcloak next to the two Imperials as they passed through Rorikstead heading to Whiterun.

Eoin looked over at Jacob. "Stormcloak. What will we do when we reach Whiterun?"

Jacob replied, "Me and Vedvenin sent couriers ahead to Solitude and Windhelm to have them meet there. We'll try to deal with this Dwemer. Also, you may call me Jacob."

Does something happen on the way?
15131111112111122121111.title: During the journey

151311111121111221211112.content:
After a days ride they reach whiterun upon reaching the gates Eoin looks over to his two companions and said "would you excuse me for a while my wife is in the town at the moment and I need to tell her to secure the manor. If what you say about the Dwemer is true things might get very bad very fast"

No problem" said Jacob paying no mind to it

Hurry back, that's an order "said vedvenin with a scowl still sore about earlier

Ill meet you outside when you have finnished your meeting
151311111121111221211112.title: No, they reach Whiterun

1513111111211112212111121.content:
Jacob and Vedvenin entered Whiterun as they made their way towards Dragonsreach. Jacob passed by Jorrvaskr, reminding him of his beast blood. The two walked up and saw Eoin waiting.

"Alright. Let's meet the Jarl." Jacob said.

The three entered Dragonsreach.

Who's the Jarl?
1513111111211112212111121.title: Meeting the Jarl

choices: Irileth and Proventus voice their opinions.
15131111112111122121111211.content:
"What is it now, Vedvenin?" Jarl Bulgruuf asked. "Do you wish to trap another dragon in my palace? And you smell like you got stuffed into a smelter."

"Not so, Jarl," Vedvenin answered. "Jacob and I stumbled upon an ancient Dwemer in some Dwarven ruins that were connected to an Ancient Nord burial crypt."

"Jacob? You mean the Stormcloak?" Bulgruuf asked. "I don't know what you're doing with the enemy, but Whiterun has seen far too much combat, just like the country-side. So many victories and losses all rest on the shoulders of you two. A battle between two of the dragonborn, now that would be something to see. But that still doesn't explain why in Oblivion you smell like you got stuffed down into a smelter!"

"That's a long, bizarre story, Jarl Bulgruuf," Jacob said. "Even so, there's a very evil, very powerful ancient Dwemer on the loose! Now is not the time to be wondering on such things as a battle between the two of us! A devastating one nearly broke out between her and an Argonian, who's also a dragonborn, like us."

"I am aware the two of you are very high-ranking officials in both your armies," Bulgruuf said. "Now, what's this nonsense about a Dwemer in Tamriel? They haven't been seen in over a thousand years."
15131111112111122121111211.title: Jarl Balgruff

151311111121111221211112111.content:
"Jarl Balgruff," Jacob said, "I met Vedvenin when exploring an Ancient Nord burial crypt. We then found a Dwemer ruin next to it. We searched and found a man chained up. We released him when he attacked Vedvenin. I tried to stop him when he knocked me out. Vedvenin can explain the rest."

Vedvenin then walked forward, "He grew some sort of Dragon wings from his back and flew away when I passed out. Although we're enemies, Jacob healed my wounds and met Eoin here. We believed it best to warn everyone of this Dwemer loose in Tamriel."

What happens next?
151311111121111221211112111.title: Jacob and Vedvenin both explain.

15131111112111122121112.content:
They set up a small camp in a cave as Jacob started a fire. Jacob started cooking slaughterfish. Eoin sat across from him while Vedvenin stood at the mouth of the cave. "Say Eoin, why'd you join up with the Imperials?"

What happens next?
15131111112111122121112.title: Stopping for the night

151311111121111221211121.content:
My parents were slaves " Eoin began while sharpening his blades " I was born into a life of slavery to one of the houses can't remember which one" Eoin for the first time removed his helm and chest plate to reveal that his scales were jet black, He indicated to a seal on his back "Dunmer magic to keep slaves nice and obedient, My father managed to smuggle me out of morrowind to cyrodil"

Jacob returned at this point and began to listen to Eoin "I met Martin you know the Prince , ye I was hero of kavatch a long time ago. I got trapped in multiple plains of oblivion before ending up here" "Given what I had been before hand I merely reenlisted, and here we are".

Intresting" said vedvenin
151311111121111221211121.title: Eoin tells his story

1513111111211112212111212.content:
"Alright...Nothing's working out today. Looting ruins to find nothing, releasing a Dwemer unto Tamriel, and can't catch any fish. This is all that was biting." Jacob said. He threw down metal plates with seared slaughterfish. He pulled the mask on his face down and began eating. "Say Vedvenin, what's your story? You seem quite powerful. What happened?"

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212.title: Dinner

15131111112111122121112121.content:
"If you really want to know," she sighed. "After my parent's house burned down in Kithendis Falls, over in southern Morrowind about twenty three years ago, I was handed off by my father to a friend of his, along with an ancient ebony sword that I received six years ago back in Cheydinhal. The man I knew as my father always said I was different from the other children, always wanting to learn combat and go hunting, rather than go play with the other kids. By the time I was thirteen, I was already as skilled as the average soldier, but I kept working at it, and eventually I became quite dangerous by the time I was able to legally enlist in the Legion. The soldiers feared me for my skill. Most of the ones that started training at that age hadn't held anything more than a knife. About a year ago, the one I knew as my father passed away, but before he died, explained everything. Once he passed, I went to the tavern to drown my sorrows in mead, at which point I was being harassed by the Orum gang. They tried to brand me a whore, and in retaliation, I took out seven of their lieutenants, but when I was ambushed in a dark alley by them, I became surrounded. Lucky for me, an Altmer mage showed up and killed the ones I had been unable to. Enough about that, though. I don't know why I always wanted to dominate the opposition. It just felt natural. You two are close to the beast blood, but what if I'm close to tapping the full potential of the dragonborn? Was that inferno I unintentionally unleashed just a sample? I want to find out what a dragonborn is truly capable of, and I won't rest until I figure it out. Perhaps it lies in Alduin's elusive soul? Or maybe the answer lies with that Dwemer. Either way, I want to become stronger and smarter. I want to know the limit of power a dragonborn can posses."

"Wow, that's quite a tail," Jacob said.

"Anyway, what's your story, Jacob?" Vedvenin asked. "Why are you in Skyrim, and why have you sided with the Stormcloaks?"
15131111112111122121112121.title: She tells the story

151311111121111221211121211.content:
Jacob looked at the floor. "My ancestors traveled here when Ysgramor was leading. They all fought and finally settled here. I was born around Dawnstar, a little south of there. I worked in the mines around there to try and get money to train with a soldier who had been staying in the town. He taught me what he knew and I kept training. Then, vampires attacked when I was a young man. I fought a few of them off, but then one got the upper hand on me and took me out." Jacob pulled the mask down and showed scars lining the left side of his face, his eye was white and blind. "I woke up and a small Imperial brigade had entered the town when I woke up. I tried to ask for help, but a Thalmor was with them. He tossed me aside and left me. When I went to the house I grew up in, the smell inside and the trails of blood was all I needed to see. Gathering what money was left, and stealing some, I traveled to Windhelm. On the way, a werewolf attacked me and infected me with Lycanthropy. I was crazed by the hunt and went on a rampage. When I came to, I ran to Windhelm. Ulfric took me in and I was a Stormcloak. Any other family I had went missing, probably because they worshipped Talos...I was sent down to Riften and found the Theives Guild. After doing some work, Brynjolf came to me and joined me into the Nightingales and I trained there. Then I joined up with the Dawnguard. After all that, I started traveling as a hired mercenary. And here I am. All I can do to not lose it is fight. I try to keep as many alive as possible, but I can't always."

Jacob stared at the fire and looked up at the two. "Sorry about that. Should we keep moving during the night?"

Should we?

My advice to you is, if you want to keep your head on your shoulders, you watch your tongue around her. I'm pretty sure Tullius knows of her skill, and I suspect he's given her permission to kill any Thalmor she comes across. I've seen the bodies. So many soldiers have died by her hand alone. We need to avoid making her angry, because if you saw what she did to the Thalmor, it would make the deaths of my brothers and sisters look merciful."

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"Legate?" The soldier asked, quietly. Vedvenin sat up and looked at him. He noticed Jacob farther back in the cave. "Ah, that must be that Stormcloak that's been causing us all kinds of trouble! Thanks for turning him in to us."

"Stand down, soldier," Vedvenin said, as she began to stand up.

"Yes, ma'am," the soldier said. "Why, though? Isn't he the enemy?"

"This man saved my life," she began. "We're working our way to Whiterun. It's urgent we get there as soon as we can."

"We noticed a horse outside with Stormcloak colors on the saddle," another soldier said. "We thought we'd investigate." Vedvenin looked over her shoulder and was surprised at who she saw.

"Hadvar?" She asked. "What are you doing here?"

"We were tracking some vampires, but it looks like you already took care of them," Hadvar said, noting the bodies of vampires on the ground. "We'd be happy to lend you a horse, if you're in need of one."

"No thanks," Vedvenin said as she cast a Conjuration spell. "I've got my own." A skeletal, blue-violet steed appeared behind her, with a flaming, blue mane and tail.

"I guess we'd better get going, then," Jacob said, a little groggy as he got up on his horse.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Vedvenin's reaction

Eoin took care of saber cats on the ridge and supplied the group with food when there supplies ran low all the while remaining hidden
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: On the road to Whiterun.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Upon walking up to Dragonsreach, Jacob and Vedvenin caught sight of Jarl Bulgruuf, who approached them.

"Vedvenin, what's going on?" Bulgruuf asked, somewhat sternly. "Don't tell me you want to trap another dragon in my palace."

"It's not that, my Jarl," Vedvenin said. "We accidentally released some kind of great evil upon Tamriel."

"You two had better come inside, then," Bulgruuf said. "I fear Tullius and Ulfric would be at each others' throats if it weren't for Irileth and my guards."

"Do you think it was a mistake not going to the Jarl first?" Vedvenin whispered to Jacob. Before he could even answer, they were approached by General Tullius.

"Vedvenin," Tullius said. "What reason did you have to call me to Whiterun? And it's better be a really damn good one, because if I found out you dragged me all the way out here for some petty meeting, you're out of the Legion."

"I feel the same way toward my Stormblade," Ulfric said. "If he asked me to come here for some pointless meeting, he's out of my army."

"This isn't about dragons anymore, General," Vedvenin said. "We stumbled upon a Dwemer in some Dwarven ruin, and we believe him to be over five thousand years old."

"So?" Tullius asked, frustrated. "What's that got to do with anything?"

"She almost died, General," Jacob said, with as much respect as he could hope to give. "I noticed him remove a small, glowing thing from her chest. It looked kind of like a dragon. After I hit him with the pommel of my sword, he dropped her to the ground and hurled me through the door we came through, at which point I got knocked out. She can explain the rest."

"After the Dwemer hurled Jacob through the door, he sprouted etheral, dragon-like wings and lept through the rock ceiling," Vedvenin explained. "It was only a few more seconds until I felt an intense amount of heat building up in my chest and the room was filled with fire. I don't remember much after that, other than I heard someone scream in pain."

"When I came to, the door I was thrown through was glowing a red color, probably meaning it was quite hot, and a wall had been made brittle enough for me to use my Unrelenting Force Shout..."

"Hold up," Tullius ordered. "Unrelenting Force Shout?"

"FUS RO DAH!" Jacob Shouted toward the ceiling. The outskirts of the Shout was enough to cause Tullius to stumble back a little.

"I see," Tullius said. "Please, proceed."

"Anyway," Jacob began. "I used my Unrelenting Force Shout to knock down a section of wall, and it was unbelievably hot in there. Rock and metal were glowing a bright red color, a pipe had burst, and was leaking water, which helped cool things down a little, but made a lot of steam. Everything in that room, even her armor, was so hot it was glowing. Anyway, I picked her up, brought her to the surface and got a horse from one of my comrades. After finding an abandoned bandit camp, I treated her wounds to the best of my abilities, and here she is."

"It would seem that not all Stormcloaks are mindless thralls, huh Ulfric?" Tullius retorted, causing Ulfric to grunt. "But yes, I do agree that this Dwemer could be a bit of a problem, seeing as he nearly killed my most elite soldier. So, what is it you wanted to discuss?"

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
As Jacob headed through the forests of Falkreath, he thought he caught sight of someone's silhouette, and dismissed it as shadow from the trees

"You move fast for someone as heavily-clad as yourself!" Jacob exclaimed. "Why'd you run off, anyway?"

"After years of trying to gain honor, to make a name for myself, and I lose it all in a few seconds," Vedvenin said. She looked as if she were about to cry.

"Why do you say you've lost your honor?" Jacob asked.

"I've politically embarrassed General Tullius by assaulting a Commanding Officer, went into a hallucinogenic rage," she began, her voice becoming shaky. "And do you know what the final trigger to such rage was? When Eoin mentioned the Blades."

"Hey, slow down," Jacob pleaded. "Why is it you don't like the Blades?"

"It's not that hard to figure out!" Vedvenin exclaimed, suddenly becoming angry. "They meddle in affairs they barely understand, and try to play the part of puppet master on a dragonborn. The Greybeards were right about them."

"Come on," Jacob began. "Let's get back to Whiterun."

"After what I did, I can't show my face in front of Tullius again," she said.

"He actually asked why you went into a mad rage like that without a clear trigger," Jacob said. "I told him everything, and he seemed pretty pissed off with Eoin. He ordered his troops to search for you and I volunteered to help. Ulfric objected, of course, and even gloated that Tullius had lost his trump card and the war was already in his favor. As it turns out, the Thalmor are supplying both sides, according to Tullius. He also said that once this little conflict is finished, he's going to war with the Thalmor. I'd bet you'd like to show those arrogant bastards a thing or two. Come on, we really should get you back to Whiterun."

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
The whistle of an arrow could be heard, and Vedvenin instinctively spun clock-wise, and stepped to the right of where she was facing, incidentally putting Jacob in harm's way. An arrow penetrated his armor and stuck into his shoulder, knocking him back a little, and causing him to fall over, still as a statue. Vedvenin then drew her own bow, loaded in a steel arrow, and fired at one of the figures at the cliff's edge. A silhouette fell as a red mist was ejected from the form. She immediately knelt down to give Jacob a Cure Poison potion, which helped get him moving again in seconds.

"Thanks for that," he said, yanking the arrow out of his shoulder.

"Don't mention it," Vedvenin said. "I'm going to see what was up with those two up there.

After about a minute of climbing, she saw a vampire wearing hide armor, wielding an enchanted iron sword. He was bent over his comrade, a woman in leather armor. She had an arrow sticking out of her forehead.

"Why did you attack us?" Vedvenin asked, sternly.

"You're really hard to keep up with," Jacob said, as he clambered up to the cliff where Vedvenin was standing.

"As much as I hate cohorting with vampires, maybe we can help them so they'll stay away from the cities and people. We may need your help, um..."

"Falkner," the vampire replied.

"Falkner. If we killed your Court-Lord, would you be able to feed off your thralls again?"

"Best shot I'd say. There is a problem though..." Falkner said.

Jacob, worried asked, "What is it?"

"No one's allowed to see him since recently. The only people able to see him are new vampires who join the group."

Jacob turned away and looked across Skyrim. After a long silence, "Me."

Vedvenin was curious as to what he meant, "Huh?"

"Make me a vampire," Jacob said, "I'll kill him and then allow you to feed again." Jacob turned to Vedvenin, "You okay with this?"

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Before they make it to the castle, the two of them stop as they hear a sudden voice.

"And what is this I see?"

looking towards the direction the voice came from, Jacob sees an Argonian walking towards them wearing large, heavy looking armor that appears to be made mostly of bone, and carrying a greatsword of the same material

"I'm heading on my way to a quest and what do I find? Two vampires with an Argonian thrall, walking through the forest in broad daylight." The Argonian said. "But before I do anything else, I suggest you release that thrall, Vampires. Or you may not like what happens next." He said, sounding completely calm.

With apparent reluctance, Serana released Eoin, who blinked a few times, looking confused, then dropped straight to the ground, unconscious.

"Now then," The Argonian said, "explain what you two are doing out here and I'll consider letting you go."

Jacob explains what the two of them had discussed earlier, despite the angry glare Serana shot him.

"Hmm...It seems I have a decision to make. Do I let you vampires go, and be certain that I'm saving this fellow Argonian, or do I kill both of you, and risk having to fight him too?" The Argonian asked, knowing full well (from what he knew of vampires) one of them would likely make Eoin back into a thrall.

After giving it much thought, He decided it was better to save the unconscious Argonian, as he could hunt the vampires down later.

"Alright, I've decided. The two of you may go. But don't waste my sparing your lives by trying to follow and kill me."

With that, the heavy armored Argonian picked up Eoin, threw him over his shoulder, and walked off.

"Well that was awkward, but it turned out better than I thought it would." Jacob said as they continued through the forest.

"I offer my deepest, most sincere apologies for every wrong I have committed against you, Vedvenin," Eoin said. "I..."

"It may be hard, and it may not be right," Vedvenin began. "But I forgive you, Eoin. However, I must break this little reunion short."

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Making amends ( Eoin and Vedvenin)

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"You're leaving?" Jordis asked, confused and frustrated. "After all you've done for Skyrim, and the people that look up to you, you just pack up and leave!?"

"This isn't an option for me, Jordis," Vedvenin said as she stuffed her belongings in the chest in the master bedroom.

"Well, won't you at least tell me?" Jordis asked.

"No," Vedvenin said. "It would be better if as few people as possible knew. Odds are, Ulfric will try to get the word to spread like mage-fire, and I want to leave before I make things worse."

"I understand," Jordis said. "It's none of my business, and it should stay that way."

"Good," Vedvenin said as she exited via the porch door. "Take care of the house for me." She ran along Solitude's exterior wall toward Katla's Farm and the carriage.

"I can take you to any of the Hold capitals," Thaer said.

"Riften," Vedvenin said, handing him the twenty gold fee.

"Climb in back and we'll be off," he said. She climbed into the back of the carriage hurriedly. "When you get to Riften, you might want to stop by the Black-Briar Meadery. Few mugs of that stuff, and you'll forget all about the long trip."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Vedvenin in Solitude.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"Hey there, beautiful," a familiar voice said as she dismounted the cart. "Come running back to Sibbi for some love?"

"Oh, look," Vedvenin began. "The little brat's gotten out of his time-out early. Let me guess, mommy-dearest gave you an early pardon?"

"Watch it," Sibbi said in a warning tone. "Wouldn't want a pretty, little thing like you to end up dead, now would we?"

"You're the one that needs to watch his mouth, Sibbi," Vedvenin warned him, setting down her belongings. "Besides, it's bad to be listening to that pairing knife between your legs all the time."

"How do you know about that?" Sibbi asked, shocked. He turned red as a beet after realizing he fell for a simple verbal trap. A woman working at the stables covered her mouth, but was giggling to herself over what she heard. "You take that back right now, or I'll..."

"Or you'll what?" Vedvenin asked in a taunting voice. "Go crying to mommy?"

Sibbi charged her with a dagger, only for her to catch his arm and punch him in the stomach, knocking him unconscious. An middle-aged woman walked through the gates just as Sibbi fell to the ground. It was Maven Black-Briar.

"What did you do to my son?" Maven asked, infuriated.

"He's only unconscious," Vedvenin said plainly as she picked up her belongings. "He'll wake up in a few hours; filthy, but alive."

"Hold on!" Maven exclaimed. "In this town, when I say bark, you bark, and when I kick you, don't bare your teeth. Now, I command you to serve my son as he requested!"

"You know, between your son and a Hagraven, I think I'd go with the Hagraven," Vedvenin said.

"That was not a request, it was an order!" Maven exclaimed. "Now serve my son as I ordered you too, you filthy whore!"
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Vedvenin in Riften.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Maven felt a piece of metal with sharp edges collide with her cheek, and half her face went numb. Vedvenin had just back-handed her across the face with great force and little effort.

"Now, if you'll excuse me," Vedvenin began. "I have somewhere I need to be."

"Don't you walk away from me!" Maven exclaimed.

"What are you gonna do?" Vedvenin asked, not at all intimidated. "Send your guards after me? Send the Thalmor or Dark Brotherhood? Send anyone you like. Just know that I will kill them and send you their heads on a platter. Think I'm not serious? Send someone, see if I don't hold to my promise." She proceeded to walk south, toward the Cyrodiil gates. She stopped and turned her head to let Maven know she was talking to her. "Just know that your son is lucky to be alive after what he said to me. I've put up with it long enough."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Vedvenin slaps her. Hard.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
After walking south for a few miles, she came to a large, wooden gate. An Imperial guard stood on the watch bridge.

"Halt," he said. "Before I allow you to pass, you must prove you are not a Stormcloak."

"Do you actually believe Ulfric would allow a Dunmer into his ranks?" She asked.

"We are also to check if you are carrying any contrabande, most notably skooma, which you dark elves, along with the Khajiit are notorious for smuggling across borders."

"Here we go again, with the racial stereotypes," she sighed. "Just search. I can assure you you won't find anything illegal."

Two of the soldiers started rummaging through her belongings, and it took them almost three hours to search everything.

"She's got a bloody armory and half an alchemy shop in there!" One of them exclaimed. "How does half of this stuff even fit?"

"Never heard of an enchanted chest, huh?" She asked. "They're bigger on the inside."
