1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: She awoke in a tower, hog-tied, but not gagged. She conjured up her Fire Storm spell and discharged it, tearing the ropes apart and burning them. Her stuff was in the far corner of the room. As she went to grab it, she heard someone running up a flight of stairs, and through the door burst...
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Jacob

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: Is it actually Jacob or is there something wrong with him?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Jacob.

choices: Vedvenin makes it back to the gate.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"I thought I told you not to follow me," Vedvenin said, frustrated she had been set back who knows how long. She started to pack up her belongings again.

"We still need your strength, you know," Jacob said.

"Strength', yeah, that's laughable," she said. "Why don't you ask Eoin for help? Isn't he unkillable?"

"Maybe so, but he can't put a scratch on that Dwemer!" Jacob exclaimed. "We..."

"And what makes you think I can do any better?" Vedvenin asked, becoming stern. "I couldn't beat Eoin, and I'm on my own now. I'd prefer to keep it that way!"

"Then what?" Jacob asked. "What if the Dwemer grows in strength? What if he's just waiting for one of us to just give up so he can take over?"

"Then that's your problem," she snapped.

"Listen, Vedvenin. "Jacob began, trying to choose his words carefully. "You can't keep running away from your past." As he said that, he noticed she looked like she was about to cry as she burst through the door and disappeared into the rain and fog.

"Vedvenin! Wait!" Jacob shouted, about to go after her. He then put his left arm against the door frame and rested his head against his arm. "Dammit. What did I say? Where did I go wrong?"
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: It's him

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: Who is she ambushed by?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: She gets ambushed.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Vedvenin ran from the tower which Jacob had taken her to. She ran through the fog and rain until she realized she reached a swampy forested area. "Great, I'm off track," Vedvenin said with great frustration. She continued wandering until she saw something move towards her. A man in a black robe with a faded skull on it and a hood walked towards her slowly. "Back off buddy," Vedvenin threatened as she went to burst the man into flames. Just then she felt a jolt from behind her stop her as she fell. She caught herself on her hands and knees. "Wha..Why couldn't I use Magicka?"

A second female Necromancer came and tied her arms quickly as a third brawny Orc thrall tied her legs. "I told you it'd work, Piyr! The Magicka siphon is draining her Magicka away!"

"I guess," the first male one said, revealing his accent to be strongly Nord, "just conduct your test on this whore and we'll go from there."

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: A group of Necromancers

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
The female Necromancer ordered her Orc thrall to keep Vedvenin's head down as she placed bone meal, a human heart, and void salts next to Vedvenin's head. Vedvenin struggled and tried to break her way out, but these necromancers seemed able to make incredibly strong thralls. "Stop it!" Vedvenin screamed shaking her body out of anger and fear of what they might do.

"Ooh, she's a nasty one," the first Necromancer said, "Ilka, maybe you should look at her past and show her what went wrong?"

The Necromancer known as Ilka smirked, "But of course." She then drew something on Vedvenin's head using some kind of potion as her vision changed. Vedvenin saw the house of her parents, she felt the heat of the flames, the pain on her face that would later leave a scar...and the screams of her parents as they burned. Vedvenin was stuck in a loop watching her history again and again.

In reality, the male Necromancer now had an ebony arrow through his skull. "Who's there," Ilka yelled wielding Frostbite in her hands. She turned as she heard a quick whizzing noise as it got her through the eye, taking her and her thrall down.

Jacob ran to Vedvenin, sheathing his Blackbow of Fate as he laid Vedvenin upright against a tree as she was regaining consciousness, the loop broken. "You alright? Come on, Vedvenin!"

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Jacob reappears

choices: Vedvenin finally gets to the gate.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"This is why I can never come back," she said, her face showing a great amount of fear, her limbs shaking in shock.

"What are you talking about?" Jacob asked.

"I'm broken, Jacob," she said, almost crying. She tried to hold back her tears, but the fell like rain. "I keep hallucinating. I'm haunted by my past, and can barely function to where it seems like nothings wrong. I can never come back here, not like this." She gathered her things and trudged off, heading south. She sheathed her bow.

"Dammit," Jacob said to himself. "What'd they do to her?"
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Vedvenin caves in

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: What stops her this time?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: She gets held up. Again.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: Why does he stop Vedvenin?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Jacob. Again.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
She was a ways out from Riften, as she passed down a road with one side forested and the other a mountain. She continued moving when she felt something jolt through her body. She looked around and didn't see anything at first until she realized there was something in the woods. She headed through searching the small forested area when she saw the siphon the Necromancer was using. She sheathed her weapons and approached it, "What in Oblivion is this doing here?"

She suddenly fell straightforward as something knocked her over, tied her legs and began dragging her. Vedvenin clawed at the floor trying to get a grip, unable to see her assailant. She was then flipped up with her back against a large, thick tree as a rope came around her chest and arms tying her down to it. She struggled against the ropes, unable to get out. She looked forward and saw Jacob sitting in front of her. "Jacob?! The hell do you think you're-"

Jacob pulled down his mask and hood as he walked to Vedvenin and knelt in front of her. "Listen," Jacob said, knowing this may be his final time he could help Vedvenin with this, "you can't keep running from your past."

Vedvenin was already shaking, her eyes watery. "N-no. You don't understand."

Jacob brought his face closer and turned his head to show the left side of his face scarred heavily. "These scars are from my past as a child. You have that one too don't you," Jacob said motioning to the scar across her cheek. "That past, whatever happened, it forged you. It tempered you. It made you who you are, Vedvenin. You can't keep running from that, or else your only gonna live these thoughts of pain for the rest of your life. Come on, Vedvenin, talk to me. Face your past, and learn to live with it. You can't change it now and never can, so embrace it." Jacob finished and waited for Vedvenin's response.

Does she take Jacob's advice?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Final test

choices: He asks her about this object.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: "I'm sorry, Jacob," she began. "But after what happened back in Whiterun, there's no way I could face Tullius again. I also have the sudden urge to head back to Morrowind. It feels as if something's calling me. It's strange. I don't even know how I could detect something from this far away, and I even know its general location."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: No

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"What do you mean?" Jacob asked curiously. "I knew people could sense things from countries away, but that was only with a siphon giving them power or something. What kind of power?"

"I'm...not sure." Vedvenin said just as confused.

"If your heading to Morrowind, I'm heading with you." Jacob said as he began untying Vedvenin.

Does Vedvenin let Jacob come?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: He asks her about this object.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: "This is a personal matter, Jacob," she said, becoming stern. "And I'd rather keep it that way. Now cut me down, and if I ever catch you near me again, I will make sure you end up dead."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: No

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"Fine." Jacob began cutting her down. "Just...be careful in case." Jacob cut the final rope and began walking away, leaving behind a healing potion and a Magicka potion.

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Jacob cuts her down.

choices: They get to the inn, no trouble.
They are stopped midway by some Justiciars.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"One more thing," she said to Jacob, who turned around, receiving a fist in his face. He fell unconscious almost immediately. She proceeded through the gates, and as soon as they were closed, she whispered to herself, "I'm sorry, Jacob. I didn't want to have to lie about that object. Forgive me." She cut through Cyrodiil, heading south along the road. As she approached Cheydinhal, it was starting to get dark. "I wonder if that old man still works at the inn." She entered the city, and was taking in everything. It looked like the same town she grew up in. Even the town square was the same.

"I remember you!" An Altmer in mage's robes exclaimed. He looked incredibly happy to see her. He settled down and asked, "Do you remember who I am?"

"That's right," Vedvenin began. "You were that mage who helped me kill off the Orum Gang, then treated my wounds. Allinor, was it? It's good to see you again." She noticed a great statue of the Champion of Cyrodiil, who most knew as the Grey Fox. "I've always aspired to some day be like him."

"Huh?" Allinor asked, confused.

"The Grey Fox," Vedvenin said. "He was an unstoppable force in the Oblivion Crisis, and I've always wanted to be his equal. I wanted fools like the Orum Gang and Thalmor to leave me alone. I guess I'm right about there now, slaying dragons and whatnot."

"You... it can't be," Allinor was in disbelief. "You're the dragonborn we've been hearing so much about? The one who defeated Alduin and Miraak?"

"Yes," Vedvenin answered, perplexed as to why he was so excited.

"Oh, Donovan will be so happy to hear about this!" Allinor exclaimed. "He's been wanting to meet the dragonborn ever since the rumors reached here."

"That old man's still working at that floating inn?" Vedvenin asked.

"Yep! Come on, let's go!" Allinor exclaimed, very excited.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Vedvenin heads to Morrowind

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: What is the reason for the Justicars stopping them?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: They are stopped midway by some Justiciars.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: Perhaps they saw Vedvenin with Jacob(A Talos Worshipper) and demand answers?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Other

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"You, there! Dark Elf!" A Justiciar exclaimed. "Do you deny being seen cooperating with a worshipper of the false god Talos, and an enemy of the Second Aldmeri Dominion?"

"No," Vedvenin answered, knowing the truth was probably best. "I'm aware you have spies everywhere, such as the late Ancano and Estormo. However, seeing as he's a Stormcloak, I would have killed him, had he not been in the Dawnguard, and therefore an ally against the vampires that threaten Skyrim. I'm sure he and that Argonian can handle them just fine. Volkihar vampires and their pets aren't that strong."

"Then, seeing as you've killed many of our soldiers, including surviving Labyrinthian, it can be said the two of us are not much of a match for you right now," the Justiciar said, noting her Daedric armor, dragonbone swords, and dragonbone bow, as well as her jewelry, all having powerful enchantments and either being incredibly strong or having a wicked punch to them. "However, we would ask you to leave your associate with us. He would be interrogated for being associated with an enemy of the Dominion."

"How about you two leave and I don't cut your heads off," Vedvenin said in a warning tone, drawing her dragonbone swords.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Sure

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"Hah! Would you look at this? The little Dunmer girl would challenge us?" The first Justicar jokingly said.

"I suppose so," the other said pulling out two bound swords, "Let's show her the power of the Aldmeri Dominion!"

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: They are not intimidated

choices: They proceed to the Cheydinhal Bridge Inn.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"Very well," Vedvenin said, shrugging. With one, quick sweep of her blades, she decapitated both Justiciars. She then sheathed her swords. "That was boring."

"You can be really scary at times," Allinor said. "Brilliant, but scary."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Battle

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: More Justicars or something/someone else?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: More Justiciars.

choices: Arriving at the Cheydinhal Bridge Inn
They are approached by some guards.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
A swarm of Justiciars stormed across the town bridge, surrounding Vedvenin and the mage. The town guard watched, unable to do anything to help.

"It's just one little whore and her boyfriend!" A Justiciar laughed. Vedvenin located him in the crowd and quickly silenced him. She equipped her helmet and braced for the inevitable onslaught. One Justiciar charged her and swung, but his blow got deflected, and a sword pierced his stomach. He fell over dead.

"I'm going to try something," Vedvenin said to the mage. She charged a fire spell, and held it until some of the Thalmor troops were a little closer in. When the spell discharged, Justiciars were sent flying through windows, and into walls and carts. She turned around to see the mage bent over with his hands covering his head. "You're still alive, you know."

"Woah," the mage said, astonished. "What was that?"

"Fire Storm and Companion's Insight," she told him. "Come on. Let's get to the inn before these guys wake up. If they're still alive, that is."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: More Justicars

choices: Stay the night at the inn
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Vedvenin crossed the Cheydinhal bridge with Allinor. "Well, that's quite the story. Might I ask why you are heading to Morrowind."

Vedvenin turned away, "No." She replied simply as she continued walking. She passed until she was almost passed the bridge.

Does she stay for the night or make the entire trek?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Arriving at the Cheydinhal Bridge Inn

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"You've really been through a lot in the past year," Donovan, the inn-keeper, said. "I never would have though you would be dragonborn. Not that that's a bad thing. Almost everyone in Tamriel knows about you, you know. From Hammerfell and High Rock to Morrowind, they're talking about you. I mostly hear good things, but I do get the occasional word that you've murdered an entire platoon of Thalmor troops. Can't say I'd blame you, really. Who knows, the Emperor himself might want to see you."

"That's nice and all," Vedvenin began. "But I'm actually just dropping by for the night. I'm sorry I didn't come by to visit for a while. I just need to get to Morrowind soon."

"Why?" Donovan asked. "What happened?"

"I'd rather not talk about it," Vedvenin said quickly.

"I understand," Donovan said. "And before I asked, I could've sworn you were starting to form a genuine smile."

"Where in Oblivion did you get all this gold!?" A voice said. Vedvenin looked over and saw a thief poking through her belongings. She approached him and he scrambled without taking anything.

"Sloppy thief," she muttered.

"Poor lad," Donovan said, laughing. "He's been on some hard times lately , and has resorted to petty thievery to hold himself over. Anyway, you look tired. The room you slept in last is yours. Oh, and there's a new mirror in there. Vilnius!"

"Yes, sir?" A young Imperial asked, poking his head through the kitchen door.

"Show this good lass to her room," Donovan ordered, gesturing to Vedvenin.

"Yes, sir," Vilnius said nervously. It was painfully obvious that he was intimidated "When you're ready, ma'am."

"Poor kid," Donovan chuckled. "You've obviously got a long day ahead of you tomorrow, and I won't hold you up. So, please. Enjoy your stay. Must feel good to be home after so long away from it." Vedvenin followed Vilnius to her room, which he promptly left.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Stay the night at the inn

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Vedvenin awoke somewhat early in the morning and headed out of bed. She grabbed her gear in the chest at the foot of the bed and headed downstairs. "Shame you have to leave so soon," Donovan said as Vedvenin walked, "You only just got here."

"Sorry Donovan, but it's important I get to Morrowind as soon as possible."

Donovan shook his head, "Well it was nice seeing you again."

Vedvenin left the inn and crossed the bridge of Cheydinhal into Morrowind. The rest of her trip lasted a day or two before she reached her birthplace.

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: The next morning...

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: As she came upon Kithendis Falls, there was quite a bit of greenery compared to northern Morrowind. The burnt husk of the house she was born in stood across the road she was walking on from another house. They were, in fact, the only two in sight. As she entered the house that was still standing, she found a considerable amount of evidence that it had been abandoned for some time. A thick layer of dust blanketed everything, and a strong gust of wind came through from the south, stirring up the dust and making it hard to breathe. She laid her belongings down on a bare patch of floor, and started to dust everything off, from the highest spot to the floor. By the time she was done cleaning the place, she had a pile of dust about nine inches high and three feet around just outside the door. She took a broom and spread it out. She then began to hang up the weapons she never uses, and stacked potions and poisons on an unused shelf. She followed up by placing alchemical ingredients and the rest of her belongings in other places. She did, however, leave hundred of precious gems and miscellaneous items in the chest she brought. After all was said and done, she thought she'd go and pay her last respects to the remains of her parents. When she reached what was left of their house, she found two charred skeletons. She nearly fell to her knees at the sight. She knew the pain they went through when they died. Another gust of wind came through, exposing a cellar door.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Vedvenin's event

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: Vedvenin walked toward the cellar door and opened it, a she saw a ladder lead down into a dark basement. She always noticed the door there but never bothered with it. She climbed down and landed inside. It was cold and dank, but everything looked to be in an okay condition. She soon found a torch and relit it. She then saw...
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: She investigates the cellar.

choices: She takes the journal back to her 'new' home.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Ebony weapons and armor lined the walls on mannequins and weapon racks, an alchemy station, an enchanter's table, and there was even a forge set-up, complete with a grinding wheel and armor table. Immediately to her right was a bookshelf, but it only had a single, large red book on the top shelf. She removed it, and it turned out to be a journal by someone named Konahrik. Although the name sounded familiar, she couldn't place where she had heard it before. She skimmed through it, finding about a quarter of it to be written by Konarhik. As she flipped the pages of the journal, she got to someone by the name of Ideran, who wrote a mention of a recently established House Seranaan.

"I thought there were only five Great Houses of Morrowind," Vedvenin said to herself. "What's all this about this sixth one?"
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: ...an armory.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: Placing the new book under her arm, she walked back to the ladder and climbed back up I to her house. She placed the book on a nightstand and then...
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: She takes the journal back to her 'new'...

choices: She opens the letter and package immediately.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
She immediately picked the journal back up and flipped up until she got to a man by the name of Saveros. It mentioned the five Great Houses.

Fridas, 28th of Rain's Hand, 3E 42

Houses Telvanni, Redorran, Indorel, Hlaalu, and Dres may be able to wipe our name out of Morrowind's history, but may our descendants and theirs always remember we are descended from Konharik, the greatest dragon priest! House Seranaan will always live on in those of us who pass on our legend and our legacy! Our greatest treasure, though, is an ebony sword Konharik himself wielded against Miraak. He called it... ...the rest of us simply referred to it as the Dark Blade.

The text between those two nearby points was faded to the point where it wasn't even legible, much less visible. She flipped ahead through Saveros' entries until it mentioned something interesting.

Morndas, 15th of Sun's Dawn, 3E 47

Lady Azura has granted me a vision of the last heir of House Seranaan. This warrior will be chosen by the ebony sword Kohnarik wielded. I've never heard of a sword choosing its master, but it would seem this one can. According to Lady Azura, this warrior will be born of fire and orphaned by flames, they will have slain the Black Dragon without the Dark Blade, proving their worth to the sword and allowing them to enter Konharik's final resting place, Valdenzarre.

There was a knock at the door, and Vedvenin opened it to find a courier holding a package with a letter tied to it.

"I've been sent here by the Emperor himself," the courier said. "The contents of this package were meant for your arms and eyes only. Looks like that's it. Got to go." He hurriedly walked off. Vedvenin went back inside. It was getting dark out.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: ...continued searching.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Vedvenin laid the package on the old table and tore the note open. Reading: Emperor Titus Mede requests the presence of the one Dunmer known as Vedvenin. When this gets to you along with the package, proceed and report to the Imperial City immediately.

Vedvenin through away the note, now curious as to what's in the package. She opened it and removed the cloth wrapped around it showing a long ebony sword, with the blade serrated with ruby. She held it in her hand, it was almost perfect for her just from the feel of it. She then examined the hilt and saw words in Dragon Speak written in there. She realized almost instantly that that was her name translated. She quickly sheathed the sword and ran out of her 'home'. She soon traveled back to Cyrodil and reached the Imperial City.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: She opens the letter and package immediately.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"Sir!" An Imperial guard shouted, bursting through the Emperor's chamber door. "There's a heavily armed and armored Dunmer woman who has requested to see you."

"Send her in," Titus Mede II said.

"Yes, sir," the guard said. "You can come in. He has allowed your presence." He followed her in. She was looking through her father's logs. He was a man by the name of Ezaro Delgreind.

Turdas, 7th of First Seed, 4E 177

My wife, Nora, had a child today. A little girl. We had been talking about a name, and we have decided on what her name will be. Claire Delgreind. Konharik's sword is still collecting dust in the basement and hasn't selected its true master yet. I can only hope Claire will be the one to proudly carry his weapon into battle, for it has likely been too long since Konharik left his inheritance for the last of House Seranaan.

"Please," Titus Mede began, bringing her out of her trance. "Have a seat." Vedvenin, who now knew herself as Claire, took her seat. "I was informed recently by General Tullius that you were wrongfully stripped of your weapons and armor upon your capture in an ambush intended to capture Ulfric Stormcloak. As such, I have taken the liberty of restoring to you your family's sword. Now, tell me, Vedvenin. What happened in Dragonsreach from your point of view?"

"I knew that Argonian and Ulfric wouldn't keep things quiet," she sighed. "Basically, when Eoin mentioned the Blades, I started to hallucinate. I saw a Dunmer, and he started hurling slurs at me. After banging my head against a thick, wooden beam, I punched the elf in the face, only to find I had instead punched Eoin in the mouth in front of General Tullius, Ulfric Stormcloak, and Jarl Bulgruuf. I had politically embarrassed him. The name's Claire, by the way. Claire Delgreind."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Meeting the Emperor

choices: Vedvenin heads to Morrowind/Battle of the Five Houses
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"Well Claire, I'm familiar with your battles and how impressed the generals in the Legion were. So I thought we might need you in this...disturbance." The Emperor said as he stood from his chair and started pacing.

"Disturbance?" Claire asked. "What kind of disturbance, like a magical one?"

"Towns, hunters, even Legion soldiers have reported seeing something flying with wings. But they claim it appears to be a person. And to add to that a few villages have seen large numbers of Dremora nearby. A disturbance such as this must be handled swiftly and precisely. I was hoping you'd be willing to-"

An Imperial Legate burst through the doors. "Sir! We have news from House Telvanni in Morrowind! It's...It's..." He stammered.

"What?!" The Emperor said, sounding annoyed.

"An army of Dremora are crossing Morrowind attacking everything! The five houses are joining together to try and stop this!"

"Gods," Titus said, "This is already too out of hand. Claire, would you go assist the houses?"

Claire nodded and stood as she left with that.

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: The meeting continues.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"The five Great Houses of Morrowind are quite powerful, especially when combined," Claire began, "The Dremora should prove as little more than a nuisance for them. In the mean-time, I will head to Valdenzarre and retrieve my inheritance from my ancestor, Konharik as quickly as I am able. I never would've thought I'd be related to a dragon priest, or be a part of a sixth Great House of Morrowind."

"Wait," Titus Mede began. "Sixth House?"

"House Seranaan," Claire began. "We were toppled by the other five at the beginning of the Third Era, and I am their last heir. Good day, Emperor. I hope your forces join in on a 2-pronged attack with Morrowind." She walked off quickly to get to Arvak, who was waiting just outside the palace.


------



As she reached Valdenzarre, roughly halfway between Kragenmoor and Ardrethis, she noticed several Thalmor trying to break in.

"There's a powerful weapon in here," one of them said. "Now, if only our spells would break this damned barrier!"

"Having trouble?" Claire asked, rhetorically. She walked into the ancient hall, which was being over-grown with plant life as if the barrier the Thalmor were having trouble with wasn't even there.

"How were you able to get in there!?" The Thalmor captain shouted.

"I am Claire Delgreind," she began. "The final heir to House Seranaan, wielder of the sword Vedvenin, and descendent of the dragon priest Konharik. I have come here to retrieve my inheritance. Also, you may want to turn your attention behind you. The Thalmor turned around and saw a dozen Daedra approaching them. Claire held her ancestor's sword up to a symbol referring to it, and the wall split into four, allowing her access. As soon as she stepped through, however, it closed behind her.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Other

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
A torch sat on the wall of the corridor she just entered. She picked it up and made her way down it as she heard the Thalmor fight the Dremora. She soon saw many different hieroglyphs of Konahrik and his acts as he led some of the Dragon Priests. She continued until she came to another wall. She held her sword to it as it split into four pieces like the one before. The next room contained a large table and an elevated altar. On the altar was the symbol still imprinted on the sword. Skeletal bodies laid spread throughout the room, they were either bandits who got stuck inside or what were the Remnants of her house. Intrigued, she entered the room as the wall closed behind her.

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Claiming Inheritance - 1/3

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
What are you trying to tell me? Claire thought. Is this more than me just claiming my inheritance from you?

She walked down a long, winding staircase, eventually reaching another altar at the end of a Hall of Stories. She held Vedvenin up to it, and the wall split into four once again, with six more following suit behind it. Each one was composed of tougher material than the last. Stone, iron, garnet, malachite, ruby, sapphire, and finally, diamond. The main hall was empty, save for a long, thin sword with a V-shaped cross-guard, and a suit of armor that resembled the ebony set, but was made entirely out of gold.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Claiming Inheritance - 2/3

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Claire approached the armor and sword and looked at them.

"They are yours."

She held Vedvenin out as she spun around to see who was there. She made sure no one could follow her, were they waiting here? She then faced a spectral image of a large man in robes, including what looked like spectral flames burning around his feet. He wore a mask with horns and a hood. "They are meant for you." The image said.

"Wait," Claire asked confused by this image, "That mask...Konahrik?"

"You may call me that, Vedvenin. But I am him no longer, my work is done." Konahrik replied.

"What? You mean when you died?"

"No. Even after death, I had work. That work was you."

"What?" Claire asked, now even more confused.

"After the rest of my house died, leaving you, someone needed to carry it's legacy. I'm am nothing but a husk of the Warlord Konahrik. What I do no longer means anything. So I tried to draw you here anyway possible. All the hallucinations of your parents' death were caused by me, in hopes to draw you back. I protected you in battle, but now I no longer need to." Konahrik stood next to Claire looking over the armor. "This is the armor of the House of Sedoraan. And these swords will carry it's will. Your will. Take them."

Claire laid Vedvenin on the table as she removed her armor and placed the other set on. She then took the swords and sheathed them on her belt. "There."

"Good....You were meant for this, child. Carry the memory, power, and glory of our house. You are the...last one...now...." Konahrik disappeared as he gained his rest. Claire headed out the way she came, stepping over dead bodies of the Thalmor and Dremora. She stood holding her new blades, ready to use her inheritance.

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Claiming Inheritance - 3/3

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Equipping her helmet, she rushed to Arvak, and rode to the path connecting The Rift to Morrowind. She was atop a cliff, and watched as the Redoran Guard in their Bonemold Armor, Telvanni mages in their fancy robes and ebony-clad soldiers fought against the horde of Dremora, which oddly seemed to be invading from one point. After some seconds, she dismounted Arvak, and took a leap of faith off the cliff and right into the middle of the Dremora horde, killing all Dremora within ten feet of her landing point, and wounding others a little farther away. She drew the blades Vedvenin (Black Wind Master) and Faasnuhavnodun (Fearless Brutal Grace) and began cutting down any Dremora that stood before her. Some were still in shock at her entrance. It was starting to get dark, and she was still tirelessly fighting Dremora. One hit her on her back with a Battleaxe, only for it to get deflected, and the Dremora knocked back. Claire stuck Faasnuhavnodun through him and cut the head off another with Vedvenin. By the time she was done fighting and the Dremora had retreated, it was dawn. Blood and bodies covered the ashen ground, and the Redorans and Telvannis stared at Claire, standing amongst the massive amount of bodies, facing them. They were all in confusion as to where she had come from. Arvak came sprinting in seconds later, stopping next to Claire.

"Wait," a soldier in ebony armor began. "Who are you?"

"Claire Delgreind of House Seranaan, descendent of Kohnarik." Some of the soldiers and mages gasped. They had heard the tales told by House Seranaan before its destruction, but dismissed them as myth and as such, destroyed House Seranaan.

"Impossible!" A Telvanni mage exclaimed. "They were destroyed at the beginning of the Third Era!"

"Well, she's got the armor," another mage spoke. "And on top of that, she took out more Dremora in one night than we could have in a week!"

"They had no chance," Claire began. "There was no fight. It was just a massacre that took all night. Now," she mounted Arvak. "Let's get to Skyrim and put the rest of these demons in the ground, shall we?" She was met with war cries and cheers before heading to The Rift.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: The 2-pronged attack begins

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: Claire rode down the same road she took to get to Cyrodil and the same road she sucker-punched Jacob on. She rode farther on Arvak until she noticed...
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: The Battle of The Rift

choices: She removes her helmet and tells him.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"Dammit," Jacob whispered to himself. He was wounded bad, and bleeding. He thought he heard a horse galloping behind him, and saw a skeletal steed with a woman in gold armor that appeared similar to the ebony armor set. She lept ahead of the steed, forcing it to stop. A Dremora wielding a Daedric battle-axe was about to bring it down atop Jacob's head, and as he braced himself for impact, an arrow pierced the Dremora's armor, mortally wounding him. A woman walked up from behind, stood in front of Jacob, and drew an ebony sword whose edge was plated with metalized ruby in her left hand, and a long, thin sword whose blade was crafted out of some kind of white metal, with gold lining the blade edges, becoming thickest at the weak, and having a cross-guard made almost entirely of gold. As he took a closer look, the strong of the blade was crafted out of malachite. She lunged into the group of Dremora ahead of her, cutting them down one by one, and eventually forcing a retreat. She turned back to Jacob.

"Who are you?" Jacob asked.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: ...Jacob fighting Dremora wounded.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Claire removed her helmet.

"Vedvenin?" Jacob asked in disbelief. "Can't be."

"My name is Claire Delgreind, Jacob. I am the last heir to Great House Seranaan, and a descendent of Kohnarik. You once knew me as Vedvenin, a woman who had so many times failed to find her meaning." She handed him a Potion of Ultimate Healing. "We've got a big job ahead. Where are Tullius and the others?"

"Solitude," Jacob said after downing the healing potion, suddenly feeling renewed. "Thanks for that. I don't know how long I would've lasted, had you not showed up."

"It's like the Oblivion Crisis all over again, but worse," Claire said, with a hint of malice in her voice. "We need to get to Whiterun immediately. The five Great Houses of Morrowing and the Imperial Legion have launched a two-pronged attack on the Dremora inhabiting The Rift. Next will be Whiterun, then Hjaalmarch, clearing a path to Solitude and severing the supply lines to the Dremora in The Reach."

"Lady Delgreind! Lady Delgreind!" A Dunmer soldier in ebony armor called, running toward Claire and Jacob.

"Your men call you 'Lady Delgreind'?" Jacob asked, quizzical.

"I didn't ask them to," Claire said. She turned her attention to the soldier. "What's the report?"

"We have secured roughly half of The Rift. All that remains now is taking the city of Riften. Once we take that, we will have a secure thrusting zone from which we can clear the rest of the Hold of Dremora. We attack on your command."

"Good," Claire said. "Attack as soon as the opportunity arises. Who told you to come find me, anyway?"
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: She removes her helmet and tells him.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"Good. That most likely means they'll support us and recognize me as the last descendant of the house." Claire said.

Jacob ran over and found a horse nearby, "Claire, head to Solitude and join them in the defense. I'll meet you there." Jacob then rode away as Claire rode to Solitude.

Who will the story follow?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: "An officer of House Redoran."

choices: Everyone starts to run away from Claire and the guards attack.
Nobody pays any mind to the voice, but gives Claire curious looks.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
As Claire approached Solitude, Imperials and Stormcloaks stood side-by-side with a shield wall in the front and rows of archers in behind. Hadvar and Ralof were the two commanding both factions in the field. As she neared, Hadvar approached her.

"Halt," Hadvar began. "State your business or be on your way."

"I wish to speak with General Tullius, Hadvar," she said.

"How do you know my name?" Hadvar asked, becoming defensive. Claire removed her helmet, revealing a face Hadvar knew well. "Vedvenin! It's probably a good thing you showed up. I doubt the line would be able to hold against the Dremora. You should probably come in to Solitude. I suspect General Tullius and Ulfric, as well as the Jarls would be the first ones to want to speak with you." She dismounted Arvak and continued with Hadvar through the line of soldiers. A few seemed a little creeped out by Arvak's appearance. "What's with the armor? Preparing for some fancy meeting or something?"

"Actually," Claire began. "It was my inheritance from Kohnarik, and the armor worn by House Seranaan, a forgotten Great House of Morrowind. It could not be acquired without me being the one to wield the swords Vedvenin and Fassnuhavnodun..."

"Wait," Hadvar said, stopping. "Who are you, really?"

"My name is Claire Delgreind," she said, facing Hadvar. "I learned this only recently when I accidentally uncovered a journal in what was left of my parent's house."

"I see."

As they headed into Solitude and headed toward the Blue Palace, a voice rang out from above.

"A morbid hunger for blood lies in her cold, red eyes. She comes to take your lives away."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Claire

choices: Meeting with General Tullius and Ulfric.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Everyone backed up, slowly at first, but then began to run for their lives. A guard swung his blade, only for it to bounce off her armor in such a way that it was ripped out of his hand. As he ran off to find his sword, another guard ran up to Claire. Before he could even attack, she raised her hands into the air.

"Surrendering, hm?" The guard asked. "Come with us. We will see what the Jarls make of you."


------



Claire was brought before the eight Jarls in the Blue Palace, and they all just gave her curious looks. Jarl Bulgruuf was the first to approach her.

"Vedvenin?" Bulgruuf asked, confused. "That can't be you..."

"It is me, my Jarl, but feel free to call me by my real name, which I recently discovered," Claire said.

"Oh?" Bulgruuf began. "What could that be?"

"My lord," Irileth interrupted. "This may be some disguise created by a Dremora. We can't excuse caution. Not in these times."

"Perhaps we should ask her some questions only your real Thane would know," Proventus suggested.

"That would probably be best, Proventus," Bulgruuf said. "Tell me, when you came before me, where did I send you, what did you retrieve, and for who?"

"The first time I came before you, you said your court wizard, Farengar, needed an able assistant with some research on dragons he was conducting. As such, he asked me to go to Bleak Falls Barrow and retrieve an ancient stone tablet for him, which turned out to be a map of ancient dragon burial mounds that Delphine wanted. Immediately after I got back, you were speaking with a guard, who said a dragon was attacking the Western Watchtower. When Irileth, a few guards and I arrived at the scene, the dragon had left for a short time, but returned. After killing it and I consumed its soul, the Greybeards called on my way back to Whiterun..."

"I think you've verified yourself enough," Bulgruuf interrupted, raising a hand. "Cut her loose. So, tell me, what is your name? How did you find it, and where in Oblivion did you get armor made of solid gold?"

"Claire Delgreind, last heir of the forgotten Great House Seranaan, and descendent of the dragon priest Kohnarin."

"Do you have any proof regarding your claimed history?" Bulgruuf asked, skeptical.

"It's all right here in this journal," Claire said, handing Bulgruuf the large, red book she found. Bulgruuf flipped to the first page, and found many entries by Kohnarin, and as he flipped through some more, eventually finding entries by Saveros. "But that does not explain how you got the armor."

"On my way there, I noticed some Thalmor having trouble with an invisible, magic barrier. I passed through without issue, and every time I held the sword Vedvenin up to an alter, the wall split into fourths. I am without Konharik's protection now, but he said I would no longer need it."

"What were the odds?" A guard asked. "A descendent of a dragon priest, Morrowind royalty, and dragonborn."

"Now," Claire began. "I must see General Tullius immediately."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Everyone starts to run away from Claire and the...

choices: The meeting continues, or Eoin walks in.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
As Claire entered the Castle Dower, she over-heard an argument.

"For the price of assisting you in getting rid of this menace, we want Markarth," Ulfric said in an exchange of demands.

"All of Tamriel is in mortal danger and all you can think about is what you want from this war?" Tullius asked in disgust. "The Legion has bigger problems to deal with, Ulfric. Daedra are pouring into Skyrim by the thousands, and all you can think about is the war!? Your men and mine are having enough trouble keeping them out of Solitude, as it stands! Eoin has informed me that even he can't put a scratch on this Dwemer menace..."

"Of course an Argonian wouldn't be able to put a scratch on an ancient being, he's not a Nord."

"Then why don't I hear about you trying to stick your sword through him, huh? Is it because you're a coward that will only kill unarmed kings?" Tullius asked, raising his voice.

"General," Legate Rikke began. "Someone is here." Tullius looked over and saw Claire, in gold armor.

"Vedvenin?" Tullius asked. "What's with the armor? There isn't some ceremony going on that I don't know about, is there?"

"The name's Claire, General. Long story short, I got this armor from the tomb of Kohnarik, my ancient ancestor, who left it for me as my inheritance from him."

"Kohnarik?" Ulfric asked, in disbelief. "You mean the dragon priest?"

"Yes," Claire began. "Enough about that, we need to figure out how we're going to get to Windhelm and dethrone that Dwemer."

"But how are we going to do that?" Tullius asked. "Not even Eoin's blades can put a scratch on him."

"Faasnuhavnodun," Claire began. "This sword can cut through anything, magical or material. Jacob should be here in a few minutes."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Meeting with General Tullius and Ulfric.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Jacob entered through the same way Claire did. He walked in as Ulfric, Tullius, and Claire turned to look at him. His arm was Light Stahlrim but of a grey and red variation. His two swords glew an ominous red in their sheaths. "What's with the armor change Jacob?" Claire asked.

"I'll explain later," Jacob said, then turned to the two leaders, "I've determined the locations the Daedra seem to appear from. One is North of Markarth, another is Southwest of Riften, and another from the mountains of South of Falkreath. We should focus on repelling the invasion first, then push to each of these locations."

"Fine work Stormblade," Ulfric commented, "Head on to the one North of Markarth and see if you can find out more." Jacob nodded and turned.

"Wait a moment," Tullius said, "Claire, would you accompany this...Stormcloak to this Daedric spawning ground?"

Does she?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Jacob walks in.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: "Of course, General," Claire said.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Yes

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
As the two dragonborn headed south, toward the Oblivion gate, there was a surprising lack of Daedra.

"Tell me, Jacob," Claire began, breaking the silence. "Why did you join the Stormcloaks? Surely it must go deeper than the 'freedom' of Skyrim Ulfric proposes?"
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Markarth Oblivion gate.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Jacob continued riding his horse as he told about it. "Honestly, I'm not sure. I guess it was just since I felt useless in the beginning. Than there was the whole rebellion and the empire and everything. Than, what really did it is when the took my sister, who worshipped Talos. I tried to stop them but they beat me pretty good. That story's on the left side of my face," Jacob said, hinting to his heavily scarred face and dead eye, "so I joined up with Ulfric. And I know he has flaws, but I don't want to live in fear of being dragged out of my house or killed at night by them. Or worse."

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Jacob answers her question.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
The two dragonborn rode towards the oblivion gate watching as it pulsed and hummed with power. The landscape was charred and corrupted. As both Jacob and Claire approached the gate a figure strode through , it was Eoin ,

"Hello friends!" Bellowed Eoin "I hope you brought your blades" he said as he drew his own and turned towards the gate again.
A horde of daedra poured through wielding swords and axes. Eoin fought with ferocious strength maybe even rivalling Claire, as his friends rode towards him. Claire leaped from her horse and began cutting her way towards Eoin. Jacob rode his horse still cutting down and Daedra attempting to break away from the fight
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Gateway to hell

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: For every Daedra they killed, ten more appeared, and it wasn't long before they became surrounded by thousands of angry Dremora. Claire's sword, Vedvenin had a torrent of dark energy spiraling around the blade, while the whole of Faasnuhavnodun glowed with a brilliant light.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: More fighting

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: So, what happens?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Something big happens.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content: What about one of those huge siege engines
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Daedric siege engine

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
A huge Dadric machination loomed menacingly as the Dremora fell back behind it. Claire charged it, trying to pierce its armor with Faasnuhavnodun, but to no avail.

"How do we kill this thing!?" Claire shouted.

"There's usually a Great Gate that it came through," Eoin called back. "If we destroy that, this thing dies! But it would seem that there isn't one!"

"We're boned," Jacob sighed. "Looks like I'll see the two of you in Sovngarde!"

"Not so fast, Jacob!" Claire called back. "I have an idea. It's risky, but it's all we've got!"

"What's the plan?" Jacob asked.

"I'll deal with this abomination, while you two back up a safe distance!" She shouted. "Trust me!" Eoin and Jacob retreated as they were ordered . After a few minutes of running, with Claire distracting the Siege Machine, they turned back to watch. They look to be far enough away, Claire thought. Either this works or it doesn't. Either way, I most likely won't be of any service to Tamriel any longer. She sprinted along a cliff's side, and used a Juniper tree to catapult herself into the machination's open front.


------



There was an explosion at either end of the Siege Engine, and it fell over barely seconds after. Several seconds after hitting the ground, there was a massive explosion that incinerated the immediate area around it, and the shockwave felled trees a hundred meters behind where Jacob and Eoin were standing, blasting the two of them off their feet.

"I'll be damned!" Jacob exclaimed. "She did it!" A yellow dot was visible in the sky, and gradually became larger. After some seconds, the object landed between Jacob and Eoin. It was Claire's helmet. Jacob's excitement turned to melancholy as he realized the loss of his friend. "May you find eternal joy in Sovngarde," he said to the helmet. "Come on, Eoin. We need to get back to Solitude with the news."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Markarth is doomed

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Jacob was riding his horse alongside Eoin when he stopped. "Huh? What is it Jacob?" Eoin asked.

Jacob turned to the Argonian, "Go on ahead and tell them what happened. I need to do something first."

"What? Jacob, you aren't-"

"Go!" Jacob yelled as he pulled his horse away. Eoin sighed as he ran on to Solitude.

----------------

Jacob rode his horse right outside the grounds of which they just cleared. He dismounted his horse and searched upon the ashes of Dremora for any sign of Claire. He did that all the way up to the piles of ash in the area the Siege Engine Claire destroyed was. Jacob walked through the giant open field of ash, pushing away larger piles of ash. He quickly lit a torch as it got darker and continued through until he saw...

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: On the way to Solitude.

choices: ...Faashnuhavnodun with its blade in the soil.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Vedvenin stood amongst the ashen wasteland with its blade buried into the ash and soil, its black hilt appeared as a shadow.

"How much stuff did she lose?" Jacob asked himself as he picked up the sword. Something glowed in the corner of his eye when he picked up the sword. When he turned, he saw...
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: ....Claire's sword, Vedvenin.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Jacob then saw the glint of a gold streak crossing across armor. He noticed Claire buried somewhat under ash as and arm stuck out holding Faasnuhavnodun tightly. "Claire!" Jacob yelled as he ran to her body. He knelt beside her and shook her lightly, "You okay? Say something!" He felt for a pulse a saw she was still alive. He quickly through Claire over his shoulder and carried her swords in there sheath as he placed her over his horse and rode back to Solitude. "Hang on Claire..."

--------------------

Jacob burst through Solitude's gates as he rode in front of Tullius, Ulfric, and Eoin. "Eoin, check back outside, can you make sure I wasn't followed?"

"Will do," he replied as he went through the gate.

"General Tullius, do you have an infirmary somewhere?"

"Yes but it's already overflowing," Tullius informed him, "We need another place to take her."

Jacob realized the perfect place, "I know where. Ready forces from the Falkreath Gate, that's where the rest of them are coming from." Jacob then ran toward the Temple of the Divines.

Jacob burst through the door and quickly looked around. Vacant. Jacob found one of the beds of a priest there and laid Claire down. He placed the two swords next to her bed and the helmet on a nearby nightstand. Jacob then took old fine clothes and ripped the linen, using the strips as bandages. He bandaged Claire up and waited inside the temple.

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: ...Claire clutching Faasnuhavnodun, unconscious.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Claire woke up with a jolt, sitting upright. Jacob saw she was awake and ran to her side only to be choked my her. It seemed she was slightly delirious from the explosion. Jacob got free from her grip and shouted for help from the priests. He backed away to a bench as the priests restrained and treated a slightly more lucid Claire. Eoin strode in getting a few dark looks from the priests.

"How is she?" Asked Eoin sitting beside Jacob "You were followed by the way, some necromancer"

"She's ok I think" replied Jacob rubbing his throat " And thanks I couldn't be as careful as normal"

I understand" said Eoin resting a hand on Jacobs shoulder "now if you excuse me I need to make myself comfortable"
This made Jacob slightly confused by which his Argonian friend meant but as he watched Eoin climbed up onto a rafter.
____________________________________________________________________________ _______________________

Twenty minutes passed before either spoke again but as Jacob was about to ask a question about the oblivion crysis ...
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Claire wakes up

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Claire groggily opened her eyes, and was thrown into a coughing fit. After it subsided, she looked at Jacob, then up into the rafters at Eoin.

"How long was I out?" She asked.

"Little more than a day," Jacob said. "I could've done without you trying to kill me, though."

"I'm sorry," Claire began. "But I have no memory of that. I wasn't expecting to survive that explosion, either. Guess I'm tougher than I thought."
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Claire wakes up again

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"I'm still curious, Jacob said, "What did you do to that Siege Engine to stop it?"

She turned her head, not sitting up and looked at Jacob, "I got myself in with the working machinery and created a Fire Storm. It was pretty unstable and really did a number on me as you see."

"Yeah," Jacob commented, "What you did was risky, glad you pulled through."

What happens next?
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: They continue to chat.

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"We still have on more gate to deal with, though," Eoin said. "But in your condition, we probably won't be able to do anything about it."

"Have you forgotten?" Claire asked. "I have healing magics." She cast Grand Healing on herself, and the burns and singe marks disappeared. She got up and equipped her armor and sheathed her swords. "So, are you two ready?" She asked with renewed confidence and vigor, with a slight smirk appearing on her face as she faced them.
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: Eoin speaks up

choices: They trust him enough to guide them
No way. He can come but not lead
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
Let's go" said Eoin seeing Claire healed he tossed her her helm which she got with no effort.
Suddenly Eoin, now near the door , fell to one knee, gasping for breath.
Jacob raises an eyebrow but Claire asks "are you ok Eoin?"
"I'm fine" said Eoin standing up again but I fear Whiterun is not".
This got both Claire and Jacobs attention

What's happened at whiterun" asked Claire quickly some of her monotone facade breaking.
"Great gates" said Eoin "At least six"
"There's no way to get there in time" shouted Jacob rearming himself quickly
"There is one way, ill take us through oblivion"

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"Hold on," Claire began. "What are you doing in Tamriel?"

"Is it too much to ask to wonder around for a few minutes?" Sheogorath asked. "It's been a couple thousand years since I've set foot here, at least! Now, I can't stay long, mind you. A Daedric Lord actually has his draw-backs. With me, if I stay in your plane too long, I will become mortal and lose all of my powers! Then I'll just be a madman! That wouldn't be any fun at all! Besides, if I were to destroy Nirn, just as Merhunes Dagon did, there'd be no fun to be had. It's no fun to torment an undead or a Dremora! So, I would like you three to come with me to New Sheoth. I will explain what I have found out about this new thorn in your backsides!"
1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.title: They stick with him. Who knows what sheogorath ...

1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"Now then," Sheogorath began. "To save time, I'll transport us all there!" All four of them were swallowed up by portals to New Sheoth. Sheogorath stood in front of them on the other side of a banquet table. "Have a seat. I'm going to drop my insanity for a few moments to explain the situation."

"Alright," Jacob said. "What's this Dwemer up to?"

"Ah," Sheogorath began. "So you already know about this nuisance, hm? Well, the situation is a little more... severe than you might think."

"What could possibly be so bad about this guy that the Daedric Lord of Madness is suddenly so.... sane?" Claire asked.

"Since you're wondering, lass, this Dwemer has robbed the library of Hermaeus Mora of knowledge that even he kept from himself. The knowledge to steal the power of the Daedra and Aedra and use it as your own. Even though we have time, there isn't a lot of it to go around. He isn't out to destroy all of Tamriel. He's out to kill you three before you can stop him."

"How did you find all of this out?" Eoin asked.

"Haskill," Sheogorath began. "I turn my back for three days and he comes back with incredible information. Sometimes I underestimate him." A platter containing a large treat was placed on the table. "A strawberry tort! Come, friends! Let's eat, then we'll work on increasing your power to equal his."

"The town guard has informed me that there may be someone conspiring against me, but they don't know the motive, who it is, or who is working with them. They all say it was a masked man who came to them, and offered them bags of coin for their services to his master."

"So," Jacob began. "What you're telling me is that someone's trying to get the guard in their pocket so they can attack you directly?"

"That's it, exactly," Claire said. "I am easily one of the most influential people in all of Tamriel, so I have my rivals."

"No one. Yet," Claire began. "I just want you to find evidence that they're planning to send in an assassin or something. I have my hunches, but I'm thinking it couldn't be anyone other than the Black-Briars, the Thalmor, and some other influential people."

"Hold on," Jacob said. "You said you were a descendent of Kohmarik, and the last heir of some House Seranaan, but that doesn't explain how you got that armor and those swords."

"The ebony sword," Claire began. "Vedvenin was passed down to me from my father, and was confiscated by the Imperial Legion when I was captured. It was recently returned to me. However, a prophecy stated that the only one Vedvenin would allow itself to be wielded by and grant its true power to was a child born of fire and orphaned by flames. Such a child was to be the last heir of House Seranaan, a forgotten Great House of Morrowind and a direct descendent of the dragon priest Kohnarik. Only that child would have been allowed into Kohnarik's tomb with the sword in hand. The other sword, Fassnuhavnodun, which translates as Fearless Brutal Grace, was found next to the suit of gold armor I am currently wearing."

"But isn't gold a soft metal, useless for armor and weapons smithing?" Eoin asked.

"This is no ordinary gold, Eoin," Claire continued. "It's like Stalhrim, almost completely indestructible, and requires a specific tool or process to mold it. This suit may be the only one of its kind left. And if you want to know how I found this out, I stumbled upon a journal in the basement of what was left of my parent's house. 1513111111211112212111212112111122211222.content:
"No," Tullius said. "She has never been one to become as angry as she was and harm another without a trigger. Hadvar, for example has witnessed her in battle, and she has never turned against an Imperial soldier in blind, unprovoked rage. Stacked onto that, she has never used the Voice unless absolutely necessary. Now, I don't know what that fit was all about, but I'm sure it wasn't without a trigger. She kept yelling at someone that wasn't there, or at least, we couldn't see or hear."

"Looks like you've lost your trump card in this war, Tullius," Ulfric said, meaning to taunt Tullius. "Now, take your Thalmor and your puppets and get out of my country. You've already lost this war."

"Did you just open your mouth to gloat, or can we talk business?" Tullius asked, irritated. "I'm against the Thalmor, myself, and I intended to start a real war with them once we're through here. Who do you think is the only faction that benefits from this foolish conflict? The Thalmor. Who do you think is keeping this conflict going? The Thalmor."

"You pin everything on the Thalmor, who have no play in our side," Ulfric said. "Yet, you receive aid from them and let them prowl our lands."

"I never agreed to the terms of the treaty, Ulfric!" Tullius exclaimed. "I was never aloud to voice my opinion, and neither were the Jarls! We were told the terms, and we had to like them! Besides, my scouts have reported Aldmari troops moving some excessively large cargo into southern Winterhold. Your territory."

154.content:
Electricity arced over the Breton's form, leaping out from his hands and arms as he fell to the stone floor on his hands and knees, breathing heavily. Gasping in a lungful of cold air, he slowly raised his head to identify his aggressor.

Greyish robes adorned with numerous fetishes fashioned from dragon scales; gloves covered with a protective layer of yet more dragon scales; boots formed of what seemed to be a thick, brown leather; and a golden mask resembling some twisted, corrupted squid, narrow eyeslits doing nothing to lessen the mixture of lethal pride, utter disdain, and pure arrogance that seemed to radiate outwards from what little the Dovahkiin could see of his eyes.

Flanking him, two vaguely human... Things, floating roughly two feet off the ground, their shoulders and backs draped in layers green cloth, withered arms hanging in the air in front of them. Where their legs should have been, however, was simply a writhing collection of tentacles, each one probing the air surrounding it. Their faces... No, their heads, resembled that of a malformed octopus, tentacles jutting off at different angles, grey eyes directing their baleful gaze at him.

The robed figure stepped forward, his deep and resonant voice audible throughout the entire area.

"Who are you, to dare set foot here?" He regarded the Dovahkiin for a moment, as if realising something. "Aah... You are dragonborn. I can feel it, and yet..."

He trailed off for several seconds, most likely deep in thought. He resumed talking, a sense of grudging respect creeping into his voice, which displayed a strong Nordic accent.

"So you have slain Alduin... Well done. I could have slain him myself, back when I walked the earth, but I chose a different path."

The figure, who had been confirmed as being Miraak, continued.

"You have no idea of the true power a Dragonborn can wield! Mul... Qah Div!" Ethereal armour resembling the spikes and spines of a dragon materialised over Miraak.

"This realm is beyond you. You have no power here, and it is only a matter of time before Solstheim is also mine. I already control the minds of its people. Soon they will finish building my temple, and I can return home."

Miraak turned to the abomination flanking his left side, drawing in a breath. "Send him back where he came from." The abomination began to float closer and closer to the Dovahkiin, now joined by the other squid-human thing, as Miraak turned from the Dovahkiin, and began to walk away. "He can await my arrival, with the rest of Tamriel..."

The two abominations began to blast the Dovahkiin with spell after spell, who locked his jaws together, not giving them the satisfaction of seeing his pain, meaningless words floating inside his head a fraction of a second before he lost consciousness.

Name: Azalvaunt (Real name: Hulgar Arnand)
Species: Breton
Allegiance: Imperial
Armour: Daedric set, Konahrik Mask
Weapon: Daedric 2H Sword, Daedric Mace
Magic: Destruction (Novice - Adept), Conjuration (Master), Restoration (Novce - Apprentice), Alteration (Novice)
Most used shout: Unrelenting Force

So, let's have three branches, shall we? The first one is where I shall focus my attention (Although others are perfectly welcome to add, although I request that you wait until I have added at least one more chapter), and the others are for anybody else's take on Azalvaunt.
154.title: The Temple of Miraak

1541.content: So, shall we follow Azalvaunt after he is ejected from Apocrypha, rewind to an earlier point in time to establish his character, or fast forward to some event after the Temple of Miraak quest?
1541.title: Storyline 1 (Mainly my storyline)

15412.content:
Azalvaunt held his steel blade in a reverse grip and plunged it into the Stormcloak's shoulder before ripping it out in a spray of blood. Dropping the blade, he swiftly retrieved the mace of a dead Stormcloak, turning to face the last that still lived.

Azalvaunt drew in a breath and charged at the rebel, ramming into him and sending them both crashing to the ground. Lifting his newly acquired mace above his head, Azalvaunt brought it down on the dazed Stormcloak's head, crushing most of the skull even through the helmet.

His stamina spent, he rolled off the corpse and lay there for a while, getting his breath back. Pushing himself to his feet, Azalvaunt surveyed the remains of his would-be ambushers before slowly trudging away from the site of the small skirmish.

Several hours and a carriage ride later, Azalvaunt weakly flopped onto his bed inside Breezehome, his small house in whiterun. Yawning, the Breton felt himself slowly slip into unconsciousness as his fatigue finally caught up with him.
15412.title: Past

choices: Check the bounties at the Bannered Mare! Crush the bandit scum!
Observe the local wildlife (I.E. Whiterun guards) in their natural habitat...
154121.content:
Azalvaunt limply hung from Alduin's claws, blood matting his long hair. He tried to breath deeply for one last defiant Thu'um, but his lungs would simply not co-operate. He gave a weak cough, blood spilling from his mouth as he did so, and began to slip off Alduin's blood soaked talons, falling the short distance to the ground. Both Stormcloaks and Imperials lay in heaps, their bodies ignored by all as Tullius and Ulfric stood atop the mountain of corpses, engaged in a fierce duel, neither able to see Alduin as he encroached upon them, about to deliver one last shout that would seal the rate of the world-

Azalvaunt jerked awake from the nightmare, taking a few seconds to realise where he was and that Skyrim had not been ground underfoot by the World-Eater himself. Rubbing his eyes, Azalvaunt slowly sat up, the sheets receding as he slowly got out of bed. Azalvaunt sighed. This was the second time within twice as many days that he had experienced a nightmare, something that had not happened since his childhood.

There was the distinct possibility that his lycanthropism was connected to it somehow. He had heard several of the companions, engaged in their own conversations, muttering about the impossibility of experiencing true rest at night. Hopefully the onslaught of terrifying visions plaguing his slumber was simply caused by the immense stress of trying to save the world. Yes, that sounded likely.

He frowned. If stress was contributing to his nightmares he would need to find a way to somehow get Nazeem to shut up, at least for a while. The arrogant Redguard never stopped talking about the Cloud District with whoever was in earshot, and Azalvaunt couldn't give less of a shit about the pretentious farmer's daily activities. Ahlam's comments about him stuffing himself up Balgruuf's rear helped to alleviate the rage one felt when dealing with him, however.

Sigurd was little better, always enthusiastically spouting his position at Belethor's store as if his life depended on it. At least he was good at chopping firewood.

Cracking several of his joints, Azalvaunt began to formulate a general plan for the day...
154121.title: Unrestful Sleep

1541211.content:
Azalvaunt quickly geared up in his steel plate armor and snatched the Orcish mace leaning against his nightstand. He was ready to bring justice to the lawless.

         As he exited his home, he noticed a woman in Daedric armor with a sword comprised of what looked like dragon bone quickly walked past. The air about her bristled with magic energies, as if she were a living conduit of immense magical power and had no choice but to irradiate the residuals into the atmosphere, though a fair amount of him felt it was just her armor. Quickly, he picked up a brisk pace toward the Bannered Mare to get at least one bounty before they were all gone.

         Hilda noticed him enter immediately and said, "The woman that just walked out took the last bounty letter I had. I can, however, mark on your map, where she was headed. If you hurry, you can still catch her." The Breton feverishly handed Hilda his map, and she marked the location of his target.

         Fort Greymoore wasn't too far of a walk. Maybe four hours, but he had made much longer treks. When he finally arrived at the ancient fortress, however, the scene he found was grizzly. Bandits had their weapons and armor cut to ribbons by what seemed to be a very sharp blade. A bandit in scaled armor limped up to Azalvaunt and collapsed at his feet, dropping a steel greatsword, in which much of its blade had been shewn clean off about an inch before the cross-guard. There were no visible fractures in the blade, just a smooth, featureless cut that had rendered the weapon useless. Azalvaunt felt pressure on his legs and looked down to see the bandit clawing at his armor.

         "Please," the bandit cried feebly. He had a strong look of desperation in his face. "Help me!"

         When Azalvaunt looked at him more closely, he had numerous lacerations in his skin, some deeper than others, and metal studs in his armor suffered the same fate as his weapon. The bandit succumbed to his wounds and fell limp, into a heap on the blood-soaked earth. Drawing his mace, he made his way into the fort, where he was met with more death and a lot more blood. After taking a few steps and surveying the scene, he was pressed against a wall by a Daedric shield, and there was a sword against his neck.

         "You're no bandit," the woman pressing her shield into his gut said, flustered. "They would've foolishly fought back to their last breath." She removed her sword and shield from Azalvaunt's body.

         "You- you're the same one from earlier in Whiterun," Azalvaunt began between breaths as he gathered himself to assess the figure before him. "You killed all of those bandits?"

         "What kind of question is that?" She asked. "Of course I did. Those bounties don't complete themselves, you know."

         "If I may, can I see your face, so I may recognize you if we meet again?" Though he wasn't expecting her to actually fill his request, she removed her helmet, revealing a young Dunmer with short, silver hair that didn't extend past her neck, with a few strands in front of her left ear, garnet-red eyes, and pale, blue-gray skin. She left without another word.
1541211.title: Check the bounties at the Bannered Mare! Crush ...

15412111.content:
Azalvaunt surveyed the scene of carnage around him, looking at each dead body to see if they looked rich enough to carry anything worthwhile. As was the case with most bandits, several carried small coin pouches, which Azalvaunt looted. Seeing the bandit that had pleaded to him for help twitching slightly, he moved silently over to the marauder and stamped down hard on his neck, several slight cracking noises signifying that the bandit was definitely dead.

Checking his money pouch while walking and verifying that he did indeed have enough money for a horse, Azalvaunt rolled his shoulders and began to sprint, enjoying the enhanced... Well, everything, that the dragon souls he absorbed granted him. More magica, more stamina, and even harder to kill, making him that bit more deadly with each slain dragon, yet somehow not affecting his appearance at all. You'd think someone who could survive a greatsword blow to the stomach would resemble a stone wall, but Azalvaunt's figure remained the same as it was when he had first entered Skyrim: tall, well muscled although not to the extent of the Nords, and still sporting a somewhat gaunt appearance despite the rich food of Skyrim's cities.

Azalvaunt began to salivate, and the battlemage had to consciously stop himself from running his tongue over the bottom of his canines as his thoughts briefly drifted to venison stew for a few seconds. Swallowing, then drawing in a deep breath, Azalvaunt continued his trek along the road to whiterun, forcibly controlling his urge to feed, wrestling it back down until it could be used to assume his werewolf form during combat.

So, does Azalvaunt arrive at Whiterun Stables, or does he visit the Bannered Mare again?
15412111.title: The road back to Whiterun.

154121112.content:
"A man like you needs a warhorse, I reckon."

Azalvaunt glanced at the dark brown mare a few meters to his left. "How old are your horses, Skulvar?". The nord took Second to think before replaying, "None of them are older than nine, and the youngest is six." He gestured to the mare Azalvaunt had briefly inspected. "Now, the one I've got for sale is seven years old, but in fine health. She's got a lot of spirit, that one. We've taken to calling her Queen Alfsigr-" Azalvaunt winced internally at the clunky name "- Or just Allie for short. I suppose you can name her anything you like once she's yours."

Azalvaunt nodded, already checking the small bag of Septims he had withdrawn before handing it to Skulvar, who did the same. Asking Skulvar to take care of his new horse for now, and paying him a little extra for the service, Azalvaunt jogged the distance to Whiterun's main gate before entering.

After changing back into his normal clothes before a quick rest in Breezehome, Azalvaunt retrieved an iron dagger and tucked it into a mostly hidden leather scabbard at his hip.

--------------------------------------------



Gently pushing open the door to the Bannered Mare, Azalvaunt's eyes took a moment to adjust to the light cast by the roaring fire in the center of the room.

Seeing Uthgerd in her corner, Azalvaunt thought maybe he could satisfy her request for another brawl.

What happens next?
154121112.title: A Faithful Steed

1541211122.content:
"Perhaps brawling isn't the best idea..." Azalvaunt thought as he sat down on the left bench, ordering a mead when Saadia did her rounds.

Azalvaunt was most likely correct in thinking this, for several reasons: He had spent the past several hours walking; his huntlust was becoming almost unbearable, which could trigger an unwitting transformation if he pushed himself; Uthgerd was still in her armour and would need time to change out of it; and to top it all off, he could honestly snap Uthgerd like a twig if he was particularly inclined.

"Focus on the mead, Hulgar. And the music. Focus on Mikael's words. Well, the ones that aren't trying to shamelessly flirt with every woman in the city"

Azalvaunt blinked. Had it really been that long since he had used his own name to refer to himself? The reason the had crossed the border in the first place was because he was fleeing from a rather large group of villagers who had discovered both his home at the time - a large, and rather warm cave - and his necromantic learnings.

Azalvaunt's expression soured imperceptibly. Damnit, he'd paid for those bodies, and handled them with the respect that a dead man or woman otherwise deserved! Then the uneducated masses rolled in, led by the same merchant who had secretly sold him the corpses, who seemingly wanted both his money back, and any possessions of Azalvaunt's he could sell for a nice, tidy, profit.

Azalvaunt had fled over the border, being apprehended by an imperial patrol. Figuring a jail sentence would be preferable to being mauled to death by a mob, he had allowed himself to be bound and tossed in the back of a carriage before blacking out. Only once they reached Helgen did he realise the fate that he thought had awaited him at the time, due to being in the company of a particular rebel.

Sighing, Azalvaunt swigged from the bottle, letting to cool, sweet, drink take away his momentary troubles.
1541211122.title: Nord Mead

choices: Ask Vilkas about these nightmares, they keep getting worse!
Take the new horse out for a ride...
