̲͔̱͓̤͍̣̀
----

Azalvaunt felt the edges of his mind fraying like shit. Coughing up blood Groaning, he sat up from the cold, stone floor warm embrace of his bed, the covers beckoning him into dreadful peaceful sleep. Reaching for his sword swinging his legs over the side of the bed, he concentrated on walking and tried to ignore the harsh throbbing pain of the mortal wound hangover. Managing to stumble downstairs on the charred stump unsteady legs, he collapsed sat down at the table, weeping moaning.

Azalvaunt blinked, attempting to focus his thoughts. He had just had the worst nightmare he could ever remember experiencing, yet he could recall so little of it. It was unreal, in a way, as if it had never actually happened. Gently shaking his head from side to side, Azalvaunt once again formulated a mental plan for the day...
15412111221.title: Alok

154121112212.content:
Deciding to spend the next few hours recovering from the abject terror of his indecipherable dream, and to see if he could potentially make sense of it, Azalvaunt slipped on his armour and placed his sword in its' scabbard on his hip, before setting off at a slow pace to Whiterun's stables.

Fitting his as of yet unnamed steed with a saddle, Azalvaunt guided the horse out of the stable and next to a large rock embedded on the path leading out of Whiterun. Keeping the rein in his hand while balancing on the rock, Azalvaunt hooked his leg over the saddle, finding the extra height made it much easier to mount the horse. Azalvaunt made a quick mental note to learn how to better mount a steed without any assistance from Skyrim's landscape.

Digging his armoured heels into the horses sides proved sufficient to spur the mare into a gallop, Azalvaunt guiding her to the right, in the direction of the western watchtower. Scenery passed by in a green almost-blur, a slight wind touching Azalvaunt's bared face. A genuine smile, one unmarred by sadistic bloodlust or drunken stupor gradually widened on Azalvaunt's face as he brought the horse down to a quick trot, showing teeth naturally sharpened just enough to make an attentive person somewhat uncomfortable.

Further slowing the Kate's speed to just above that of walking, Azalvaunt let out a contented sigh. Yes, this had definitely been the right choice, he could barely even remember the fear he had experienced less that half an hour ago. Cracking his neck in both directions, Azalvaunt began to think of possible names for his steed. Simply calling it 'Horse' wouldn't do, and would most likely not register as snake within the animal's mind.

What name does Azalvaunt choose?
154121112212.title: Nahlaas

choices: Azalvaunt thinks back on his entrance into Skyrim at Helgen
Azalvaunt remembers the battle with Mirmulnir
1541211122121.content:
"I think I'll call you... Freyja."

Azalvaunt thought the name over in his head for a few seconds. There didn't seem to be anything wrong with the name, and he couldn't think of a reason not to using. Spurring Freyja onwards into another gallop, Azalvaunt slowed her once they came to a familiar ruin by the side of the path.

The Western Watchtower.

Azalvaunt dismounted, breathing in the clear air as he walked to the entrance of the almost-ruin, brushing his hands against chunks of masonry that had fallen during Mirmulnir's first attack. Azalvaunt looked at the entrance to the structure, ascertaining its height and comparing it to Freyja's. yes, she'd be able to fit in there. She could rest and he could reminisce.

Walking back to the mare and putting a hand underneath her head, Azalvaunt began to guide her into the watchtower, slowly walking backwards.

Once she was inside and resting, Azalvaunt sat beside the horse and closed his eyes, letting his head tilt backwards slightly as memories rushed through his mind...
1541211122121.title: Freyja

15412111221211.content:
Hulgar's eyes weakly fluttered open, and he blinked to clear his vision. Sitting in front of him was a man wearing what appeared to be a blue robe over chain mail, and fur trousers and boots. Like Hulgar, his hands were bound. Looking to his left, Hulgar saw a sight that made his blood run cold. An Imperial soldier in full armour, guiding the horse that was pulling the carriage he and the blonde haired man were sitting in.

Turning to his right, Hulgar saw a man in tattered clothes, his hair and face dark. Directly to his right sat a man in what he assumed to be fur robes of some kind, his blonde hair swept back, and a strip of cloth tied around his mouth and the back of his neck, acting as a gag.
All of them had their wrists tied together.

"Hey, you! You're finally awake!"

Hulgar turned back to the man in front of him.

"You were trying to cross the border, right? Walked right into that Imperial ambush, same as us, and that thief over there."

The man, whom Hulgar recognised as a Nord due to his accent, indicated the man with tattered clothes by tilting his head to Hulgar's right.

"Damn Stormcloaks... Skyrim was fine until you came along, the Empire was nice and lazy. If they hadn't been looking for you, I'd have stolen that horse and I'd be halfway to Hammerfell."

The man stopped scowling and looked Hulgar straight in the eyes.

"You there, you and me, we shouldn't be here. It's these Stormcloaks the Empire wants."

The Nord in front of Hulgar snorted through his nostrils.

"We're all brothers and sisters in binds, now, thief."

The Imperial turned his head towards them.
"Shut up back there!"

The thief turned to the Nord at Hulgar's right. "What's wrong with him, huh?"

The first Nord's face displayed anger - not quite rage, but somewhere in between that and mild anger. "Watch your tongue! You're speaking to Ulfric Stormcloak, the true high king!"

"Ulfric, jarl of Windhelm? You're the leader of the rebellion, if they captured you - oh gods, where are they taking us?" The first Nord's face displayed a look of resignation. "I don't know where we're going, but Sovngarde awaits..." The thief's eyes bulges out of their sockets as his face flushed white. "No, this can't be happening, this isn't happening!"

The first Nord's voice grew gentle as he spoke, trying to calm the thief. "Hey, what village are you from, horse thief?" The thief turned to him. "Why do you care?" The Nord smiled sadly. "A Nord's last thoughts... should be of home..."
"Rorikstead. I'm - I'm from rorikstead."

The occupants of the cart grew silent as it continued on its journey, growing closer to wherever they were being taken. Hulgar sighted thatched roofs and stone fortifications, and a sense of fear and dread settled in his stomach.
15412111221211.title: Brothers and Sisters in Binds

1551.content:
"Alright, I'm in. I'll report any information I find. General," Jacob added with a smirk.

Nighttime came. Jacob rented room in an inn across from House Delgreind, when he noticed a man attack a guard before pulling him into the shadows. Jacob descended to the streets and cloaked himself. He snuck behind the shadowy figure and gagged and bonded him. Jacob then saw the man was...

The vision shouted its voice sounding of echoes "what ruins" coughed Jacob struggling for air "the ruins outside Kvatch, you must make things right!" Yelled the vision and as suddenly as it had happened Jacob stood there still again watching the same old man

155111.content:
-The next day-

Jacob rode alongside Claire as they reached these ruins. "This the place?" Claire asked as they pulled their horses to a stop.

"Yeah. I was told the ruins outside Kvatch. And here they are." Jacob replied. As the two dismounted, they saw from the ruins...
155111.title: He goes to the ruins with Claire

choices: Normal Claire and Jacob lose a fight. Badly
1551111.content:
A shimmering image of Eoin shone at the door of the tomb. As Claire and Jacob approached the door the image spoke "Greetings if you have been summoned here something has gone wrong". "Wrong?" asked Claire. The image did not reply but instead the door swung open to reveal a tunnel.

After following the tunnel for and hour, fighting zombies and ghosts (they are in cyrodil), when they reached the main chamber a large seal lay on the floor. It pulsed as the seal turned like a clock throbbing with a red glow. "What is it?" Asked Jacob "I'm not sure" said Claire "but if there's something wrong here and I think the seal is the problem". Claire walked onto the seal and examined the markings, she could not tell what the runes on the seal said as it seemed the were written in a Daedric script. She stood and saw a mold for a sword. She walked over to the mold and drew her blade. Suddenly as if magnetised her blade jumped into the mold and darkness engulfed both Claire and Jacob.

When they both awoke they saw two figures standing on the opposite side of the chamber. They stood over on the other side strapping on armour. They looked up to reveal that they were exact copies of Claire and Jacob
1551111.title: A ghostly image

15511112.content:
"What the hell is this?" Jacob yelled angrily at the copies. They just stood normally as if nothing ever happened. Claire and Jacob exchanged a look, "What should we do?"

Claire didn't trust then one bit. She pulled Her swords out and began charging the clone. "I'm not sure. But we kill first and ask questions later!" She swung as her copy quickly unsheathed her blades, identical, and blocked the attack. Jacob and his copy watched until the Jacob copy readied his bow and readied a Daedric arrow to launch at Claire. Claire looked and saw the spear launch toward her when Jacob dove in front of her and took it to the stomach. "Jacob!" Claire yelled as Jacob stood for another second and was knocked down by a second strike. In that moment, Claire's copy knocked her sword away and stabbed her blades through Claire's chest. Claire gasped as blood poured from her mouth and chest.

The Claire copy slid Claire off her blades and dropped her by Jacob as they were enveloped in darkness again.

Claire using the last of her Magicka healed herself to get herself standing. Her vision blurry, she looked and saw Jacob laying in a pool of blood with the arrows in his chest. She quickly grabbed him under his shoulder and dragged him through the tunnel they passed through. Time passed as they neared the exit. Jacob was coming to slightly. "You alright?" Claire asked, but only received a hoarse cough and a stream of blood as a reply. She pulled Jacob out and then rolled the stairs down. As she pushed herself up she saw someone on a horse riding towards them. Someone who looked strangely familiar...

Claire fell unconscious along with Jacob a moment later.

What happens next?

"What...Eoin...?" Claire said delirious and weak. Eoin turned and saw Claire awake and knelt next to her.

"Don't move. You're heavily injured, just rest." Eoin said.

"But...Jacob...and them...?" Claire said losing real sense.

Eoin had her face him, "Listen to me, Claire. I don't know what happened, but you're in no position to operate. You or Jacob. Just rest please."

Claire let her head hang to the side as she stared mindlessly injured.

What happens next?

"Oh, the usual," Claire began sarcastically. "We let loose a couple of shape-shifting demons, or Daedra, or whatever they are, and got our asses kicked! Now, if you'll excuse me, I'll be back in Cheydinhal tending to my business." She proceeded to limp off.
1551111212111.title: Jacob regains consciousness

Jacob felt his body just full of pain and broken. He felt the two holes in his chest where that...thing, shot him. Jacob tried to sit up before coughing some more blood.

Jacob could only move his head side to side. He looked over to see Claire passing by, with an obvious limp. "Claire." Jacob said. She turned and looked down at him. "You can't just wander off with whatever those were wandering around. Could you at least stay low and rest until you're ready to go?"
15511112121111.title: One of them stops her.

choices: The copies or copy walk to the fire
155111121211111.content:
Claire turned to leave but Eoin spoke up "those things are you". Both Claire and Jacob turned to Eoin "yes both of those creatures are you. They look like you talk like you but are different in a few ways" said Eoin standing "they beat you in this fight because they had just been freed but their power will go down to match your own". "Well if there OUR copies why don't you have one?" Asked Jacob sarcasticly "because I killed mine. Sheogorath helped though and that was 200 years ago. These ones were also released differently".

You know an offal lot about these things...." Said Claire
155111121211111.title: Claire stays

155111121211112.content: "I'll be fine, Jacob," Claire said. "Cheydinhal's not too far from here. I've explored all of Cyrodiil before I went to Skyrim, so I know it like the back of my hand. Don't worry about me. I'll lay low until I'm better. I'll just have some of my contacts scour Tamriel for those things. And besides, I've got a large order to fill for the Imperial armed forces. I guess I'll be seeing you two around." She exited the cave, mounted Arvak, and made for Cheydinhal.

Jacob laid there for a moment until he finally pushed himself off the bed and fell. He landed as pain bolted through him, he quickly drank a potion of healing to get to his feet. He staggered around until he found his horse. Eoin ran towards him, "What are you doing?!" Eoin yelled after him.

"I'm heading to Cheydinhal," Jacob replied, "You didn't see them. There's no way Claire could take them in alone. I'm going." Jacob slammed a heel on a horse as it rode off toward Cheydinhal, Jacob trying to hold to his consciousness.

Jacob awoke in a cave not knowing how he had got there

3 hours earlier
Eoin ran out of the campsite after Claire. He needed to catch up to her

5 days later

Eoin and evil Claire arrived at a large temple in the heart of morrowind

155111121211112111212221112111212.content:
A bolt whistled past and exploded against a wall. When Claire's doppelganger looked over toward where the initial bolt came from, another darted from the other side of the room. She cast an explosive spell with no results. Another one came from the ceiling and embedded itself into the floor right between her feet.

"Damn." A female voice said. "Looks like my aim's a little rusty." They both looked up and saw the real Claire balancing on an ancient chandelier, wielding an Enhanced Dwarven Crossbow. She didn't even have a scratch on her. "Now, then," she continued. "Let's fight one on one. No cheap tricks, and no summoning either of those two to fight for you. This will be a real test of your skill. I did some research on you Doppelgangers. You know everything we know, and you're a mirror image of us. But there aer crucial differences, like personality and how you hold your weapon. You're sloppy and jerky, but you hardly leave any open area. Unlike me, where my motions are fluid and smooth, but powerful. Also, you don't have a scar."
155111121211112111212221112111212.title: Claire

1551111212111121112122211121112121.content:
Doppelgänger Claire held a hand out toward Eoin, motioning him to stay back. "That may be true, that we're different," she said, "but in a different way. I am made to be an improvement upon you, so is the other one. By the way, if you were looking for Jacob, he's closer than you thought." Evil Claire motioned to the soul gem Eoin was holding. "I have no scar because I was tougher during it all! I took my life into my own hands!"

Claire pulled out her blades as she held Vedvenin forward, "And now...I'll take yours."

Evil Claire pulled out copies of Claire's blades, however they had an aura off them. They were forged magically to match the original. Another difference. Eoin obeyed and watched as the battle unfolded.

Who will win?
1551111212111121112122211121112121.title: The fight commences.

15511112121111211121222111211121211.content:
They matched each other blow-for-blow, blocking each other and avoiding strikes with relative difficulty.

At least I now know how it is to fight me, Claire thought before proceeding with combat. She attempted a vertical strike, with Vedvenin's likeness blocking the strike, and Faasnuhavnodun stopping a blow from it's own.

Claire's doppelganger attempted to block a powerful sweep, with the original's swords blocking the copied weapons, seemingly learning their strengths, and exploiting their weaknesses, relaying them to Claire. Unbeknownst to her doppelganger, Vedvenin and Faasnuhavnodun slowly sapped their copies of strength, leading to fractures. After a particularly hefty blow, the doppelganger's swords shattered on contact with Claire's exposed neck, barely scratching the mail. Claire quickly launched offensive counters, only for her doppelganger to avoid a great majority of them, just as she would. Claire charged her double, her equal, preparing to give one final blow to finish the job, before her copy vanished in a cloud of darkness without a trace.

She quickly sheathed her blades and snatched the soul gem from Eoin, holding it in her open palms and concentrating on it.

"Eoin, I would suggest you don't interrupt me, or the results could be catastrophic."

An aura of bright light formed around her, slowly engulfing her and the soul gem as if it were a raging inferno.
15511112121111211121222111211121211.title: Claire

15511112121111211121222111211121212.content: The battle was long but when Claire tried to make a large swing the doppelgänger simply stabbed forward. Claire stood motionless in shock looking at the wound. CLAIRE!" Screamed Eoin and began to run forward to help her. Evil Claire cast a spell on Eoin then took the soul gem back. "Follow me" said evil Claire sweetly and Eoin simply said "yes mistress" as they walked deeper into the cave

"I'm still breathing, so I guess I'm fine," she said. "Had a run-in with a copy of some sort. Looks like me, talks like me, even beat me at my own sword-play. The only thing different, apparently, is how they act. According to a friend of mine, they are the exact opposite of you. I believe the term for such a thing is a Doppelganger?"

"Come," her employee said. "Let's get you inside."

When she arrived, she saw...

Let's get your armor repaired and upgraded." She handed him a healing potion, which he downed immediately, and his wounds healed.

Inside in the lower levels, Claire added in armories, including a Forge, workbench, and grindstone. They placed Jacob's Stahlrim on the workbench and hammered on some more Stahlrim and some metals. They then upgraded one of Jacob's bow to deal Frost Damage and Soul trap. Afterwards, Jacob felt stronger than before. "This was a good suggestion of yours Claire," Jacob complimented when...

"I've been looking or you," he began. "Got something I'm supposed to deliver. Your hands only. Let's see here. An invitation from House Telvanni for a wedding procession. You've got friends all over, don't you? Looks like that's it. Got to go."

"A wedding?" Claire asked herself. "Never was very fond of parties." She opened the invitation, and it mentioned the wedding would be held in Blacklight, Morrowind. House Redoran territory. It also said she could bring as many friends as she likes. "Jacob. There's a wedding going on in Blacklight, Morrowind Would you like to come?"
15511112121111212211111.title: ...a courier approaches Claire.

Jacob smiled, "Of course. I think this is exactly what we need to take our minds off this Doppelgänger buisness." Jacob said, "However, it's better to be safe than sorry. I'll find Eoin and bring him along as well," Jacob said as the two both left for Blacklight, Morrowind, for the wedding of Brelyna Maryon.

What happens?
155111121211112122111111.title: "Of course."

1551111212111121221111112.content: "I have something to take care of, first," Claire said as she walked off into the city. She caught sight of Allinor, who appeared to be watching his back for Thalmor. She approached him, and asked, "Would you like to attend the wedding of a friend of mine?"
1551111212111121221111112.title: Before that

15511112121111212211111121.content:
Allinor wasn't sure if he felt his brain explode or heard her wrong. Normally, she wanted almost nothing to do with men, unless they came to her for business reasons. Though he had taken a liking to her ever since he nursed her back to health after she was attacked by the Orum Gang, he had never had the guts to talk to her, other than say hello when she came back into Cheydinhal after almost a year.

"I'm sorry, but if I recall correctly, you asked me if I wanted to go to a wedding?" He asked, in disbelief.

"You heard right," she began. "Part of the reason is to keep men who would think they could just take advantage of me away. Not too sure what the other part is. So, do you want to come with me to Blacklight or not?"

He hesitated, then with a stutter, said, "Uh, sure! I'll be back in a few moments. Just need to get some things together for the trip."
15511112121111212211111121.title: He wants to.

155111121211112122111111212.content:
Jacob rode on his horse beside Claire's as they rode toward Blacklight. It was early afternoon when they began coming. "So when's your friend coming? Allinor, was it," Jacob asked.

Claire replied, "Yes. He's taking a carriage and will meet us there. Wasn't Eoin gonna tag along?"

"Couldn't find him," Jacob said simply, "He's a pretty slippery lizard....So, what is it with you and Allinor?" Jacob said the last part cautiously, wondering if his guess was correct.

What happens next?
155111121211112122111111212.title: On the way to Blacklight.

1551111212111121221111112121.content:
"Ever since he rescued me from the Orum Gang a little more than a year ago and nursed me back to fighting condition, I've felt odd whenever I was around him," she replied. Jacob howled with laughter. "What's so funny?"

"I think you're starting to fall in love!" Jacob exclaimed. Claire blushed profusely.

"I've never known love outside that of my immediate family. You know, brotherly love," she said.
1551111212111121221111112121.title: Claire's reply

Jacob laughed, "Oh come on! I may not be married, but I know what love is. Why else would you keep other men away except him? And invite him to a wedding?" Jacob chuckled, "You made your story sound so, storybook. A man rescuing a damsel in distress..." Jacob teased.

What happens next?

"If you were smarter, you wouldn't have said that. Now, get up," she said sternly.

Jacob chuckled, dusted himself off and stood up. "Alright, alright. Suppose it was a little too much. But honestly, I'm glad you have a true friend who's...well, normal like Allinor."

Does Claire respond to that?

"I guess that's true," she began. "At least he can take care of himself when he needs to."

"That's the spirit!" Jacob exclaimed. "Now, can I have my horse back?" Claire dismounted Jacob's horse and mounted Arvak.

Jacob and Claire soon approached Blacklight. The area was adorned with decorations and festivities. Jacob turned to Claire, "Also, whose wedding is this anyway?"

Claire pulled out the letter and looked it over, "Brelyna Maryon from Winterhold sent me the letter."

Jacob chuckled, "Oh yeah! Brelyna and I were friends when I got Mage training. Lots of good memories...Well, there was the time she turned me into a cow...then a dog....and a horse...."

Claire chuckled as their horse stopped.

What happens next?
155111121211112122111111212111111.title: Blacklight.

choices: Eoin, Brotherhood, Morag Tong, or doppelganger(s) show up.
1551111212111121221111112121111111.content:
"Keep an eye out for Morag Tong, Dark Brotherhood, and our doppelgangers. We don't want another Vicci wedding," Claire said.

"Yeah," Jacob answered. "But if the Dark Brotherhood has sent Eoin, there's nothing we can do to stop him."

"I can always banish him to Oblivion," Claire said.

"Archmage!" A woman exclaimed. "You came! Who's your friend?"

"You don't need to be formal, Brelyna," Claire said. "The name's Claire. This is Jacob. And if you've ever been wondering about Skyrim, I convinced Ulfric to stand down on the terms that their religious freedoms would be restored if and only if they rejoined the Empire."

"And it worked?" Jacob asked, shocked.

"Yes," Claire continued. "I also had the Thalmor pack up and leave. Their Embassy now serves as another home."

"Anyway," Brelyna continued. "What's with the armor, Claire?"

"As it turns out," Claire began. "I'm a direct descendent of Kohnarik, a once very high-ranking, very powerful dragon priest, and this is my inheritance."

"And you, Jacob?"

"This is the armor of the Psijic Knights. My family has played a role in the Psijic Order for generations. Now, it has come down to me," he said.
1551111212111121221111112121111111.title: The Wedding

15511112121111212211111121211111112.title: Eoin, Brotherhood, Morag Tong, or doppelganger(...

1551111212111121221111112121111111211.content:
Jacob and Claire had wandered around the wedding, not doing much when Jacob spotted someone familiar coming towards them. "Hey, looks like Eoin's here." He said.

Eoin approached, still wearing his regular gear, but removed his helmet. "Surprised you two are already up and going after what those copies did to you." Eoin chuckled.

"It'll take more than a cheap rip-off of myself and Jacob to kill us." Claire said.

They stood around a little more, conversing among themselves when...
1551111212111121221111112121111111211.title: Eoin

15511112121111212211111121211111112111.content:
Allinor approached the trio and introduced himself. A couple of male dark elves were conversing with each other at a nearby table.

"She's pretty, isn't she?" One of them asked.

"Eh, she's normal," his friend responded.

"Huh?" The first one was confused.

"I've done business with her, and she's just a woman in a man's world. She works a forge, runs a business, and enchants weapons. She's also a damn good swordsman and the Archmage of the College of Winterhold. Also a general in the Imperial Army and the last heir of House Seranaan," his friend said.

"Huh. What does this 'business' of hers entail, exactly?" He asked, noting Allinor, Jacob, and Eoin.

"Don't let her catch you saying stuff like that," his friend said.

"Why not?"

"I've heard she does horrible things to those that consider her just another Dunmer girl. Also, even the Black-Briars don't dare trifle with her. She's the head of one of the most powerful military forces in all of Tamriel. To call them a family would be to lie. It would also seem that even the Thalmor have recognized their power, and fear and respect them. I've felt the armor and weapons her business crafts. I know the sheer power behind them. So, I can understand why the Thalmor would back down."
15511112121111212211111121211111112111.title: ...Allinor arrives.

155111121211112122111111212111111121111.content:
Soon, they all turned their attention to wedding procession. Brelyna stood next to her fiancé. Jacob had seen the man with her before a couple of times, but never knew who he was. Jacob watched as they Priest of Mara began the ceremony. As Jacob did, Allinor approached him.

"Jacob?" Allinor said.

"Oh. Allinor. What is it?" Jacob asked.

"I...I just saw you outside, along with Claire." He replied.

Jacob turned his head and saw Claire a little ways away. "Oh no," Jacob said as he walked to Claire. "I think our copies are here."

He heard Claire curse under her breath, "Where are they?"

Jacob walked with Claire outside as they rounded Blacklight. They soon saw their copies grabbing gold and riches from carriages, leaving a few occupants downed by them. "There!" Jacob yelled as he chased at them, Claire following. The two tried to run, but Jacob tackled one of them as they fell into an area by some forested region. Jacob held spells ready in his hand and Claire sheathed her swords, the copies doing the same.

Jacob dodged his copy's first attack as he leaped forward and cast incinerate, but missed. Jacob then caught a glimpse of Claire's doppelgänger knocking Claire down. "Claire," Jacob yelled before his copy got an icy spear through his chest. Jacob fell to his knees and let his head hit the ground. The doppelgänger stood over him, ready to finish him when Jacob felt something.

He felt a new sense of power, of knowledge, of strength...and of destruction. Jacob saw three colors glow across his skin, being red, ice blue, and purple lightning arcing across his body. Jacob felt the energy build within him.

The two Claire's stopped to look, and while they were, the real Claire kicked the other away and jumped behind a boulder. Good choice. A second later, an explosion ripped from Jacob. The two Doppelgängers were blown back injured, but quickly stood with their injuries, cloaked, and fled. Claire turned from the side of the rock, almost destroyed from the blast and saw flames, rows of ice, and lightning arcing in a large radius around Jacob's body. "Jacob," Claire yelled as she ran by his side and flipped him into his back. Large wounds covered his charred, frozen body. The electricity causing his arms, legs and fingers to twitch slightly from time-to-time.

"C...Cla-" Jacob began but was interrupted by a fountain of blood that coughed up from his mouth and dripped from his mouth. Just from his looks, you could tell he had some massive internal injury.

What happens next?
155111121211112122111111212111111121111.title: The wedding begins.

choices: She made it before anyone else missed her.
She's late and people are probably suspicious.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: Claire apologized to the survivors and quickly summarized the situation before casting Heal Other on Jacob to keep him from dying. She quickly brought him into the city's inn, and asked the inn-keeper to get a healer as she hurried back to the wedding.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Claire's response

choices: At the inn where Jacob's getting his wounds treated.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Claire rushed back to where Eoin and Allinor were waiting, near the front. A dead assassin lay at the base of the patio where Brelyna and her husband stood. He looked to be Morag Tong, and was also brutally mauled to death. Eoin handed her a note, containing the assassin's orders, and Allinor almost winced when he saw the wounds on Claire's face.

"This is just a glimpse of what I went through in Skyrim," she said. The marriage ceremony ended, and Claire picked up the body of the assassin and dumped him over a low wall. She was approached by Brelyna, who asked her where she disappeared to, and what happened to Jacob.

"I'll explain everything on the way," she said. She glanced at Brelyna's husband. She had heard of the man when she filled an order for House Redoran.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: She made it before anyone else missed her.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob's body felt like seven kinds of hell. He remembered just a burst of power when the Doppelgängers attacked but passed out. He worked himself to pry his eyes open as his slunked to the left. He saw a blurry image sitting in a chair across from him, but he soon recognized the dark elf. "C..Cl-Claire..?" Jacob stuttered out barely.

Claire stood and sat by the chair next to his bed. "Good. You're awake. How do you feel?" She asked.

Jacob coughed away from her before turning his head back. "...that a joke?" He asked, believing the state of his situation was obvious. "W-what happened anyway?"

"I'm not sure. Looked like some energy discharge," she inquired.

Claire stood up and was starting to walk off until Jacob reached off and grabbed her arm. "Claire...if you go, I go... I gotta face this through." Jacob pleaded.

Does Claire let Jacob come?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: At the inn where Jacob's getting his wounds...

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Yes you can come" said Claire causing Jacob to break into a weak grin

Actually" said Eoin walking in "that's not a good idea. I was reading in Mora's realm and that energy you shot out was your dragon soul. For now you can't shout"

What!" Said Jacob

"Don't worry it's not perminant but you need to rest. By the way your doppelgängers owe me 5000 gold"

What for" said Claire

"You know what it was for" laughed Eoin leaving them alone
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Yes

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob groaned, "That doesn't matter. I'm coming. I..I need to see that thing die in front of me."

Claire helped Jacob to his feet and walked him outside. She got Jacob onto his horse and summoned Arvak and mounted him. She turned back and saw Jacob barely clinging to consciousness. "You alright?" Claire yelled back.

Jacob nodded and ordered his horse to follow Arvak. The two traveled until they reached...
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Jacob comes

choices: Claire has a conversation with her double
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: The group rode to whiterun on the way they settled down for the night
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: ...Whiterun.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
While Claire was off on a stroll Eoin walked over to Jacob. "I think I know a way to fix your Thuum " said Eoin
"THEN DO IT" shouted Jacob louder than he had meant to. Eoin nodded and drew a knife "don't move" said Eoin as he brought the dagger up. Eoin began to carve a glyph into Jacobs throat. When he was finnished he sealed the wound with fire. "It's done"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Eoin fixes Jacobs Thuum

choices: Drunken Huntsman, thinking deeply over a tankard of mead.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: Where is she right now?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Meanwhile with Claire

choices: She's at the inn's bar, trying to resist the urge to break Mikael's face.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: Is she lying in a bed, thinking, or trying not to punch that Bard?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Bannard Mare Inn

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Claire sat on the rented bed thinking when the door opened to reveal her doppelgänger. "You!" Shouted Claire reaching for her blade. "Calm down sister" the doppelgänger said "there's no point I us fighting with no allies around neither of us could win"
Claire relaxed her hand from her blade.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: She rented out a bed.

choices: She believes her, and gives in to the desire for ultimate power.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: "You and I," the double began. "We are one and the same. We have the same memories, the same voices, the same fighting styles, and we are even almost identical. Tell me, sister. Do you want power beyond your wildest dreams, or do you just want to live in obscurity, with the trash?"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: They talk

choices: The copy lunges at Claire and/or someone walks in.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: "You're wrong," Claire said. "We are not the same. Similar, yes, but not identical. Both physically and idealistically, we are not even close to being the same. We have the same memories, yes. The same fighting style? Yes. But that's where the similarities end. Look into your memories of me. Remember when I was exposed to my own past. Remember my pain. That is how I got this scar. I was just a weak, little infant, incapable of defending myself. While I value hard work and loyalty, you flaunt promiscuity, and work to damage my reputation, which took me almost my whole life to earn. You are nothing more than a valueless mimic, devoid of any sense of being or form. I can see it now. You don't even have a mortal's soul, while I have the soul of a dragon. You are, simply put, soulless. Now get out of my sight."
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Claire isn't so easily convinced.

choices: Back to a unsuspecting Eoin and Jacob
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: Something in Claire snapped and something Dark took hold. She wanted to rule to conquer, to own. She would become the most powerful and beautiful ruler all of Tamriel had ever seen. They would look upon her and worship the ground she walked on.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: She believes her, and gives in to the desire fo...

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: So tell me" said Claire "do you have a plan?"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: They talk more

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"Actually, yes," the doppelganger began. "On the night when the evil moon is black as coal, one may offer his or herself as tribute in return for god-like powers. On that night, you will experience something spectacular!"

"Great," Claire began, eager. "So, when is it?"

"Two weeks. Meet me at the top of the Red Mountain." She walked out of the room.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Yes

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Two weeks. It's been two weeks since the conversation between Claire and her doppelgänger. She had told no one about it. Jacob recovered from the wounds he received as they traveled looking for the Doppelgängers.

But now it was time.

Claire had left for Morrowind and climbed Red Mountain. She rode Arvak up the steep and rocky incline. In a few moments, it would be hers....Power.

--------------

Jacob climbed up another side of the mountain with an easier path. He kept an eye in Claire and the path ahead. Claire was acting strange the last few days and it was time to find out. He saw that if he kept his pace, he would reach the peak the same time as Claire.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Two weeks later...

choices: He flees to a plane of Oblivion.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob reached the summit and ducked in behind a stack of boulders, and watched as his and Claire's doppelgangers, along with Claire herself performed some sort of short ritual. When it was over, Jacob felt great power become condensed into one being, and the doppelgangers crumpled into piles of ash. Claire began to speak, but her voice sounded other-worldly.

"Such power. It feels wonderful!" She exclaimed. Jacob peered into her soul and noticed it had become corrupted by darkness.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: The summit

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob rounded the corner and approached Claire. "Claire! What's going on? What are you doing?"

Claire turned and looked and smiled, "Ah, Jacob. You come to witness my new glory?" Her voice sounded all wrong to Jacob.

"You....This isn't you Claire! You have to fight it!" Jacob yelled back.

"Idiot," Claire scoffed. "I won't have to fight anyone, they'll all become servants to me or grant me power...starting with you!"

She lifted Jacob with telekinesis and binded his hands with Magicka as she drained him of all of his Magicka. All of his power. As she sapped him dry she threw him to the side. Jacob laid unmoving with no energy to do anything. As she did she heard a voice calling to her in her head. It sounded like....

Herself's?

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: He approaches Claire.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
The boy's right, the voice echoed. What you are doing to yourself is not worth it. This new power you have gained will only destroy you.

"Shut up!" The now demonic Claire exclaimed at the voice. "You don't know what you're talking about! I have obtained a whole new level of power that I know how to wield effectively, and I will crush all who oppose me!"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Other

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
She fought the voice in her head when she saw more people suddenly appear in front of her. She recognized the uniforms from anywhere.

Thalmor.

"Halt!" One of the Justicars yelled brandishing a sword and lightning spell. "You shall submit to the Thalmor, demon!" The Justicar yelled, a few others grouped with him as archers in elven armor lined up behind him.

Claire let out an inhuman laugh, "Fools! I AM YOUR GOD!" She lifted the accusing Justicar with ease and tossed him over the mountain side, screaming all the way down. The others began casting spells and arrows at Claire. She laughed as they bounced away like wooden toys children play with. With a flick of her wrist she destroyed the archer line, burning flesh filled the air. Two Justicars remained. She stood above them and said. "Deliver a message to your masters! All will bow or fall to me!" The two ran when she realized only one needed to return. Using telekinesis, she picked an arrow up and hurled it at a Justicar, impaling his head cleanly.

She laughed as the last stumbled out of sight.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Something happens.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"I need to do something about this," Claire muttered to herself. She was starting to cry blood. "Jacob!" She slowly walked over to his limp form and knelt down by his head, and said to him, "I'm sorry. Get Eoin. He'll know where to find me. Where the end began." With a howl of pain, the evil she took inside of her took her body back for itself.

"Finally, that's over. I look forward to meeting this friend of yours. Should be a more interesting fight than what you put up." With that, she teleported away.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: The real Claire fights back

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob felt nothing. No pain. No feeling. No sight. He was just cold. He felt as if something was happening, trying to think with the rest of his willpower. He heard something. "...-b!....J-...! ..a...-cob!"

Eoin?

Jacob didn't know what to do or say, but he felt as if there was something he had to tell him. They didn't make much sense, but he said it.

---------------

"W.....-er....t-....nd...b-b...an...." Jacob got out in a dead voice. Eoin took a few seconds to piece together what he said.

"Where the end began."

Eoin knew what to do.

But he couldn't take Jacob, he was too weak. "Stay here Jacob! I'll come back I swear!" He then ran off as Jacob laid still and cold on the mountain. One last thing left his lips when Eoin left.

"C-Cl.....ire....?.....C-c...me.....b-b....ck....."

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Jacob.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"What's taking him so long?" Claire's corrupted flesh growled. Paarthurnax, knowing she was coming, had taken the Greybeards long before she arrived to Skuldafn, and ordered Odahviing to follow much earlier. An argonian approached from the snowy embankment. "You!" She exclaimed. "Are you the one known as Eoin?"

"Yes," Eoin said. "And I'm here to take my friend back from you, demon!"

"That's funny!" It exclaimed with a chuckle. "When I'm done with you, I'm going to take your power and your soul for myself!" As it reached to draw Faasnuhavnodun, it found that Claire's sword wasn't in its sheathe. It had somehow wound up in Eoin's hand, even though he hadn't moved since they started talking.

Vedvenin, an other-worldly voice whispered. My brother doesn't have a choice, but to do that corrupted form's bidding. Use me to put my old master out of her misery. Her soul aches to see her body like this. End her pain.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Where the end began

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Eoin listened to what the sword asked of him, but he had a different agenda. Wielding Faasnuhavnodun he charged toward Claire.

Claire launched spell after spell at Eoin as he ducked away from them, gradually getting closer and closer. Finally he reached her and raised Faasnuhavnodun. Claire reached for Vedvenin, ready to counter when Eoin placed the sword with the blunt side stopping her from getting Vedvenin. Eoin pulled his hand back, "Give her back!" He yelled as his hand dug into her chest.

Claire released a blood-curdling scream as the power was pulled away. In Eoin's hand was a Sigil stone-looking object, which he broke in his hand. Claire fell as Eoin quickly have her a healing potion as the would closed. She looked at Eoin, "Eoin...What...happened? I-..." Claire began again when Eoin stopped her.

"There's somewhere else we must go." He said, with that they disappeared...

...to Red Mountain.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: They fight.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
They appeared on red mountain again. Jacob lay still on the side unmoving. "This is the third time I've been here!" Shouted Eoin at Claire who fought against his grip "I never once got the power. I became a God through time! I killed one in morrowind!" Eoin continued to ramble "Why should others be allowed to take a shortcut?!" And he began to squeeze on Claire's throat dark energy beginning to pour out. Evaporating or going into the former doppelgängers. Claire had only two options take Eoin's soul and power and be a god forever.
Or let him drain her dry
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: A glimpse of madness

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
As Eoin sapped Claire of her power, she fell limp onto the ground.

"Eoin," Claire began, coughing up small amounts of blood. "Why do you forsake me like this?" As she felt the last of her power become drained, Eoin released his hand, and she fell limp onto the ground.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Eoin the God

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Eoin looked over the two, drained of all their power. He saw all they caused over their time. Releasing a Dwemer across Tamriel along with an army of Dremora. And two Doppelgängers with great power who wished to cause trouble and panic across Tamriel. He lifted Claire with one hand and walked over to Jacob and picked him up with the other. He disappeared and reappeared in some kind of ruins in the ground. He found a small desolate corner of it and dropped them. "You will no longer bring harm to these people. I'm sorry my friends, but this is the only way." He then vanished.

Jacob saw nothing, but heard bits and pieces of what happened. Then he felt something move against him ever so slightly. "C-c...aire..?" Jacob sputtered out.

Claire laid there, a descendant of the Dragon Priest Konahrik, and remaining member of House Seranaan. She could no longer move or see, she laid there powerless. But she had a feeling of sorts she wasn't alone, when she heard a voice utter her name.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Other.

choices: Jacob and Claire wake up in some kind of facility.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
A tremendous hammering could be heard from the other side of the collapsed tunnel, but neither Claire nor Jacob could hear it. An explosion made quick work of the rubble pile, and an archaeologist knelt in front of their bodies, accompanied by two soldiers.

"Get the transport over here," one of the soldiers said. "You aren't going to believe what we've found."
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: The New Age.....

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: Claire and Jacob awoke in a stone room. They looked around after regaining their wits. They seemed to be in markarth. Claire sat up to see that her golden armour had dimmed as if even it's power had been taken. "Good your awake" said a familier voice. General Tullius striae into the room
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Jacob and Claire wake up in some kind of facility.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Eoin sat alone in high hrothgar on a stone throne. His eyes burned red as he observed his new domain. He could remake and bend reality to his will. His magic was so powerful he could rewrite a person. Suddenly his vision blurred and he was in an odd room. Across from him sat himself leaning back on a chair. "So you finally snapped did you" joked the relaxed version "Hold your Tongue! You are but a figment" hissed the original.
Oh come now we both know you've cracked what you did to Claire and Jacob was unthinkable"
"Oh really? Well I altered a few imperials to save them. I don't want them dead just out of the way"
Did you even want this power?" Asked the copy
"NO!! I didn't ! I had to stop Claire but this is her fault. This power can't just disappear now it has to have s vessel. If she had been strong enough I would have supported her but she was weak!"

With that he was back in his throne room alone
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Cut to Eoin's pov

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: Claire and Jacob walked out of the stone room and into a steel corridor . The man removed his tullius disguise and beckoned them to follow
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Back to the others

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Claire opened her eyes to bright lights above her. Being a Dragon Priestess, when Eoin drained her of power, she ever so slightly regained it, but she didn't have much. She tried to remember what happened. She followed her doppelgänger to the mountain, gained their power, Eoin defeated her and-

Jacob! She remembered she sapped Jacob dry of power and tossed him aside. She sat up causing pain to bounce about her body. She saw the room was white, bright and tiled, with a singular, large grey metal door. In another second of looking around, she saw someone in there with her. It was Jacob with his chest rising lightly up and down, distressed. "Jacob," Claire said. She managed to get next to him and knelt above him.

She did this. She caused Jacob this pain. She looked and saw Jacob's hand twitch slightly from time-to-time. She reached down and held it lightly, a moment after she heard. "C.....-laire..?"

She looked at Jacob and saw him pry an eye open. "J-Jacob!" Claire looked Jacob over, he looked the same as he did on the mountain.

"W...Wh-where..?" Jacob stuttered out, still trying to regain power.

"I...I don't know," Claire replied, looking around the room again. "But we'll be fine alright?"

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: They awaken.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
A man in a white overcoat entered the room, and seeing Claire standing, he dropped his notepad and scrambled out the door.

"Security!" He cried out. "Security!" Only about a minute later two guards in white armor with blue visors burst through the door.

"Don't move!" One of them shouted, drawing a small cylinder and a steel knuckle. He pressed a button on the cylinder, and it extended into a sword of translucent, blue hexagons, and did the same with the cylinder, which spanned out into a triangular shield, also composed of the hexagons.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Other

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: Does Claire decide to fight them or try and negotiate?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Decisions...

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Knowing full-well her weapons and most of her armor weren't anywhere in the room, and to top it off, she was nowhere near as strong as she used to be, so there was no point in putting up a fight.

"I would like an explanation as to where I am and how long I've been out," she said.

"You're in the Republic of Cyrodiil's Ancient Artifact Research Facility," one of them began. The only indication one of them was talking was when his helmet moved. "You both were supposedly dead for over two hundred years. It is currently the one hundred ninety-eighth year of the Fifth Era. The Fourth Era ended in its two hundred fourteenth year. I'll have someone get you some clothes. You may look young, but I'm well aware of your true age. You went missing in the two hundred third year of the Fourth Era. By that time, you were twenty-six. So, if we do the math, you are about two hundred thirty-five years of age. That's quite a feat of age, even for an elf. What's even more amazing is that neither of you two seem to have aged a day."
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Negotiate

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
After being given some simple robes, they put them in a large metal thing. It had wheels on the side and reminded Claire of a Dwemer device. She helped Jacob into the car. As it drove, she looked to one of the driver's. "That man that called for security, what was he doing?" Claire asked one of the men in the seat in front of them.

"He was studying you two, trying to see what happened or find any anomalies on you." The man replied without turning.

As disturbed and angry it made her to have someone poke and prod them for research, she needed to know something. "What's he come up with for J-..my friend here?" Claire said motioning to Jacob. Jacob was still limp as he laid across a seat.

"You came up fine," the man replied. "Your friend there though...they aren't sure yet. He seems incredibly damaged and weak."

Claire looked over, remembering what she did. She reached over and lightly held his hand. "I'm sorry, Jacob," Claire whispered.

"T-t...-hanks..." Jacob sputtered out.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: They are taken somewhere.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
As they neared what appeared to be a military compound, two red streaks zipped past and broke formation at the gate, going opposite directions.

"What was that!?" Claire asked, stunned. She'd never seen anything move so fast in her life.

"Those a Mk. II Hover Tanks. The standard weaponry is a twenty millimeter Vulcan cannon, and a ninety millimeter Anti-tank cannon. You've yet to see our most powerful weapons. Those tanks, by comparison, are just the icing on the cake," the driver said.

"Why all the security?" Claire asked.

"Listen," he began. "This is a federal compound where some of the government's most secret projects take place. We've prepared a suit for your friend, here, and we'll work on getting you outfitted. Hard to believe the two of you haven't aged a day after all these years."

"State your business, or get shot," a guard with an odd-looking weapon said. It looked like a sword, but was hollowed and appeared to have electricity arcing between the teeth in the gap halfway through it.

"Easy with the rail gun, Private. I'm here on federal business. I've never seen any of the government's projects, and I don't care to. I'm just doing as I'm told by taking these two inside to get them outfitted."

"I don't see any proof of that. How can I be certain these two aren't just some random civilians you plucked off the street?" The Private asked, suspicious.

"If you don't let us through, Private, it's going to be you looking down the barrel of a gun," a man in a black suit in the car's passenger seat began.

"I'm sorry, Colonel!" The Private exclaimed. "I didn't realize it was you! Please, proceed."
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: They arrive

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Claire exited the vehicle and walked into the giant compound. Lights and screens which changed continuously filled the rooms as people in similar armies walked up and down the hallways. Then a man in a lab coat approached Claire and nodded his head. "We've been expecting you. This is an honor, please come this way." Claire followed them and then noticed Jacob get carried away hanging from his arms.

"Where are they taking him?" Claire asked.

The man waved his hand, "They're going to upgrade him so he's able to move. Word of warning: He'll look a little...different."

----------

Jacob felt his body being dragged for awhile and suddenly lifted. He still couldn't see but he felt metal press against his skin all across his body on every part, including his mouth. Jacob didn't know what was happening until his vision flashed white and he yelled. But when he yelled, it wasn't a real yell.

It was a howl.

----------

Two scientists watched as the Jacob's body was pushed into a containment machine as everything else needed was placed inside a fairly large robotic wolf. "Did it work?" One asked.

"Yep. The body will now move to his senses."

----------

Jacob opened his eyes and saw letters flash across the screen and a man standing in front of him. "Testing vocal amplifier. Can you say something?"

Jacob felt his body laying down, frozen, unable to move until he said. "Claire," his voice came out with a weird tone accompanying it. Jacob could move slightly as the man said, "You can see your friend soon."

Jacob saw in the reflection of a window a large wolf with black fur, it seemed a bit bigger than the ones in Skyrim. He stood on all fours and then laid back down like a dog, waiting for Claire. When he did though, he heard and felt metal clank. He realized that he wasn't a wolf now, but was placed into a metal body resembling one.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Inside the compound's central building.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"So, what is it you're doing with my old friend?" Claire asked.

"They are re-making him. He will be faster and stronger than ever before. As for you," he said as he removed the fabric cover from a gold and black suit of very angular armor. Its helmet had a crimson visor, which appeared as little more than a slit.

"I hope you like it," the scientist began. "Its craftsmanship is based off your former suit of armor. Your friend should be just about ready. When you're ready to pay him a visit, just let me know. If you want to change into your new armor now, I'll give you some privacy."

"That would be appreciated," Claire said. As the scientist left the room, she turned her attention back to her new suit of armor. It was graceful, and felt light, but stronger than her inherited suit. She quickly equipped it, and left the room, her helmet was folded onto her upper back, appearing as just another part of the armor. When a young, off-duty soldier caught sight of her, he immediately blushed, stood at attention, and gave her a salute. His armor was different from the rest. Very flexible and appearing much more delicate than her own, with a maroon and black pattern on the padding. He then proceeded on his way. "What was that all about?" She asked.

"Clearly, he likes how you look. He's the only Sentinel pilot here," the scientist said. "Now, let's reunite you and your friend.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Claire

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob was still laying where he was originally. He laid on a small bed in a completely white room. From time to time he'd look at himself in the reflection. He also saw a symbol of somekind similar to the Imperial's Dragon imprinted on the armor. Which made him wonder just how much changed. Just then he heard a hiss come from the door as it opened and Claire stood in the doorway in her armor. Jacob "detected" the look of initial shock on her face when she saw what Jacob had become. "Claire." Jacob said.

He hopped from the bed and walked on all fours toward her and looked up, causing him to sit like a dog. Jacob was now about half as tall if not shorter than Claire. She looked down at him and knelt beside him. She ran her hand across the top of his head. "Jacob? What did they do to you?" Claire said in shock.

"They said my body was too unstable to control normally, so they transferred my consciousness to this. Once they fix my regular body, I can switch between this platform and my normal body." Jacob said. Then Claire pulled Jacob's head close.

"I'm sorry," she began. "I drained you of power, I left you weak, and I'm sorry."

Jacob stood on all fours again. "You do not need to apologize Claire. I'll be fine. Shake?" Jacob said as he reached one of his paws out. Claire reached and felt odd shaking it but did it anyway. Just then another grunt appeared in the doorway in regular uniform.

"I have orders for you two to report to the Training room to gear up." He said before leaving again. Claire looked at Jacob who nodded as the two followed the man.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Claire meets with Jacob.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"If you are to fight effectively in our military, you are going to need to learn how to handle more than one type of weapon. Seeing as you're already fluent with sword use, I want to see you against some of our test dummies, but first, I'm going to need to see how well your sword slices through these pillars," the soldier said. Three pillars rose from the ground. They appeared to be made out of some kind of steel-like metal. He then handed Claire both of her old swords and their sheathes, which she immediately hooked up to her suit. She drew both Vedvenin and Faasnuhavnodun, charged the pillars, and in the blink of an eye, left two deep gashes in each of them. While her swords may not have cut all the way through, the cuts in the pillars were almost the whole length of the blades. "Impressive. Now that that's over, I want to see how you handle a new type of weapon. Let's start with the hand gun." He tossed her a strange-looking weapon with an open end. A paper target in the shape of a person lifted out of the ground, and the pillars were lowered back into the floor. "I wouldn't recommend pointing it at your face. Too many accidents with people looking down the barrel of a loaded gun and accidentally pulling the trigger. At any rate, try shooting some targets. Now, shoulders and back straight, left foot in front, right foot slightly behind, hold the weapon with your right hand, but keep your finger off the trigger until you're ready to fire. Also try placing your left hand on the handle, gripping both the pistol and your right hand to steady the weapon. Have you disengaged the safety?"

"Safety?" Claire asked. She looked the weapon over, unsure of the difference between the trigger and the safety.

"It's right here," the soldier said as he moved a little notch on the back. "Now, take the stance I've said earlier, and remember to keep your index finger off the trigger until you're ready to fire." Claire took his advice and when her aim was steady, pulled the trigger. The kick from the weapon was more than she expected, and she narrowly avoided getting hit in the face by her own weapon. When she looked at the target, she noticed she...
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Claire's training

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
The bullet missed it's target entirely and bounced off one of the columns, ricocheting, hitting Jacob's armor and embedding itself into the ceiling. The three looked up at where it was left. "I guess I should've warned you about the kick." The soldier said. "We'll keep working with it."

Claire looked at Jacob and saw no mark where the round hit him. "How wasn't he hurt," Claire asked curiously.

"His body resembles a wolf's, but his armor is heavily metal. The bullet just bounced right off."

Jacob turned and looked to also see no mark. "What now?" Jacob said over the speaker on him.

The soldier opened a second door, "You can start your training if you want now while Claire here works on hers." The man said.

Jacob turned and looked up at Claire who nodded her head. "You go on. I'll see you afterwards."

Jacob nodded and continued through the door to his training room.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: ...completely missed.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
She readied herself for the recoil before firing again. This time, she got the edge of the target.

"Again" the soldier said. She fired off another shot, getting a little closer to the center. "Don't stop firing until you hit the center at least five times in a row with that pistol. Whether or not you run out of ammo, I'll teach you how to reload quickly. You will also be taught how to clean your weapon." She fired off a few more shots, each one getting a little closer to the center. She aimed for the target's head, and fired. The bullet ripped into the center of the target's head area. She fired seven more times, each round landing in the center of the target's head area, until the pistol clicked. "Eight bullets in the head, six in the torso, and one in the ceiling. Not bad. Now, let me show you how to reload. Just give the clip a light tug, and it will come right out. When you insert a new clip, don't forget to pull back on the section above the barrel's seem to cock it. In case you got the wrong image, the word 'cock' when it comes to guns, means 'prime', or make it ready to fire." As Claire inserted the clip into the small handgun, she noticed engraved letters in the casing. They read Beretta 9mm.

"Excuse me," Claire said.

"Huh?"

"I hope you don't mind me asking, and this may seem like a silly question, but what company is Beretta? I've never seen you guys carry a weapon like this," she said. The soldier sighed.

"Our military has been looking into other worlds that we might be able to inhabit or trade with its inhabitants. We've found a few worlds that may be habitable, but we've found one that was definitely inhabited," the soldier said.

"Was?" Claire asked.

"Yeah. Apparently something horrible happened there. Nothing but rubble, as far as the eye can see. The wildlife and foliage have taken over what's left of whoever left all that technology behind. We've found things from children's toys to massive, steel war machines. Even found some working music disks, and that world. That world is much more massive than our own, but has the same gravity, and resides in a spot in the universe almost completely devoid of magicka. In all there records, there isn't a single mention of elves, except in their works of fiction. I don't know how those people got that far technologically without magic. Buildings and towers, some higher than the Throat of the World, all without magic. It would seem that centuries ago, those people feared what they considered magic, heretic rituals that supposedly conjured evil and pagan gods. Whatever civilization previously inhabited that planet, they're all gone, now," the soldier said with a somber tone. "That gun is a surviving, perfectly restored relic of a dead race of humans."

"That's awful," Claire said. "Any idea as to how an entire planet's civilizations could have been wiped out?"

"I don't really have any idea. You'll have to bring it up with one of our scientists," the soldier said. "Now that that's out of the way, let's get back to training you." Claire fired off more rounds into the target's head.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Claire's training

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob walked into a large room similar to Claire's, but there was a large observation window with people watching him. "Welcome," a voice boomed over a speaker. "We hope you're getting use to your new body. But let's show you your combat readiness."

Jacob nodded in confirmation that he was ready as two men walked out carrying a large brown-red material. They placed it on top of him and strapped it around his belly as it covered his back and sides. "That is a special vest meant for animals in the military. It's made out of a specially reinforced material called Kevlar. It can stop stun rods and certain bullets."

Jacob felt the vest on him, but it felt extremely light. Then he felt something on his "hands" change. He looked and saw large metallic claws stretch out. "Those are for close range encounters. Give them a try." A dummy then appeared in the room. Jacob charged at it, bolted to the side, and swiped across the dummy's chest, tearing straight through. "Excellent, also, your fangs can work the same way."

Jacob nodded when he saw something on his armor pop out, it seemed circular as she saw it lead to a thicker piece in the armor. "That is a GP-40 grenade launcher. It will fire a highly explosive round long distances. Think of it as shooting an arrow. You have to compensate for the drop."

Three targets appeared in the room as Jacob positioned himself and pointed the end toward them and fired. He bounced back a bit but the grenade burst a second later as it collided with the dummies. "Good. Now there's one last thing."

Jacob saw another man appear with a large sword-looking thing with two edges and serrated teeth on the inside which lightning bounced off of. Jacob felt it's weight as it was placed on his back and locked into place. "That is a railgun. Using magnets, it launches high-velocity rounds. Give it a try."

The room grew longer as Jacob felt the electricity bolt around him and the gun before he fired it. It launched down the room and burst into a wall with a large explosion. The man removed the railgun and took it away. "That concludes your training. Any questions?"

Jacob turned and looked at the screen. "Is there anything else I should know about my body?" Jacob asked.

It was quiet for a second until the voice replied, "Well, that little speaker by your neck you're talking out of, you gotta protect that. If it's blown off or broken or damaged, then we won't be able to understand you until it's fixed. If it's broken, when you talk you'll sound like a dog. Got it?" Jacob nodded as the man brought up multiple scenarios as Jacob went through each one.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Jacob's training.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
The distinct sound of a HI-Laser rifle could be heard throughout the room Claire was training in. Semi-intelligent test dummies skittered about an arena-type area in the base, and soldiers of various ranks watched her obliterate the dummies with astounding speed. A couple soldiers were chatting in the control booth.

"Wow," a Private began. "Who is that guy?"

"Actually, he is a she," a Lieutenant said.

"I doubt a woman could have that much skill with a weapon like that! I mean, look at that thing! It's as big as he is!" The Private exclaimed. "But if you're right, and that's a woman, if she's hot, I'm asking her out!"

"We'll see soon enough," said the Lieutenant. "It's the final round of the training session. When their are no more hostiles, the helmet on the suit will automatically deactivate. Still, though. It takes a good amount of strength and dexterity to use a HI-Laser rifle, especially a Model 19BR, like what the new trainee's got."

"End match, well done. Very impressive. All that movement and almost no collateral damage," the match room's controller said. Claire's helmet disengaged and molded back into her suit, revealing to the young officers that she was, in fact, a woman.

"Told ya so," the Lieutenant snarked.

"And I told you that if she's hot, I'd be the one to ask her out," the Private retorted.

"Prepare for rejection," the Lieutenant responded just before Claire entered the control room.

"Here's your paper-work," the training room controller said. "Be sure to look that over tonight."

"You're new here too, right?" The Private asked. "Wanna talk about your experience so far over dinner?"

"Thanks for the offer, but no," Claire said.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Back to Claire

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob had left his training room after a bit more practice. They removed the armor and railgun and let him travel around the facility freely. He stopped by the lab and checked up on his real body. "We still aren't sure what's wrong," the scientist told Jacob. "But once we figure it out, it should be easy to fix. We'll contact you once we've fixed it."

"Thank you," Jacob said through the speaker without moving his mouth. The door to the lab opened as Jacob left the lab and saw Claire in the hallway. She turned and walked to him and petted him.

"Finished your training," Claire asked, Jacob nodding in reply. "One of the men told us we have barracks for the two us. They want us to rest up, so I guess we should visit it."

"Right," Jacob replied as they walked down the hallways until they reached the designated room. A large "RM-208" was printed vertically on the door. Claire opened it to see simply two beds, a couch, and a table. Claire walked and and took a look around and noticed under the beds were chests of sorts for their armor. Claire deposited hers inside and looked to see Jacob just sitting there. She also saw some kind of device close to his neck. "What's that," Claire asked Jacob. But she was already reaching for it and had her hand on it.

"Oh no, Claire wait! Don-" That was all Jacob got out before Claire took it off.

"Jacob?" Claire asked, not sure what happened.

Jacob replied with barks and woofs, trying to show her what it did. After a moment of barking, she realized what it was. "I'm sorry. Here," Claire said. She knelt next to him and began to place it back in correctly. "Did that work?" She asked, only receiving a whine from Jacob. "Alright, how about that?"

Jacob's voice came back through the speaker. "Better. Thanks."

Claire laid on her bed as Jacob laid at the foot of the bed. Claire fell asleep, hopefully shorter than the sleep she was found in, and Jacob entered some kind of standby mode.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Barracks.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Claire and Jacob jolted awake to the sound of an alarm, and Claire quickly equipped her armor while Jacob sprinted to his own gear room. As Claire was heading outside to see what was going on, she stopped by the armory to grab a Model 19BR HI-Laser rifle, and a rail gun. Soldiers manning the guns were firing away furiously at something, and Claire saw what it was. A small, enemy formation heading toward the base. She hurriedly equipped a scope to her laser rifle, spotted a small, nimble enemy, and fired off a shot. Less than a second later, there was an explosion, and debris was sent flying, some of it landing in front of her. A soldier was firing off a rocket launcher, and wasn't able to hit anything.

"Give me that!" Claire exclaimed as she snatched it from him. As she peered through the sight, she heard the lock-on tone, and fired. The rocket trailed behind an enemy mech and completely annihilated it. The rest of the formation retreated, some of the mechs being badly damaged. She looked over to the soldier she took the rocket launcher from to see it was...
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Alert!

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
She looked at the man who she had taken the launcher from and noticed the insignia signaling him as a lieutenant . The man looket at her surprised not only for what she did but her shot as well. Claire handed the gun back to the man. "Sir," she muttered as she began to walk back toward the armory. She heard a few footsteps by her and turned to see Jacob who had turned the hallway and was moving alongside Claire in his armor.

"Are you alright, Claire," Jacob barked over the speaker.

Claire just turned and glanced at Jacob still walking. "I'm fine," she said. "What happened though? Who were those guys?"

"I don't know. Maybe we'll learn a bit later."

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: ...a commanding officer.

choices: Someone walks up to Jacob and Claire.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: "We're not sure about the origin of the attack, but from what we've recovered, they look like assault vehicles from the Democratic Republic of the Summerest Isle. You all did well responding to this threat. Had they taken this base, I doubt any of us would be here listening to this debriefing. You are dismissed," the Colonel, who rode with Claire and Jacob to the base the other day said.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Debriefing

choices: They wake up the next day
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
After the debriefing, Jacob and Claire returned to their barracks. Both of them were thinking the same thing as the other. "The Democratic Republic of Summerset Isle?" Claire said when they were in their barracks, she sat on the bed.

"It seems so," Jacob replied sitting next to her. "It seems not only the Empire still exists. But why are they fighting?"

Claire and Jacob sat silently until they both had a similar thought. "Jacob, do you think that that could of actually..." Claire trailed off.

Jacob let out a low, angered growl before answering. "It could be possible that the Thalmor took control. Those elves..." Jacob scowled.

Claire and Jacob sat there until Jacob said, "We should rest. We didn't get much sleep before that siren went off."

Claire chuckled a little, "Jacob, I think we've had enough sleep to last lifetimes."

Jacob's voice chuckled over the speaker as well. "I guess that much is true. But still..."

"Yeah yeah," Claire said as she lifted the covers and slid under them. Jacob laid at the foot of the bed again and tried to rest.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Barracks.

choices: Meeting with the Governor of Bravil.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
A knock was heard at their bedroom door, and Claire groggily got out of bed, and answered it. The Lieutenant from last night stood on the other side.

"What do you want?" Claire asked.

"I was ordered to retrieve you and your friend to meet with Governor Rallis of Bravil would like to have a word with you. We have already explained to him that with the current situation with the Communist state residing in Southern Tamriel, all on-duty soldiers are advised to where their combat armor and keep their weapons on their person at all times. Let me know when you're ready, and I'll take you to him. Behind his visor, he was quickly looking her over, and with how small she was, he found it hard to believe she could wield a weapon as big as she was with so little difficulty. After a few minutes of preparation, she and Jacob exited their room and asked the soldier to lead them to the Governor.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: They wake up the next day

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
The Governor was sitting at a fancy, wooden table, downing a cup of something that smelled strong and bitter.

"Sir," the Lieutenant began. "I've brought you the soldier you've requested to see."

"Good," Rallis said. "Give us some privacy."

"Yes, sir," the Lieutenant said. He immediately exited the room.

"So, you're the soldier I've heard about that can use a large laser rifle with relative ease, is that correct?" Rallis asked.

"Yes, sir," Claire said.

"I hope you don't mind me saying, but I was expecting someone a little larger," Rallis said.

"My small size has actually helped me in a bar fight once," Claire said. "But that's another story."

"I am well informed of your true age, Ms. Delgreind, so please, tell me. How many were you fighting in this bar?" Rallis asked.

"I took on seven Orcs that were sexually harassing me," she recalled. "Won that little fiasco flawlessly."
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Meeting with the Governor of Bravil.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"I can't say I've ever heard of anyone taking on seven Orcsand living to tell the tale!" Rallis exclaimed. "I'm quite impressed."
