"Well, I didn't just beat them senseless, I killed them, Governor," Claire said. "Then the rest of the Orum Gang showed up and ambushed me in an alley. Had a mage not showed up, who knows what they would've done to me before they killed me?"

"I think we've spent enough time with casual talk, ma'am," Rallis said in a polite tone. "We need someone of your skills out on the front lines. Prove yourself out there, and then we'll see about getting you set up to go on a trip to a new world. Only the best get sent to that forsaken place, mostly because we don't know what's developed there over the time since those humans vanished, leaving behind only skeletons and their possessions. There may still be a few survivors, but the odds of encountering anyone native to that world is looking very unlikely. I have come here because I require someone of your skills. All the Governors were told of your inherent abilities, and I came here expecting to fight tooth and nail to get you and your friend into the armed forces battalion stationed in and around Bravil, but it would seem nobody else took interest. At any rate, I expect to see you in Bravil at my doorstep in seventy-two hours. I hope you will consider my offer." The Governor exited the room, leaving Claire and Jacob to go to their Barracks and discuss the matter.


-------


"We only just got here, Jacob," Claire said. "We've only gone through basic training so far."
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: The Governor is genuinely impressed.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob was sitting on the ground and Claire was sitting on the bed. "I agree Claire, but if we've been asleep that long, then this is still Tamriel. This could be where Skyrim was for all we know."

"I know. But we don't know half of anything that's happening right now. How are we suppose to choose sides?" Claire said. Claire looked down at her feet. Jacob hopped up next to her and laid down, placing his head on her lap. "Everything we remember is gone. My home, my friends, my rank, they're gone." Claire said.

"As much consolation as this may or may not be...You still got me." Jacob said.

Claire hid her smile as she stroked the artificial fur on Jacob's head. "So what do you think, Claire? Wanna head to Bravil?"

What do they choose?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Jacob's input.

choices: They overhear soldiers chatting about something at dinner.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
They thought about for awhile (1200 Hours if Jacob was correct) when Claire finally decided.

"Sure," Claire said. "We leave tomorrow."

"I guess it's decided, then," Jacob said. "I can't wait to see how much things have progressed." He looked at the wall clock, which read 1800 hours. "Looks like it's dinner time!"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Yes

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob walked alongside Claire as they walked through one of the mess halls. Claire carried both of their trays of food to an empty table and sat both trays down, Jacob jumped up and sat next to Claire. They were eating when Jacob's ears picked up chatter that interested him.

"Heard the Governor visited those two soldiers that the archaeologist found. Heard he wanted them to fight." One grunt said sitting at a fairly full table.

"Hm. I wonder if we would send them to Reichan," ons soldier than said. Jacob did not turn his head to look at them, to not draw suspicion.

He heard one soldier scoff. "I've seen what those two can do, but I still doubt that they would be ready for that hellhole. I even heard that those elves enlisted Colonel Dadeli to oversee those operations."

One soldier made an angry noise, "Bastard. He should be fighting with us! Why would he help them? He's not even an elf."

"I don't care," one soldier replied. "I can't stand that freak."

Claire noticed Jacob had stopped eating and was curious as to what he was doing. "You alright, Jacob?"

"I just overheard a few soldiers talking about us and some place called 'Reichan', and a Colonel there named Dadeli. I wonder where that is..." Jacob trailed off.

"We'll probably find out soon enough where, who, and what that is. But we'll cross that bridge when we come to it." Claire said.

Jacob nodded and continued eating when they finally returned to their barracks and rested, waiting for the next day.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: They overhear soldiers chatting about something...

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: As Claire slept, she had a dream. In the dream was a wasteland ravaged by an unfathomable catastrophe that put the eruption of the Red Mountain to shame. Silhouettes of people picked through the ruins of structures to find anything of use. When she woke up, she was still in the barracks. Jacob was curled up into a ball on the couch, sleeping peacefully. Claire equipped her armor and woke up Jacob. Immediately after he was fully awake, they left for the mess hall for breakfast.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Transfer to Bravil

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob sat up next to Claire again in the mess hall as he ate his food out of something that was more of a bowl than a tray. Jacob stopped and saw (more like 'detected') something was bothering Claire as she pushed her food around a little bit with her fork. "Something wrong," Jacob asked looking at her. "Were some of the soldiers giving you trouble?"

Claire looked up a little startled and caught off-guard. "Sorry, I was just thinking about that other world I was told about. It...it just sounds terrible." Claire said.

"If we're sent there from Bravil, I'm sure we'll be fine," Jacob added. "We've been through quite a bit."

Claire nodded as the two finished their food and left the mess hall.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Soldiers chatting.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Claire and Jacob stepped into the vetol to be flown to Bravil. In flight a message played over the com "all officers in transit, you are being reasigned to Honour guard status. The emperor is in the city".
"Emperor ? " said Claire "yes The Emperor" replied another soldier. He has survived hundreds of years, he wields god like power, he has improved soldiers into super soldiers"
"Could it be Eoin?" Asked Jacob "who else" said Claire
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: To Bravil

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"You seem to have some sort of resentment for him," the soldier said. "But if you don't wanna discuss it, I understand."

The aircraft landed in Bravil, and the loading bay doors opened.

"Let's go! Look sharp! The Emperor will be watching us!" A Lieutenant Colonel exclaimed as the soldiers undid their fastenings and started to march out the bay doors. Claire simply followed behind the others, saving the sights of the changed city for later. Claire and the other soldiers all removed their rifles from their back holsters and set the butts of their rifles on the ground with a rhythmic thud.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Arriving in Bravil

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
http://www.xda-wallpapers.com/preview/65...

The Emperor stood wielding two large power swords that looked like modified Daedric swords glowing red. On his back under his Cape were two heavy bolters. He strode forward to the Vetol. "Hello men and women"then looking at Claire and Jacob said "and welcome back
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: The Emperor

choices: "She is yours to do with as you please, men."
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
She felt every muscle in her body tense with rage, and several soldiers around her started to sweat as the air around them suddenly got much warmer.

Don't do it, Claire thought. You're better than this, and he's the fucking Emperor. You could be hanged for treason! Everything went dark, and next thing she knew, she was on the ground, the whole right side of her face quite sore. Several grunts piled on top of her to try and keep her from moving.

"I've seen that look of rage in you before, Claire," Eoin said indifferently. "Let me guess, you held it in as long as you could, but everything went black, and next thing you knew, you were on the ground, correct?" He saw the pure rage she had in her eyes as she subconsciously struggled violently against those holding her down. She stood and glared at him with incredible rage.

"Damn, she's strong!" A soldier that assisted in trying to hold her down exclaimed.

"Stubborn and determined as ever, I see," Eoin said. A soldier got her in the neck with a tazer, and she fell to the ground. Eoin then opened his mouth to say...
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Claire tries to punch him

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Let her up" Eoin shouted startling everyone "I wouldn't have had them revived if I was going to let them be harmed"
The soldiers stood to attention and allowed Claire to stand. "You are all my honour guard now, as such you must become something more!, all of you report to the chaplain for testing. He will decide if you shall be marine, raptor, beserker or a sorceror"
"Yes Emperor" the sergeant replied as the untit marched off except for Claire and Jacob.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: "Let her go."

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"Let's go, Claire," Jacob said, urging her. "If you try again, he might kill you."

"Ugh, fine!" Claire exclaimed. "Let's just go to this damn Chaplain and get this whole affair over with!"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Jacob intervenes

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: This is optional for you two" Eoin simply says
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Eoin stops her.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: "Why is this optional, and what does the examination entail, Eoin?" Claire asked.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Don't

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: It's essentially a medical exam followed up by a special, rigorous training session designed to exploit your weaknesses and work against your strengths to make you come out stronger," Eoin said. "And I can't say I'm not entirely surprised you're able to use such a large laser rifle as you would a pistol, Claire. So, do you want to go through with it, or not?"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: He gives her an answer.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"Thanks," Claire began. "But no. I think we may be strong enough to combat whatever threat may lye ahead of us."

"Are you sure?" Eoin asked. "The other Governors suggested sending you two to Reichan; the Hell World."

"I'm sure," Claire said. "You know how tough I am."

------

"See?" A soldier asked another of his rank, a few hundred meters off. "I told you she's a beauty."

"I hear she's going to be sent to Reichan, on vote of all but one Governor. Rallis wanted her and that hound of hers in his special forces unit, but it looks like all that will change."

------

"The next shuttle for Reichan is set for 0900 tomorrow, and certain military personelle are aloud to stay at civilian complexes, like the Highgate Hotel," Eoin said as he left.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: "No."

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
After checking in, Claire and Jacob took up a room in a higher floor in the hotel looking over the city. Claire seemed to settle in kinda nicely when she saw Jacob just staring out of the window. She walked over and sat beside him, "What's wrong? Is it Eoin?"

Jacob shook his head and faced Claire. "That's not it," he said. "I keep hearing more and more about Reichan, and...all those lives." Jacob's ears seemed to fold down at that.

Claire said, "I know. It's tragic, but it's like you said in the barracks, we've been through a lot and will be fine." Claire scratched behind Jacob's ear, to Claire's surprise Jacob stamped his foot slowly. "Jacob, what are you doing?" She said, hiding the enjoyment in her voice.

"I...I don't know," Jacob said. Probably a feature that made the user seem more convincing as an animal. Claire smiled as she stood and went to sleep, Jacob next to her.

Waiting for Reichan.

Waiting for Hell.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: The Highgate Hotel.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"All who are going to Reichan, do be warned! Magic can be used there, but your Magicka will not regenerate, and once your Magicka reserve is depleted, you will no longer be able to cast spells!" An officer exclaimed.

"That is one big rifle!" A Nord soldier, who had clearly booked the same flight, exclaimed. Clearly, he noticed Claire's HI-Laser rifle.

"This Reichan place," Claire began. "Have you ever been there?"

"Can't say I have, lass," the Nord said. "However, I do know that it's about seventy light years out, and the last time someone looked through a telescope at it, there was an enormous war taking place, like nothing in Tamriel's history! The cruelty of some of these humans should not be underestimated, if there are any left."

"How long is the trip?" Claire asked, as they neared the loading-bay doors. "I think about six hours. These ships are damned fast."



SIX HOURS LATER


The sound of an alarm jolted Claire from her sleep, and the ship started to spin out of control. There was then an explosion on the right side of the ship, and it listed heavily to starboard.

"We've lost the starboard engine!" The pilot exclaimed. "Everyone brace for impact!" The shuttle slammed onto the ground, and rolled multiple times before coming to a halt. When Claire came to, she was upside-down in her seat, and nobody else seemed to be alive. Some seemed to be completely crushed, while others either had large pieces of metal shewn through them, or their necks broken. She looked at Jacob, and he was still breathing, but unconscious. Claire undid her safety belt, dropped to the shuttle's ceiling, and lifted Jacob over her shoulder. After a few minutes of travel, she realized they were completely lost. She heard multiple footsteps approaching their positions, and it turned out to be...
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Reichan

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
She saw men climbing over rubble, advancing on her position. She saw they wore tattered garbs and few of them had metal masks or metal strapped sloppily to their own armor. She saw a few only have small arms like the Beretta back in Bravil, while others had knives, pipes, blunt weapons, etc. Claire ducked behind cover and pulled her HI-Laser Rifle out and began firing. She took a few down as the sound of their scream filled the air with the smell of their flesh. She fired another round when she heard some clunk behind her. She turned and got hit clean in the face with a rifle butt.

Claire fell unconscious, dropping her rifle and Jacob. Then men quickly surrounded the two and exchanged glances. Four of them carried Claire while a bigger man grabbed Jacob by his two back legs and dragged them into a long, tall and deserted destroyed building.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: ...some natives.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
As Claire came to, she was in a make-shift metal cage, made from steel rebar and concrete. Two of the natives were having a conversation.

"She's going to pay dearly for what she did to my brother," one of them said.

"You must be crazy to try and take her on," the other said. "You saw how she wielded that weapon. It took two of our strongest men to carry that thing! And her armor is like nothing I've seen before." A third joined in the conversation.

"I don't know who or even what she is, but whatever happened to her must have been bad. Despite being able to walk away from that wreck, she was cut up real bad, and her hound is like nothing I've seen before," he said. "And besides, it was probably her first instinct to shoot first and ask questions later."

"Where am I?" Claire asked, a bit dizzy from the hit she took. She noticed her armor was gone, too, but she wasn't naked. A large man walked in.

"Here's that gun you wanted to see!" He exclaimed through dry heaves. "I don't know how she does it! That gun's really damn heavy!" It slipped out of his hand and landed with a loud thud.

"Is that laser rifle really that heavy?" Claire asked. "And when I get free, you're all going to die for exposing me like this."

"That's real funny, beautiful," the second one said. "What I find to be a real shame is you're going to be tortured until you're not even recognizable as... whatever you are."

"I'm a dark elf, you half-wit!" Claire exclaimed, angrily. "I didn't know what your intentions were, and I wasn't going to take any chances. Tell me, what was it you were running toward the crash site for?"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Claire/Jacob wake up

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
A man with a metal mask in the group walked toward Claire's cage and stood next to it. "Well we have a few reasons sweetheart. First off when something hurdles and tumbles out of the sky and lands, you have two options: 1. Run away. And 2. See what the hell that was. You can guess what we did.

"And?" Claire said, waiting to hear the second reason.

"And a man has been paying to see people like you and that dog of yours here and will pay for them in any condition. Now, with that in mind. You killed quite a few of our guys, so how about "An eye-for-an-eye"?

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: They tell her.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob opened his eyes as he laid on the stone-cold ground. He felt his front legs tied together and back legs tied together with a coil-like metal. Jacob saw two men talking when one glanced over and saw him. "Look. Mutt's waking up."

Jacob shook his head, incredibly dizzy. "Wh-what happened? Where's Claire?"

"Hm. That her name," the other said. "You girly friend is fine for now mutt. But you two are gonna have a rough time. You see after your ship crashed and we went to see it, your friend opened fired and killed a few of our best men. So, you two will pay."

Jacob was about to yell something went he felt something loosen from his neck and then something else tighten. He realized they removed his voice collar and put a rope around his neck. "What the hell man...Who in whatever world they came from thought it a good idea to let dog's speak?"

Jacob then realized they thought he was a dog to begin with, and the collar let him be understood. Jacob growled and bared his teeth as the a large man dragged him by his back legs, Jacob thrashing. However, Claire was going to the same place as Jacob.

A place with the words "KILLING FLOOR" smeared on a makeshift sign above a door that led into a dark room.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Jacob

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
When Jacob entered the Killing floor, he saw a rather large man continually punching Claire in the face with what looked like steel knuckles.

"This is supposed to hurt?" Claire asked. She then received a blow to the stomach causing her to cough up a small amount of blood.

"Insolent wench!" the torturer exclaimed. Next thing everyone knew, he was on fire, and screaming like a little girl. The others could have sworn they heard Jacob laughing.

"Alright, put him out, then we'll decide what to do with this dog!" Someone exclaimed.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Claire's torture

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
The man dragged Jacob to a wooden beam, fairly close to the ground, just a foot or three above the floor. The man took Jacob's front two paws and laid them on each other against the beam. Next thing Jacob knew, he felt a large nail drill into his paws as he let out a howl in pain as blood poured from his paws. The same happened with his hind paws as he hung from them.

Jacob's view was upside down, but he could make out the fact that a man with a whip with sharp objects strewn on it was walking toward him. The whip hit with such ferocity that fur and skin was being torn away and blood puddles onto the floor. Jacob couldn't see Claire a lot, but saw another man punching her.

Jacob turned to look when one of the jagged parts of the whip dug into his right eye, causing him to lose vision in it. Jacob let out a loud an pained howl as a few men cringed, clapped, gawked, or laughed. He just felt assault after assault until he felt like his body was gonna fall apart. This continued for what felt like an eternity.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Jacob's torture method.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"Your torture's over. Just be glad we decided to end it before you were done in!" A grunt exclaimed. Two large men picked up Claire and Jacob and tossed them both into a small cage, crafted from steel rebar and concrete.

"Might've been just me, but I thought I saw mechanical parts in that mutt's stomach where his guts should be."

"And what of the girl?"

"She's taken more punishment than any two men put together, and laughed in my face, before I somehow caught fire!"

"Interesting. A suit should be here within the next few minutes. I hope we didn't damage them too much."

In their cage, Claire noticed the damage Jacob had sustained. She saw that blood still dripped from his wounds, but the bleeding slowed from his wounds and eye.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Torture finishes

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob and Claire laid curled in the cage, beaten and bloody. Jacob laid against Claire's chest whimpering. Even though the body was artificial, the pain was real. Claire had a hand laying on Jacob's head.

Time passed when the door opened a three men entered. Claire looked over with what strength she had and Jacob turned his good eye toward them. Two men were native while the other wore a militaristic looking uniform. "This them," the man said in a low gruff voice.

"Just as you asked."

The man circled the cage and eyed them like merchandise. He then turned back and nodded. "Very well. Load them up."

Six men picked up the cage and carried them toward a large metal container. Jacob saw a native hand the man his voice collar. Good. At least he might have a chance of getting it back.

They were dumped from the cage into the container as the large doors closed behind them and the only light was a single slit in the roof. Jacob crawled to Claire and curled up next to her. Claire laid a reassuring hand on Jacob's muzzle as Jacob whimpered. They felt the container move as they were being transported.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: A suit walks in.

choices: "We need someone stopped and either captured or eliminated."
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Claire and Jacob were ushered out of the container and toward a large complex made of concrete. Once inside, they were turned over to a medical team, who patched them up enough to prevent too much blood loss. After which, Claire was given a simple white gown to cover herself with.

"What happened to this place?" Claire asked the medical personnel tending to her.

"No one really knows," the only man there said. "One day, everything's fine, and the next, it's all chaos with buildings falling apart. You guys came a couple years later, but until now, nobody's seen one of you up close." A man in a suit walked up and sat in a chair next to Claire's bed.

"I'm going to ask you a series of questions, and you are going to answer them truthfully and to the best of your knowledge. What is your name?" He asked.

"Claire Delgreind," she answered.

"What is your race?"

"Dark elf, or Dunmer."

"Why did you kill those mercenaries that were going to investigate that crash site?"

"It was instinct. I thought they were headed there to kill me and Jacob."

"Who's Jacob?"

"The wolf. But he wasn't always like that. He was once human."

"How did he end up with a mechanical wolf body?"

"I weakened him severely when I was entirely corrupted by evil. When they found he was too weak and fragile for any kind of work, they gave him that body."

"Do you regret what you did to him?"

"What kind of question is that? Of course I regret it. He's a good friend."

"We need your help with something. After you help us, your weapons and armor will be restored to you."

"Go on."
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: They arrive

choices: Claire reacts badly to the idea
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: We need the God Emperor eliminated" said the man bluntly " I know it's a tall task but he has conquered world after world since his rise to power"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: "We need someone stopped and either capture...

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: "I've fought him in the past," Claire said. "He's far too strong. I can't even kill him. Is that what happened here? He attacked your world? Destroyed your societies?"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Claire reacts badly to the idea

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Yes and no he plans to take over this world in a holy crusade" the man said "he'll make this part of his empire"
"Would that be so bad" said Claire suddenly...
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Yes.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"How many worlds have fallen so far?" Claire asked.

"A couple dozen. We need your help in stopping this maniac. He's responsible for the genocide of any lesser species. Now you tell me where honor lies in that. You take him out and help us get our world put back together, and we can guarantee a most generous reward by our standards. Do the same for the other races that have fled to our moon and onto our Earthen soil, and they will probably do the same. We, like them, are on the verge of extinction if we don't get help. So, please. If you would just forgive our kind for what a few did to you, help us," he pleaded.

"Sure," Claire sighed. "But without my weapons or armor, I'm no good to you people, and can you fix Jacob's eye?"

"Of course, Claire," he said. "But as far as your friend's vision goes, he may very well be permanently blind in one eye. We no longer have the tools to fix his vision. I'm sorry."
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Other

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Jacob awoke a little while later. A day had passed after he saw Claire and heard the plan about Eoin and his crusade. Jacob stood from his bed and stretched when the door opened, with Claire in the doorway. "You're awake. Come on, let's her ready."

"Right," Jacob replied. The men here had the tools to fix the collar and reattach it so he could answer their questions. Jacob looked at mirror and saw his face. A large, grisly scar crossed his right eye. Jacob ignored it as he jumped down and followed Claire. They entered as they each split up to different areas. Jacob entered a machine that scanned him, showing he was in working condition. He then walked forward to where another officer began strapping armor to him.

"How's your eye doing?" The man asked.

Jacob shrugged, "It's alright. Still getting use to it."

Jacob then continued to another station with a single computer. Claire walked beside him in her armor with her HI-Laser rifle on his back. The man handed Claire a pad of paper with stuff written down on it while he pulled a cord connected to the computer and put the other end behind Jacob's neck. The man proceeded to download orders into Jacob's HUD as the two then left the facility armed and hopefully ready.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Suiting up.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: The space marines, as Eoin had taken to calling his personal crusade force, landed in their shuttles in the forward camp already on the planet. Eoin stepped out of the shuttle and surveyed the camp. As normal the facilities were coming along nicely. He sighed and tried to use the teleport beacon in Jacobs new body to get them back but to no avail. He cursed at the fact that they had gone missing. He had sent out squads to find them but there was still no sign of them.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Deployment (Eoin's POV)

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
A group of soldiers entered the room from one side, and a high-ranking human officer from another.

"Sir!" One of them exclaimed, announcing his presence. "We've found a huge stock of weapons that have survived the crash of that shuttle. We have also found evidence of what could be internal sabotage. The weapons and ammo are right outside in a caravan of supply trucks, sir. We, along with the races of aliens we're allied with, are repairing our tanks away from the prying eyes of that Empire. They are also using whatever salvageable materials they can to repair their weapons. The only race that doesn't have any weapons of their own is helping us. Some of our spies have also brought back valuable intelligence on the enemy, as well as some weapons. One even managed to fake being a hover tank pilot and take off with one of their weapons without them even noticing. I guess those things are surprisingly easy to pilot. They must be quite arrogant. Our navy is still in decent shape. The USS Nimitz, USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, USS Iowa, and USS Missouri, and a dozen missile destroyers are all ready for combat, sir."

"We attack at the soonest available moment. We can't allow that Emperor to claim another planet. We don't have anywhere to run, so it's either fight back, or go extinct. I say that if we go extinct, we go extinct fighting," the officer said. "How many fighter jets and helicopters do we have?"

"We have full stock of F-35s on both aircraft carriers, and all of our F-22s are well hidden, sir. As I said before, the tanks are undergoing repairs, and should be completely finished within the hour," the soldier said. "But we don't have the ammo or the technology to compete with these guys."

"Do we still have nukes?" the officer asked.

"Well, yes, but to attack with those is unthinkable! It would render the planet completely useless--"

"If our race goes down, soldier, we're taking our planet with us! We will not leave anything useable for those Totalitarian bastards! Do I make myself clear?"

"Sir! Yes, sir!"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Back to Claire and Jacob

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
A soldier entered the room across from them and stood in front of the officer next to Jacob and Claire. "Sir, the Chimerans have arrived."

"Thank you soldier," the officer said as the man hurried off. The officer turned and faced Claire and Jacob. "The Chimerans migrated from another planet after Eoin tried to take it. That shows why some of the wildlife and the frozen side of the planet being their habitat. Then the door opened.

A fairly large figure with a body with two arms, two legs, and a head.

That's where similarities ended.

The being had four, slit-shaped glowing eyes and mouths lined with teeth. Their bodies seemed contorted and bony, and white as Skyrim snow. They wore suits with canisters on their backs with coils connecting to masks they wore on their mouths. The weapons were oddly shaped and had an eerie glow. The creature walked forward and stood in front of them. "These...they are the ones you told us about?" A deep sounding voice accompanied by a robotic tone.

The officer nodded, "Yes, this is Claire Delgreind and the wolf is Jacob."

The creature nodded his head toward them. "Good. If the reports of you two are true, we may have a chance. I wish to speak to you two later after I convene with your C.O." It soon walked by and left after being followed by a few others without masks.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Meeting the race representatives.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"Sir, the Amarans wish to speak with you," the same soldier said.

"Send them in," the officer said. The soldier left the room to fetch the Amaran representative. "The Amarans, too, migrated to this planet. They inhabit the rain forests, while we inhabit the forests."

A snake-like figure slithered into the room, accompanied by two Amaran troopers. While they had two arms, a head, and a torso resembling that of a human's they also had long claws at the end of each finger, and a flesh leaf on each their heads that reminded Claire of a desert snake she once encountered in Elsweyr. It looked like a woman.

"So, these two are the ones I've heard so much about. They don't look like much," the Amaran representative said, surprisingly without any hissing sounds.

"Don't be fooled so easily, Karana. Claire has achieved greatness many don't even get to taste," the officer said.

"True, I guess looks can be deceiving," Karana said. "And what's with the wolf?"

"That would be her friend, Jacob. We found out just recently that he was once human, and now you can see how he gets by," the officer said.

"Very well," Karana began. " I will be looking forward to this meeting. While you humans may not be as technologically advanced as those of us that have fled here, you show great courage, even if there looks to be no hope in sight. That is what makes you fearsome warriors to the end, and I respect you for that." She and her guards left for the meeting hall.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Another representative

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"Sir, the Dragoons have finally appeared," another man said.

"Alright. The Dragoons are...interesting. They just seem to go against Emperor and appear around the planet. We know they're here, just...not where."

Entering through was a bipedal machine with a single eye acting as a sensor on it's "head" as it glew. It's body was built off of armor chunks and wires. They walked forward autonomously and in unison, carrying high-tech looking weapons. "Unit Platform 0528: Null, reporting." The machine said in a toned, soulless voice.

"Thank you for coming Null." The man replied. The machine turned and looked at the two for sometime before saying.

"Delgreind, Claire. Last of House Seranaan. 2nd entity: Unknown." The machine said, almost curiously.

Claire then said, "This is Jacob. Your....um, scans, might not be working since that isn't his real body." The machine stood for a moment more.

"Affirmative," the machine. "The meeting begins soon?"

"Yes," the officer said. "Follow me."

They left down the hall, Jacob and Claire following behind them.

"An interesting time we live in now isn't it?" Jacob said to Claire.

"No kidding," Claire replied.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Yet another race.

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"Here we all have gathered on a back-water planet in a momentous occasion to represent our races and our allies. We have all failed to defeat this Emperor and his minions, and we are prepared to stand against this tyrant, even if the cost is extinction. Representative Kurnow, you may start," the human officer said in opening.

"We Chimerans were perhaps the first to face this threat," Kurnow began. "We so arrogantly believed we didn't need allies, but as the humans say, there's always a bigger fish."

"Apologies, Representative, but all memorandum aside, we are here to discuss how we are all to stand against this threat that we have all lost so miserably to," Karana said.

"Karana has a good point," Null said. "If we cannot come to an agreement, we risk losing the element of surprise, and as such, we go extinct without putting up a fight."

"Operation Last Stand, as we call it, is supposed to be, as its name implies, one final stand against these monsters. Luckily, we have someone who was on their side at one point, but has since changed her ways. Claire, I would like you to tell us everything you know about this Emperor," the human Representative said.

"Well," Claire began. "He has god-like power, first off, and before he achieved such power, he and I were equals. I crossed blades with him, and I lost. I can only hope that this time, things will be different."

"What happened to where he became so strong?" Karana asked, curious.

"I absorbed massive amounts of dark energy and became almost entirely corrupted. When I was done with that, I sapped Jacob of all his energy, then Eoin took almost all of my energy, and left us, I'm guessing to die in an underground structure of sorts. We were dug up almost two centuries later," Claire said.

"So," Karana began. "About this plan, human?"
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: The meeting

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Eoin strode through the camp as his space marines readied themselves. He had got a lock on Claire and Jacob and was going to save them. He had been informed that a hovertank had been stolen but this suited Eoin, the tanks all had trackers so now he could find the native base. 8 colloidal war machines called Titans stood ready. Each as taller than the white gold tower. Eoin had long since realised that he had made a foolish mistake by trapping Claire and Jacob and that's why he had them excavated. Eoin turned to his men and raised his blades. The entire crowd cheered in one voice "For the Emperor!"

The titans marched as Eoin's army rode on metacycles for his raptors and the rest rode in heavy Predator tanks. He had given the order that all savages were to be killed but rescueing Claire and Jacob was highest priority
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Meanwhile

choices: Barracks (Jacob and Claire before Invasion Day)
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"As you know, the city the target lies in is heavily guarded. Each of us have a position we need to take. Representative Null, if you will." The human officer said.

Null nodded as another Dragoon displayed a 3-D image of the city. "The human and Chimerans will launch a full-scale assault against the city. The Amarans will use their fleet to bombard the city from the waters. We will enter the city from the other side after the fighting had begun. Officer..."

The human officer nodded and looked over at Jacob and Claire. "You two have fought him before, so you will lead a small force to face him. The invasion will begin tomorrow. Get everything ready." The multiple races stood and began to converse for a moment before leaving again.

What happens next?
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Back to the plan

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content: Eoin stood on his favourite Titan "The Bane". He had used the sensors in Jacobs body to listen to the battle plans of the natives. He was outraged at the way they spoke of him, he brought order to the systems. But now they would pay. He had 2 kraken class titans deployed in the water. Any boats would be destroyed. His orbiting fleet was ready to bombard their units and teleport his me up if necisary. Eoin watched as the sun began to rise over the water and turned to his waiting army, and began his speech.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.title: Invasion Day (Eoin POV)

choices: The nuke goes off in orbit.
1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
"Sir!" A soldier exclaimed as he scrambled into the room. "Radar has detected massive vessels both in space and in the ocean! Their weapons would render this operation futile."

"You know what to do, soldier. Launch Operation Special Delivery. I've had our electrical systems specially equipped if we ever had to use it. Jacob, if you would please leave the room," the human officer said.

"Sir?" Jacob asked, confused.

"I am afraid to reveal any further details, for I fear the enemy may be using you to spy on us," the officer said. Jacob left the room. "I've had all electronics triple-plated with copper to prevent their electronics from being knocked out from the ensuing EMP." A rumble could be heard from outside, and it dissipated in seconds. "When that nuke explodes, anything not destroyed will have its electronics knocked out, if they aren't protected, and our intelligence states that very little of their technology is protected from an EMP, all of it being their giant, humanoid mechs. A very poor decision, if you ask me."

Claire and Jacob walked toward Eoin and his officer.

"I expected you to bring more of your little friends," Eoin said.

"I came alone, Eoin," Claire said.

"You're not going to try and fight me, are you? You're completely out-classed," Eoin began. "My super-soldiers were designed to match your skill, so they are effectively your children. Aren't you proud to have finally become a mother, Claire?"

"Not like this. You harvested my blood while I was out, and injected it into each of them, didn't you?" Claire asked.

"That is correct," Eoin said. "You can't possibly defeat an entire army at your skill level. And if you don't surrender, this rock will burn."

"Alright," Claire said. "I will turn myself in to you, on the condition that you leave this planet unharmed. These people did nothing to deserve extinction! Not any of the races that stood against you! The Chimerans, Amarans, humans, or the Dragoons. None deserve extinction, and the only reason they tried to nuke your fleet, and a spy blew up one of your ships was because they were defending what was rightfully theirs. You are the aggressor, not them. So, take me. Torture me, I don't care, so long as the races inhabiting this planet are not harmed."

"That's a good girl, Claire," Eoin said. Claire felt something smack her on the back of the head, and everything went dark. "Now, Jacob. Let's see about getting you patched up."

Claire stared blankly at the ceiling in her room, angry with herself and feeling she was to blame for the extinction of several races. A bell range for dinner, but she didn't move an inch. Her pain and sadness for the loss of multiple races overwhelmed her need for food.

"Hey!" A soldier exclaimed. "There's a victory party going on in the mess hall. You coming? Come on! It's all because of you that we were able to wipe out those inferior inbreds!"

"Get. Out," Claire growled. "Now."

"Come on, girl. Don't be so sour!" The soldier exclaimed joyfully. When Claire got up, he saw nothing but rage in her eyes. She grabbed his throat and started squeezing. She then picked him up off the ground.

"The next time I tell you to do something, you'd better damn well do what I say when I say!" She exclaimed, furious. "Got it!?" She tossed him aside like a rag doll and slammed the door to her quarters.

"Hey there Claire," Jacob said trying to smile.

Claire knelt by him and pulled him into the room and laid him against the wall. "Jacob?! Y-your body!"

Jacob looked over and smiled, "Yeah, they said it was weak since it was changing. They said it's stronger now for some reason. I'm still fumbling around after being in that Wolf platform for awhile, which I might need to use again if we travel or fight until this body is up to it."

Claire nodded and laid against the wall next to him before she put her head on his shoulder. "They killed them...all of them...."

Jacob nodded and placed a hand in Claire's hair. "I know...I know..."

The guard pushed the door opened as Claire and Jacob saw a few men looking at a 3-D display of what looked like Skyrim. "Falkreath and here are prone to attacks if that Republic decides to strike here." One man alerted the others, wearing a regal looking uniform.

"What of Markarth and Solitude," another asked wearing a cloak covering most of his clothes.

"Hammerfell is that way. They'll be able to protect any attempt of attack that way," said a man wearing a white robe. The guard then stood and stopped, "Sir."

The man in the regal uniform turned, "What is it? Can't you see...I'm..." The man stopped when he caught sight of the two, the other men looking just as surprised. "Claire Delgreind? Descendant of House Seranaan?"

1551111212111121221111112121111111211111.content:
Claire and Jacob both woke up to the sound of an alarm, and soldiers scrambling to get to the armory.

"Red Alert!" A voice rang out over the speakers. "Imperial troops are marching on Skyrim! Mobilize all units!"

Claire quickly equipped her armor, grabbed her weapons, and hurried outside, where she saw nimble hover tanks that resembled the Imperial's Mk. II, and heavily-armed and armored heavy tanks. Massive air ships took flight, and soldiers were running every which way, trying to figure out where they were supposed to go. Fighters screamed across the sky.

"Sir, Morrowind has offered their assistance. Should we accept?" A soldier asked Governor Everette.

"Yes," he said. "We're going to need all the bloody help we can get."

"Right away, sir."

"Sir," Claire began. "Just who will be coming from Morrowind?"

"An armada of Special Forces units from each house, the most dangerous being from your Great House. Even Eoin's army fears them," he said.


------


The Armada arrived from Morrowind, just as promised. Air ships and fighters flew into formation with the Skyrim ones. A soldier walked up to Governor Everette.

"Sir," he began. "We think it would be prudent to get you to a safe location. Hammerfell, High Rock, Elsweyr, and Black Marsh have already mobilized their forces to combat this hollow Empire. Hm?" He took notice of Claire. "Why, if it isn't the good lady herself! If there is anything I can get you, just let me know."

"How about a gun for Jacob?" Claire asked. "He's in his wolf form for now, and I was wondering if you guys had any weapons you could attach to him?"

He realized his head laid on Claire's lap as she sat by the tomb and laid a hand on Jacob's muzzle. "Claire, what happened?" Jacob asked through the speaker on his throat.

155231.content: It was a great day in Whiterun. After having left the barracks with a belly full of mead, you proceed to the outdoor market. You look over the stands of food, thinking about getting something for dinner, when a tall man in Ebony armor accompanied by a group of Imperial soldiers rush down the road, towards the entrance of the town. Filled with curiosity, you follow them. The group heads outside. The sentries in the watchtowers look to be alarmed. You follow the band of men towards the stables, where a pool of men have gathered, putting up wooden barricades. Captains bark orders, yelling out positions, and whether if "they" are getting any closer. In response, an arrow flies towards his head, finding it's target, sending the ill-fated man off his horse. A large horde of bandits appear, all in a sprint, some stopping to let arrows fly. The bowmen behind you fire a volley of arrows at the mass, striking them down with efficiency. You stand there gawking. You can't believe how bandits could form such a force without killing each other, nor have the audacity to attack this place. The man in the Ebony armor shakes you, "Quit standing there like a fool, and ready yourself!" You look back at the incoming army, and tense up. 'This is it. I'm finally going to get some action." And action you shall have. You are standing in the front of the defending force. One last volley of arrows flies. More bandits are slain. They are just a few feet away. You unsheathe your sword, making an arcing motion as you do, your blade meeting the flesh of the enemy's neck. He falls into you. You grab him and steady yourself as the next man plunges his dagger into your meat shield. You throw the body away, grab the now defenseless man by the collar, and stick your sword through his chest, bring it back out, raise your arm, and bring the gored blade down the the next man's head. His eye that still functions rolls back in his head, as you have cleaved through his head to the other eye. You drop the sword, not taking the time to pull it out, and take another weapon, bracing for another attack.
155231.title: A town guard (Who may have gotten an arrow in t...

1552311.content:
Men on horseback appear on the battlefield. They wear a unfamiliar black armor. Same as their weapons. They kill with grace and efficiency. The bandits seem to be fodder, to spend the defenders forces and energy. You spot the man that seems to be leading them. Then, you remember that helmet the he's wearing. It's picture takes you back, into the past you strongly remember. You see your family's faces, then their hands rolling, severed by that very man's blade. More pictures flash by, but you snap back to reality. (ATTENTION: The entire next paragraph is back story stuff, not even about the current event. If you would rather continue the battle, skip the next paragraph.)

You know this man and the atrocities he and his followers have committed. He's the very reason why you've spent training ever since the fateful day of the murders of your family, and the rest of the village. He's the reason why you've became a killer of evil men, although not a hero, disregarding justice to achieve it. You became a blood-lusting vigilante. When you realize you've become a monster, throwing away lives of innocents, just for fun, you isolate yourself, trying to regain your humanity. You finally gain your sanity back, and become a guard, after vowing to never again become what was the evil that you sought to destroy, and to protect the lives of the innocent. But that didn't mean that you would forget about that man. That of which he caused. The chain of events that place you where you are now.


You well up in anger. walking towards the man, then break into a flat out run, blind with rage. A bandit steps into your path, and raises his dagger, holding it upside-down. You catch is arm and drive his very own weapon into his stomach. You push him on as you run, A bandit clotheslines you, and brings down a battleaxe, barely missing your head. You kick him in the stomach, jump up, take his relinquished weapon, and swing horizontally, chopping into his side. He screams as the axe is then removed, and driven into his neck. You turn around to see the man you remember not even two feet away, holding a Imperial soldier by the collar. You know what he's doing. Eating the man's soul. "YOU BASTARD!" you bellow with rage. He looks at you, drops the man, dismounts his horse, and stares at you. Then time stands still. All but you, and the man and his followers. The man sheathes his war-axes, and begins to draw a massive claymore, when one of his followers walks forward, and says in a deep, foreboding voice, "I'll handle this." He comes forward, sword in hand. You glare at him. He rushes at you. You try to sidestep his charge, but he moves like a blur, tackling you. He is on top of you, and is about to plunge is blade into your heart, when you take one of his daggers, and shove it into his right shoulder. He is taken aback by this, as his victims are clueless and dazed at this point. You push him off and pick up a weapon off the ground. You swing at your assailant, and as the weapons meets his armor, the iron shatters, but leaving a dent into his armor. You then wrench his blade from his hand, as he is still vulnerable. You then take a mighty swing, and his hands claw at where his head was seconds before. The men in strange armor are surprised and appalled. But not the leader. He shows no movement, not a flinch. He then walks to you. You try to raise the weapon, but you can't move your arms. He stops in front of you. He looks at the sword in your hand, and you drop it. You then bow on your knees, and remove your helmet, all against your will. You look up at him. He steps back. Your marred face he remembers. He remembers his hounds maiming you as a child, and the execution of your family before your eyes. "You..." his raspy whisper of a voice says. "Yes, me." you seethe. "I thought you had learned your lesson," he spoke in the voice of a boy, "that you shan't attempt to defy my will. (spoken with the voice of a woman)" "Your will is damnation, death, and destruction." you speak angrily. He spoke this time in what seemed to be a thousand voices. "My will is law. It is order. It is what is going to save this world." "You will save nothing. You will only annihilate, enslave, and devour. You are not a savior, but a great evil. A monster. A disgusting abscess. Your name shall be remembered with hatred." " Hmm...I was expecting one of your long-winded speeches about how you will be rid of me." He chuckles, but pauses. "You say that I shall be remembered with hatred, meaning you think you can kill me? I think not. I think you will be hated. For opposing the the cure for the disease that everyone carries. And for that, you shall join the others who had not followed me. Those who had not accepted their new god." He draws his blade, and runs you through. You taste blood. You feel pain. This is what you expected to happen. This is what you wanted. He begins to feed on your dying soul. Your vision fades...
1552311.title: You see strange men appear on horseback enter t...

15523111.content: The stench of the dead hangs over the field. Your limpless body lies on the ground. It begins to twitch. The eyes open. The monster has awakened.
15523111.title: You awake.

Of course, I will leave the other choice for anyone who wants to write Lydias story or whatever.

1552321.title: More Dragonborn character slots

info.brief_description: Bring your Skyrim character to life in this interactive story!
info.description:
This is something I've had on my mind for awhile. This is meant to "tell the story" of your Skyrim character, but with a twist. Instead of just focusing on your character, other writer's/people's characters can jump into the story and interact with each other. I have only three rules for this:

1. Don't be controlling over a story or end it abruptly. Let it play out into a new one or allow another writer to take a turn in it.
2. Keep the stuff in this from Skyrim and it's DLCs.
3. Have fun!
